description:
I go to three places after work for a drink, Steff's, Pink Elephant and John Collins. All have their own specialities. 

John Collins is my favorite...but also holy crap expensive. You get what you pay for though that's for sure. 

Been several times and never had bad service. Knew when to check in and when to let us talk. had good recommendations and more than once had a drink on the house since we come pretty often. To know your regulars is a big plus. Beer selection is super fresh and fantastic sushi available as well. 

Be aware that there are DJ nights and it can get super loud, I prefer to go on the earlier side close to when they open though.
author: Jason P.

description:
Good place for a happy hour. Music was a bit too loud but I'm sure that becomes less of a concern the longer you stay ;) I particularly liked their Highball which was nice and refreshing for summer and I don't even like whiskey/bourbon. They also made my gin martini quite well and that's my rite of passage for a bar.

Verdict: I'd go back but would stay too long
author: Neechi M.

description:
Sooo let's be straight here the bartender Jason is a drunk who serves drinks on the weekday and likes to be snarky. 

I saw him serve himself drinks twice, he poured our party 2 shots but poured 3 so one was for him. I guess JC supports alcoholics. I think he was a bit rude but I totally get it, a drunk is serving us. I usually come here with my friends on a Saturday night where it's more lively. 

John Collins, check on your employees though.
author: Kim L.

description:
John Colins has become a little bit of a "go to" spot for work happy hours. It is in a good location as far as working in the FiDi/SoMa gray area. 

They have a good selection of beer and definitely have a fun menu of their standard cocktails and seasonal cocktails. I almost always get the paloma because they put a twist on it and make it a little spicy. Their happy hour menu is pretty legit as well, you can get a decent cocktail for like $5. Also, this is a good spot for your co-workers that are always hungry after work since they have a sushi bar in house. The sushi place is open for lunch as well, just a note. 

The bar has a beachy theme and I feel like they are always playing videos of surfing or waves when I am there. Overall, a pretty good happy hour place. It can get super busy though after work hours and then sometimes will take a little bit to get a drink.
author: Stephanie A.

description: Ok drinks, great happy hour, wonderful service. They have a Japanese restaurant upstairs but you can order from their menu downstairs. Good music and ok bathrooms.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
Alright, I have been to this place a few times.  What I love about it is that they have a separate dance floor section, lounge areas and bar with stools and space to stand. It gives you the option of what kind of environment you want to be in. 

Their drinks are consistently tasty and to my surprise so was their sushi! Ordered sushi for the first time there and I was delightfully surprised by the presentation and flavor. However, they provide the worst chopsticks I have ever used! 

The bar is well staffed so drinks orders are taken and served relatively quickly. 

The music can be too loud at times. I do wish their kitchen stayed open later, it closed on a Friday at 9:30.
author: Kayla B.

description: Recommended to come here by one of our local friends. They played good music, drinks were $14-$16 each made reallly strong lol. There is street parking. Girls have to also pay cover. Dress casual, no need to dress up. Alsoooo compared to Vegas, bartenders are SLOW.
author: Tiara P.

description:
Came with a friend to try the sushi place (Takoba), but because the sushi seating was very limited, we sat at the bar and ordered sushi there instead. 

For a bar setting, it is pretty nice. Quite spacious, but I can envision it being filled up on a busier weeknight or on the weekends. We came on a weds night and it was pretty empty, which I was totally fine with. The happy hour drinks weren't that much cheaper than a normal drink, but the drink selection was pretty good. 

Service-wise, it wasn't apparent there was service. We walked in and we wandered around the bar's lounge and didn't realize that the sushi location was actually upstairs. Reaching the sushi location, we were even more surprised at the mannerism where we were looked at disdainfully. Not sure why, but it definitely didn't feel welcoming. We then sat at the bar and the service was as one would expect from sitting at a bar seat. Although, it was definitely apparent the bartenders did provide different service depending on who you are or how you look. Being two young adults, we received less service than those of an older crowd.

Overall, for a bar situation, it was pretty average and nothing that praiseworthy. I did like what I ordered, but I can probably get it elsewhere too with a different scenario or situation.
author: Alex W.

description:
3.5 stars

It's not overly crowded or obnoxious on a Saturday night. They have separate rooms for dancing and ordering drinks, which is always a plus. The drinks were pretty standard - the bartender seemed forgetful but friendly enough. The DJ played hip-pop throughout the night and got most people in their grove. 

I think if you want an easy going but fun night, this place isn't a bad option. At least it has good ventilation unlike other bars/lounges in SF. There's also a hot dog stand outside at late hours! Yum!
author: Chariya S.

description: Quick shout out to Hotel Via for the suggestion of this place! The wifey and I decided to take a stroll in the neighborhood and find some cool spots to have a drink and one of the front desk peeps suggested this place! As soon as we walked in, we walked up to the bar and were immediately greeted and asked what we'd like to have. Since I'm an old fashioned type of gal, I ordered this while my wife ordered a ginger beer, whiskey spritz kind of drink. Both were exceptional- cause we ordered two each! Loved the water attention from one of the bartenders- good to be reminded to hydrate when drinking.
author: Vanessa O.

description:
Fantastic joint that strongly reminded me of Raven Bar. Small dance floor, spacious bar but not too big you lose your friends, and great music.

I normally never go into the Financial District to bar hop, but came here for a friend's birthday. I really liked the drinks menu and loved that the bar was long, with lots of room for people to order. There weren't a lot of people on the dance floor, which was kind of nice, but it also just seemed empty. It became more popping around 11 pm.  

Note: I hadn't eaten since 1 pm and arrived at John Colins at 9:30 pm. At that point, I was starving. I bet my stomach was starting to eat itself, which I think is a myth I read online but still. I remember asking the bartender if they sold food, which he said they didn't. But he said wait here, which I did and he brought out a plate of chex mix. Like what!! My mind was blown. Such a nice bartender guy. Here I was, tipsy and begging for food at the bar and instead of being annoyed, he saved my life. And then when my friend and I came stumbling back to the bar, without uttering one word, he started pouring us water. Even put a little flower and cucumber in there to jazz up the water. I was like.."how did you know?" And he said "I've worked here for more than 10 years..I know when people need water." I was like :OOO

Bartender, you da real MVP. That's what I call great service and bartending.
author: Emily F.

description: I didn't even know this place existed but I'm glad I popped in. It is super fun and the bar tenders were really friendly. I ordered two margaritas and they made them perfectly. The ambience is nice and not cramped which was a huge plus. The crowd was chill and fun as well. I am for sure coming back to this place since it's one block away from Work. Highly recommend it
author: David P.

description: Love this place. One it's downstairs from work and they have a decent happy hour. Two they have Takoba Sushi which sounds weird with drinks but if you love sushi then anything's good with it. Three super friendly staff met 2 of their bartenders who were so chill & the girl (sorry love cannot remember your name) made my Paloma with a delicious Tequila she recommended. The guy from Ireland also very nice and recommended great whiskey for my friend. They didn't have a large IPA selection which is her favorite but we had a great time here.
author: Talissa C.

description:
What a fun lounge! Perfect spot for when you want to have fun with a group of friends or that special someone without going to the overcrowded crowds you find at certain clubs and bars in the city.

Three spots for you to hang: first, the bar to the left for when you're buying that girl you've been eyeing her drink. Second, the dance floor to the right because you are both liquored up and want to get down to some super fun music. And finally, the lounge in the back to get to know the person because they're wifey/hubby material.

There's also a Warriors menu to the left of the bar which you might want to check out. I'd like to think that the Warriors won because I got something from there ;)
author: Cathy C.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed myself here. We were a bit confused upon entry because the real reason we came was for the sushi. We went to left, up the stairs and found a waitlist and tiny cute spot. It seemed to be awhile and I remembered that you could order downstairs in the bar! Score! I just found two seats and it's happy hour...say what? The sushi is a bit pricey, but it was good and tiny bit different which was nice. We'll definitely be back. Paired our meal with Scrimshaw Pilsner's for $5 each. Not too shabby!
author: Guisela L.

description: Good place to hang out with friends after work. This place is located in a kind of dirty street and easy to miss. But once you step in, this place would be perfect hang out place. Instead of TVs you will find projectors here. Their cocktail happy hour menu doesn't have Huge collection.
author: Sri Y.

description:
This is an old seedy bar great for watching sports, having a good conversation with a bartender, and having some very fine sushi. The locals here are cool and the prices are A-OK for one of the priciest cities on earth.

Definitely a fun bar, in a town of overpriced bars. This is a one time review and so I don't want to go too deep on this one.
author: Frank O.

description: John Collins has a great atmosphere, good cocktails and excellent sushi. The John Collins roll is amazing! And we love Chae, the tall cocktail server.
author: Philip S.

description:
Ran across this spot while desperately looking for someplace to watch the Warriors, and the GIANT TV screen drew me in. Great ambiance. The bar is nice and long, and the stools comfortable. The liquor selection looks like if BevMo opened a bar! Only thing missing was a stout beer, for some reason, but Jack was available so keep that star. Who would've thought a bar named "John Colins" would only serve sushi? Minus one star. A sandwich selection could get we sushi-challenged types to spend more. I'll probably be back, but will have to grab food before going. 

The bartenders were very efficient and attentive.
author: Tony B.

description:
Amazing experience here on a Monday night. We skipped our reservation in line upstairs and had sushi at our little spot in the bar.

Both bartenders were rad and kept checking in -- offered up free goldfish and pretzels, two of my favorite snacks!!

The sushi is outstanding and so is the atmosphere here. Thank you especially to the two taking care of us, we will definitely be back.

Hidden gem, awesome place and NICE people for a change!!
author: Molli W.

description: John Colins has the feeling of a great neighborhood dive bar. It's tucked away down an alley. It's easy to miss if you walk past the sandwich board which is typically filled with clever advertisements. In the morning they are home to a great local coffeeshop. At lunch and dinner they offer fantastic sushi upstairs. In the evenings you can drop in for cocktails. I have never been when it is overly crowded. The prices are reasonable, especially for being in the heart of downtown. John Colins is one of those places you can stop in and feel like you are a local, even if it's your first visit.
author: John W.

description:
Celebrated my sister's birthday here and it was the best experience I ever had with bottle service. MADISON!!!!!! Madison is the best!!! So helpful before I had to ask for anything she was already coming with it!!!!

My sister keeps talking about how much fun she had and I want to thank Madison for that. I cannot stop raving about her to everyone. If you want a decently priced night out with bottles come here and ask for Madison.

We will be back!!!
author: Gee M.

description:
What a great little bar, tucked away on a side street in such a wonderful part of town. It is so close to our office, I can't believe how many times I'd wandered past it between work and the hotel. 

I swear - this is the difference between small and big cities. I live in OKC, and I love it there. But in OKC, this would be one of the best bars. In SF, it's a great bar: it's well-thought out, inviting, warm, fun. Just loud enough, just enough character, kind of a Tommy Bahama thing happening just a little bit,  but not kitschy. The drinks were perfectly prepared - with a quickness - and not overly expensive. The crowd was post-work, congenial, and handsome. 

So, in SF, that means you get to stay in business (hopefully). But in OKC, we still don't have anything exactly like this. If this were to be magically teleported to my city, it would be one of the best bars in town.
author: Julie S.

description: Strong cocktails! Not overly crowded and overall a lively (but not rachet) crowd. Decent amount of seating and big open dance floor in the middle! And also a decent sushi restaurant upstairs for noms.
author: Emily C.

description: This review makes me feel officially old. The cocktail was good, as far as the drinks go, everyone was really happy with theirs. But at 5:20 on a Thursday, it took a while to find any seating, and the music was so loud, I literally had to shout to be heard by the two women in my party and I feel like I only caught every other word they were saying. I think maybe if I had been prepared for a dancing kind of night instead of just grabbing a drink right after work, I would've liked it more. Now I know for the future!
author: Ashley S.

description: Headed over here after Tequila Mockingbird (#3 bar stop). And we must have saved the best for last. Atmosphere here was pretty hyped. Friday night had a cover, but we somehow got in. Dance floor in the front area where the DJ is, but if that isn't your thing, you can just chill by the long bar. They had a VIP section with the projection, but no one was there so we kinda just slipped in there, too. Bathrooms aren't horrible. My cousin and I were amused by this woman that brought a dog in her purse. Crowd was mixed, both young and old. Music wasn't horrible, but the transitions between songs were a little rough. But not bad for a good time out.
author: Anjelica C.

description:
I'd walked in here years ago on a weekend and thought "omg so loud, so ratchet" and walked right back out. I've been back a couple times this year on weeknights and had a lovely time. I am definitely getting old.

Our bartender was cool, made some good recommendations, and we all enjoyed our drinks. We could order sushi from Takoba (the sushi bar upstairs) and sit in the lounge area, hear each other talk (!!!) what a treat.

Definitely bonus for being able to order sushi.
author: Vivian H.

description: Great tip by Nick who suggested the Venus Gin from Santa Cruz!  Great gin derived from lots of good ingredients.  Check it out!
author: Marshall C.

description:
There's a group of us that go to Dada Bar every week. On the one week we thought Dada Bar was closed, we gave John Colins a try. I had been there before briefly and seen the variety of spaces that exist. There is a space that can easily be used for private events off to the side. There are a few barstool areas. And there are some cozier seats with tables in the back. It's also a sushi place too, apparently.

Our experience here was alright. Nothing special. The music was rather loud. I like that there are staff members that visit each table to serve patrons, rather than relying on them to order their drinks at the bar. I like that John Colins is open late and offers a variety of cocktails and food options. Not my favorite bar in the world, but I would be down to come here again if someone suggested it, or if there was an event happening!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Been here a few times now. The location is good and easy to get to. The place is kind of funky, and the drinks are quite good. Pricing is inline with the area. They have a cool sushi spot upstairs I have been to as well. The sushi place serves drinks from the bar too!
author: Jonah K.

description:
When you want to turn up after a long day of work in San Francisco.. John Colins is ya boy. 

Nah, not really, it's just a wonderful bar with a great selection of cocktails. 

My friends and I met up here to grab some drinks on a Thursday night (let's face it, by the end of the week, you need multiple drinks). They have creatively crafted cocktails ranging from rum, vodka, scotch, whiskey, etc. The bartenders are also very helpful in making suggestions on which drink to get. I asked for a not-too-sweet scotch concoction, and he suggested one (forgot what it was called). 

We then were able to go upstairs to eat some sushi (yes wow, crafted cocktails and sushi are my two favorite things). Apparently their sushi bar is called Takoba, and it's actually NOT BAD. 

We'll defintely return to try more cocktails and drunk munchies.
author: Grace H.

description: For old people like myself who don't frequent bars normally and only do so on rare occasions, this place was perfect. I wanted to feel young again. When I say that, I'm talking about music, dancing and getting a bit tipsy. Dancing to the music of my day-- 90's and 2000s, brings back nostalgia of my singlehood-before wifehood and motherhood. I'm painting a picture that makes me seem like a grandma with a shawl in my rocking chair, but seriously guys, I really don't frequent places like this anymore and it's nice to dip my toes in the pool every once in a while. After my husband and I sat at the bar drinking, we got up to dance and I saw how horny everyone was on the dance floor. Was it me in my old age or is that just how 20 year olds dance these days? Was I that horny on the dance floor when I was that age and I just forgot or is it because I'm older and not that drunk that I can see how disgusting it is to watch too much PDA??  Anyways, it was cool for the show but I remembered real quick how annoyed I get when people can't handle their liquor and constantly bump into me while getting their grind on. So I did my thing and then I was out-- ready to return to my children and messy house... and I was actually looking forward to it!
author: Sharon B.

description: Great place to grab a happy hour rosè. Bartenders are always super friendly and it has a large space to hang out. Definitely, a great spot to meet up with friends or coworkers (or both!).
author: Nikki M.

description:
The atmosphere is pretty chill, but the drinks are just average.  

The night I went, there was a DJ there and playing hip-hop.  That was the reason to stay.  The crowd is really relaxed and people were willing to dance.  There's the main area to dance with the DJ.  However, next to the reserved area on the inside, you can find some space to dance as well.  I liked the big screen with the scenery changes, that was pretty cool.  

Overall their drinks were pretty sweet.  I would've liked it if their drins were more spirit forward.  

It is a 3 star mainly b/c of the chill crowd and the atmosphere.  Or else I would've rated it lower.
author: Shirley C.

description: Great music at this place downtown, they also have great drinks. I had both sake drinks and they were great! Even the fernet drink I had I could stand though I hate fernet. The bar is spacious so you don't feel like you are all over each other. My friend and I had a fantastic time, and were able to mix in mingling with dancing in their dance room. We will definitely be back!
author: jenica b.

description: I have been going to this bar for years. Back in the day I use to work right across the street. A lot of memories here, some more hazy than others. Drinks are pretty standard. I definitely feel like their classic drinks could be stronger. I appreciate the surfing scenes on the projector.
author: Cynthia G.

description: I've been here many times. But today was the first time I was here that a bar tender ignored me to help a group of girls. Even tho I'm a gay guy with a group of girls but he skipped over me to help a complete group of girls. Idk if he thought they were here before me but it was rude and I felt disrespected.
author: Martin G.

description: Came here with a friend after work on a Thursday and was decently busy.  Nick was our bartender and he was great and the music was a nice touch as well with a bit old school R&B mixed in with some new jams.  Cool spot to come and enjoy a nice kick back vibe.  The projectors showing the beach was kind of cheesy at first but I really grew on me.  The drinks were priced right too as being in soma some places charge way too much for a cocktail.  Will be back and highly recommend.
author: Michelle E.

description:
Stopped by John Colins yesterday during a spur the moment trip to SF and I couldn't remember the side street and main street it was off of. This location has excellent happy hour drinks, a great vibe, and is tucked away from downtown but still walking distance from Market St. 

Best way to give directions would be that you walk down the Minna St. before you're at SF Moma when you're walking down 3rd St.

Favorite Drinks: Try the daily specials. $1 off during happy hour. Ends at 7pm. 

Great vibe and has TV's playing the games but it doesn't feel like a sports bar or a hipster bar. Eclectic mix of people and usually a DJ's onsite. Definitely worth checking out.
author: Heather J.

description:
I recently went to John Collins for a friend's birthday and realized it had been years since I really spent time there. The drinks were reasonably priced and strong! Although my Moscow Mule was not served in a copper mug, it was delivered in a large mason jar, which was a nice touch.

There's was a $5 cover on Saturday evening, which wasn't bad at all. There was also a small dance floor to the right when I entered and the music was to my liking.
author: Yi Z.

description:
chill crowd, nice and affordable drinks, and a good amount of hype going on on a weekend night! Then again we left around 1 so I guess ratchet times did not start yet. Love the random-ass Hawaii stock photo projected on the back wall!

I want to be back to try out Takoba for their sushi! Heard it's booked out weeks in advance, so I'll be back!
author: Ivy W.

description: Great service! The bartenders are super friendly and really attentive. They make an effort to get to know you and don't look pissed off to be there like at some other places. The drinks are very tasty I had a Sweet Lelani (sp?) and it was delicious. Definitely sweet but very good. Plus you can get awesome sushi from upstairs. It's a win in my book!
author: Melanie L.

description: I like atmosphere in this bar especially photos on the walls. Nice music background it perfectly makes my mood. Beer is really good here! Just ask a barmen to recommend you one and you wont regret!
author: Nikolai B.

description:
This is a great bar for coming for a drink after work. They have happy hour ($1 off till 7pm I think) and a good selection of drinks. They have different beer on taps, not sure how often they change them. I am not a fun of their ginger beer, it is too sweet and not gingery.

We came here on a Wednesday night 5pm and it was pretty quite. It can get really crowded and loud especially on Fridays.
I never tried their food (sushi).
author: Michèle S.

description: Nice bar was very busy. I don't recommend coming here if you like good drinks   I tried 4 drinks which were on the drink menu and they weren't good. My friend had one it had saki in it was good. One out of 5 isn't worth returning.  The sushi upstairs was bomb though
author: Tony C.

description:
I always go here because one of my best friends always insists that we always start our nights here. And I don't mean any offense when i say this, the crowd is usually no younger than 25 and on average people in their 30s and some of the songs are for a more older generation--also depends on the night and it's still good music!!! I usually love coming here as they have affordable drinks and I love the chill and mature crowd! No one too crazy trying to get turnt and there are private bathrooms to yack in if people do get turnt. 

Tucked in an alleyway, John Collins is a perfect weekend night out with friends and id highly suggest getting their signature John Collins or Moscow mule (cute mason jar cups)! Those will definitely live up to the turn up!!!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: After work this place is a pretty chill bar (music isn't loud). Crowd on weekdays: young professionals probably chillin with coworkers. You can order sushi from the sushi restaurant upstairs and eat here (I prefer to eat at John Colins instead of the sushi restaurant because it's too small upstairs so there's often a wait). I don't know when the DJ comes, but when there is one, the bumpin music does get loud. Good place to start your nice or to meet up with friends for happy hour after work!
author: Annie S.

description:
I like this bar! It's cozy, solid cocktails, great HH spot if you work in the Financial District or SOMA, and there's a little dance floor so you can definitely get your groove on later in the evenings when they have a DJ and music playing. You do need to fight to get to the bar and order a drink when it gets crowded (but when isn't that the case?). 

OH! And they just added a great sushi bar on top of this place called Takoba. So you can get your sushi fix before or during your night out here.
author: Yvette L.

description:
Came here with some work friends for a quick happy hour and I think this is a perfect spot for that kind of gathering. I liked the ambiance, with lots of people standing up and chatting away, and the fact you can open a tab (or at least our group seemed to be allowed to do so). I did not, however, like my Cosmopolitan, which was probably one of the worst I have had (and I have had way too many for this lifetime) so I would say skip that one! 

The next drink, however, was pretty good but I am very sad to inform I cannot remember its name - but I do know it was named after an Asian country/region. It was very fruity and well-executed, so I guess going with the house's cocktails is a better choice than just picking a classic. Prices seemed on the high end for me, but it appears that's just the San Francisco standard for cocktail bars.

Overall, a good choice for a casual but stylish post-work drink.
author: Gabriele J.

description:
I was here only for the drinks on the ground floor. Cozy little area, located right in fidi, so a great quick and easy stop for people in the area right after work. 

Mezcalito. Tastes awful - unless you really really like dry vermouth and a drink that tastes like the bartender just messed up. But the other drinks are strong and good! Not much special about it though - just decent and not very original drinks served in a pretty nice atmosphere.
author: Grace P.

description: A five star rating was easy to give John Colin's. I watched game 4 of the NBA finals here with a group of friends and we were so impressed with the service we received. Shout out to Jamil for seating us at a prime spot. We had s group of 7 and he really went out of his way to accommodate us. We were so happy sitting right on the couches facing the game that was projected on the entire wall in front of us! Jamil also makes amazing drinks!Definitely recommend the Bali Hai Tai! Chea (pronounced Shay) was our waitress and she couldn't have been better. She checked in frequently and offered great recommendations on the sushi menu.
author: Leslie W.

description: This is my new favorite hh spot. Yay!  I really like the vibe of the place.  The specialty drinks are all good and the prices are NOT outrageous.  Their use of gins, bourbons, and juices, etc. mmmm, so good.  AND their wine pours...ooh soo generous! Yes! Bartenders are super nice and patient.
author: Tracie P.

description:
Amazing Sushi you can order right from your table if the wait time for the restaurants upstairs is long. 
Fell in love with sushi definitely coming back
author: Saloni J.

description:
Decent place for drinks, but don't expect much for the dance floor. I only been here a few times, but of those times it got pretty crowded. I used to come here because this is one of the few places that still plays hip hop, but I just came here again recently and it just sucked. I don't know who the dj was, but he kept changing the music with no transitions whatsoever and only played about 30 seconds or less of each song. 
Maybe I'm just getting too old to appreciate these kinds of things, but John Collins is definitely not my go to place to get my groove on.
author: Renee Y.

description: Came here last Friday and had a blast after work.  Nice up beat vibe with great HH specials.  Prices are already low and with the HH discount you can't go wrong.  Music might be a bit loud for some folks but I think that's what sets the vibe for a after work, it's the weekend drink atmosphere.  Will be back very soon!
author: Jon L.

description:
Drinks are good..Bartender are nice and do their jobs well...

Can't complain. Definitely will come back for some Happy Hour mingle...

Open at 5pm right. Gotcha!
author: Carla F.

description:
Second time I've been here and really liked it. A little slow on the service. One guy with long curly hair was working really hard and trying to move quickly to serve a many people as he could. Another taller bartender was flirting with a chick on the corner, taking shots, and making everyone wait. Lame.

The place had good music and was a nice little spot to grab drinks and shmooze with people. Easy place to do that. It can get pretty crowded though.

I came here a couple months ago on a Friday night for one of my girl's Bday celebrations. That time the tables had been over out so there was a nice square shaped dance floor. THAT night was an absolute blast.

They also serve complimentary goldfish and pretzel. That is a real saver for the heavy drinkers!
author: Morgan F.

description:
THE WORST. I cannot believe this place. 
We came here to eat (tonight - random Monday - EMPTY) and were put at a bench I thought was for us while we waited, given that it was a singular half-foot wide bench (the bench was our table - not our seating). We order at 7:50 PM and - I kid you not - get our food at 9:10 PM. Mind you, we (the entire THREE people in our whole group) ordered a singular roll each - that's it. 
So almost an hour and a half later, they bring out the 3 rolls on one plate, which would have normally been fine except we didn't want to reach over the middle person since we were all seated in a line. So they take it back and spend another 10 minutes putting the 3 rolls on separate plates and then we finally eat. This whole time no one comes over to apologize - our server came over once to let us know it would be "a little while longer" 20 minutes in but that was incredibly inaccurate.
About the food: it was very mediocre. We wolfed down our rolls in under 3 minutes because we'd been waiting for so long by that point. The best one was my friend's Tuna Poke roll where they put tuna poke on top of the roll pieces (instead of it being inside the roll). I liked my Midori roll fine but it wasn't anything special.
Look, I've been a waitress and a hostess and worked in the restaurant industry for multiple years. But even when it wasn't my fault that the food was taking a while, I - at the very least - always apologized profusely and tried to make it up to the customers with a free appetizer or something of the like. We had none of that verbally or food-wise. I can't believe a place like this exists in SF let alone the FINANCIAL DISTRICT. Never coming here again.
author: Mio W.

description:
John freakin Colin's. I have literally lost count of how many of times I've gone there now. I've gone so much I pretty much know most all Bartenders & the security guards by first name. It's so bad I call the door man my uncle haha! ANYWAYS! 

I have had TOO many memorable (for the most part) nights at this bar. The vibe, drinks, people & music are consistently amazing. This place can be good for happy hour on a weekday and/or a place to throw a birthday turn up on the weekends! 

It's also pretty big so it never gets tooooo crowded. I would say the only day it's gets super packed would be Saturday -- depends if people are throwing events there or not. 

The bartenders there, are the BEST!! They always show love & make drinks fast! EveryTime I go I HAVE to get their Muscow Mule (one of the best ive ever had)!  The music is good too, they usually play hip hop or old school R&B! 

If you can't figure out where to go... One is doubt.. head to John Colins!! Guarantee you'll thoroughly enjoy yourself. 

Thank you JC for all the fun times!!!
author: Nina M.

description:
I've been here twice since my friends wanted to come here... I don't understand al the high reviews! I mean, it's got a decent layout, but both times I've been here it's been underwhelming.

There also also only three bathrooms and the line can be pretty long! The line for the bathroom is also in such an awkward area. The drink prices aren't that bad and there's a small dance floor - nothing special. I'd prefer to go to another place next time than here...
author: Lillian C.

description: Perfect place for afterwork to have some drinks. It has a dance floor that gets too live after 11PM. The bartender was super nice and gave us free shots! overall great place for getting drinks!
author: Michael O.

description:
Are you ready to kick it with your friends, coworkers, mingle with some other professionals or blow off some steam?  A John Colins in the alley and located on a tiny street named Minna Street will help you with that!

It's packed on a Friday night!  Happy hours are between 5 - 7pm - $1 off beer and $2 off cocktails!  They have complimentary pretzels and goldfishes at the bar!

One downside is that I can't hear myself!  I felt like I had to stretch my vocal cords strenuously and shout throughout the entire time I was there!  Lean over and you will hear what they are saying!

It's a trendy, modern bar with little room space to have to yourself.  

Yes, people will be all up in your bubble!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Good old John Collins. This place is a hot spot for me and my coworkers, and we always find ourselves here on a Friday night after a long day at the office! The Dark and Stormy and Moscow Mule are both delicious, but this place has a $15 card minimum. The drinks are pretty strong so if you're trying to hit that minimum, take it slow!

There's also a dance floor by the front that usually has long tables and chairs during the week. On the weekends (including Fridays), there is a DJ and people breaking it down (or at least trying)! Bonus: drunk customers will be glad to hear there's a Chipotle just down the street from this bar.
author: Grace C.

description:
He's climbing in your nightclubs
He's snatching your smartphones up
Tryin' to sell em
So ya'll need to 
Hide yo phones, hide yo bags
Hide yo phones, hide yo bags
Hide yo phones, hide yo bags
...and hide yo keys cause they rapin every bag out here...

Me and three other people got our phones stolen last night at John Collins while the place was riddled with bouncers and security and even a police officer walked in and checked the bar out. Someone just jenked my phone out of my crossbody bag while I was probably at the bar. 

Why do I not feel safe at my favorite bar...?

Run and tell dat, homeboy... be safe, people.
author: Kat C.

description:
Not sure if the street parking around the area was impacted by whatever was going on at the W that night, but I was still able to find some relatively easy-to-get-in spots, perfect for my mad non-existent driving skillz. Even after midnight cover ("for girls"?...does that mean its more for guys?) was $5 on a Sat night. Crowd from what I could tell seemed fairly mixed and by that time of the night people were camped out at one of three places: the loungey chairs, the bar, or the dance floor. 
Albeit small, there were plenty of pockets of space to get in and work it to some of the best hiphop/actually dance-able music I've heard a dj play at a club in a while. If I wasn't so full from dinner, I totally would have been shaking it as well with the rest of the crowd. 
Another huge wave of people came in closer to 1 which was when it started to get even noisier and crowded so we ended up calling it a night.
Definitely gotta hit this place up again when I'm in a dancing mood.
author: Yen D.

description:
Great place for drinks. I came here around 3:30 on a Thursday. I was waiting for some friends and decided to get drinks. When I first walked in, I wasn't sure what to expect. It was quiet and a bit dark. But once I walked towards the bar area, it didn't look that sketchy. 

The bartenders were very friendly and attentive. I ordered a Kentucky Mule. The bartender made it perfectly! Luckily, I got here before the crowd. After my friends arrived, we decided to leave because we were trying to catch up and it got a little too loud for us. I would return if I were in the area and maybe not during Happy Hour.
author: Vanessa T.

description:
To be quite honest I can't really give an in depth review since I have only been here once for an hour on a Thursday. But here it goes...

Ambiance: Pleasant. Not trendy, not dive. Wood, well lit  (for a bar), and a good amount of space.

Noise: loud. Expect to carry on a conversation at the same volume you talk to your deaf grandmother at. 

Prices: average. It's SF. Expect to pay $10 for a cocktail. 

Selection: good. The drink menu goes for solid classics, Moscow mule, dark and stormy, gin and tonic, some select scotch.

Most importantly...

Bathrooms: clean. Two unisex, very clean. A+.

Overall, worth a visit. Somehow managed to be crowded on a Thursday (why???).
author: Drew O.

description: Cool spot for a Happy Hour. They have TVs to watch the game and a sushi restaurant attached to it. If you're hungry and don't want to get sushi, the bar also has a Goldfish and pretzel mix to munch on. It does get pretty loud and crowded even on a Wednesday night, though.
author: Leana L.

description:
Pretty good bar in SoMa area. The vibe here is really laid back and chill. 

The layout is of the long type with a dance floor / dj area at the front, bar area in the middle and a few tables and couches at the back. There's also a small upstairs area to eat. The bathroom is in the middle with the bar and there's 3 individual bathrooms that you lock when you go in. Interesting because the walls of the bathroom are chalkboards and there's chalk so you can write on the walls while you're in there. 

The drinks are about average as of any bar in SoMa and they do have a decent amount of beer. There's happy hour here too  but I'm never here early enough to check it out. 

Sometime at night, I think 10pm, the front area turns into the dance floor with the dj. Before 10, there's just tables there for people to eat and drink. Great because there's no cover. 

Overall, great bar with a good vibe to go after work with friends. 

Pros:
-great vibe here 
-individual bathrooms 
-average prices for drinks 

Cons:
-can get pretty packed when there's a lot of people since this venue isn't that big
author: Paul U.

description: A fun place to get your groove on with food industry people's and drink your watermelon beer. Dance floor gets stuffy so that's why they have a 5 by 7 area to smoke or get fresh air. Must stay off sidewalk cause $5 cover doesn't allow you to stay on state property
author: Laurie M.

description:
The drinks are so good! The reason for the minus star is there's a $20 min on credit cards. That equals about 2 cocktails. It's pricey, but fairly standard on the SF scale.

Do yourself a favor and order the dark and stormy.
author: Kailey O.

description: Really pleased we stumbled across this place for happy hour.  Drinks are good, bartender service is super friendly, and the sushi is fantastic!  Sushi?? who knew.  And it's really good.  Fish was fresh and better than average... plus they show Warrior games!  Perfect combo.  I will definitely be back.
author: Debbie L.

description:
My favorite happy hour place! Love love love the atmosphere of this place. It can definitely get crowded during happy hour for any day of the week, but if you come around 5 before the rush, you can probably grab a seat somewhere.
 
(+) I was surprised at how cheap the drinks are! For all the times that I have been here, my tab always surprise me because I always tell myself I should have bought more drinks (lol, probably wouldn't have been a good choice then). 

My favorite drink? I swear there's no name for it, but if you ask them to make you a drink with grapefruit, beer, vodka, and lemonade, it's the best thing ever. It may sounds gross, but I swear I got 3 of those last time I was there! My second favorite is definitely the mint mojito. I like my drinks light and I can sip on these all night long! 

Definitely a nice hole in the wall that I will definitely be coming back often all summer!
author: Tram N.

description:
Drinks were pretty good, bar was clean, and they have ginger beer on the soda gun. And I freakin love ginger beer. My only real complaint is how loud it was. It was difficult to carry a conversation without yelling, and that was before the DJ cranked it up. I prefer quieter bars, but that's only a matter of opinion. 

My Moscow Mule and my Irish Mule were both tasty. There isn't much to the drinks themselves, but I appreciated that they were made with Tito's and Jameson.
author: Nate C.

description:
Looking for a fun spot to grab a drink after work or catch up with some friends? John Colins is a super fun, spacious, and great spot to do just that!

The place is spacious, the decor is fun, love the art there! Can't go wrong with some palm trees and couches to get comfy on in the back. The bartenders are nice, pour great drinks, and I especially recommend the one that they make in a mason jar with sweet tea vodka. It's amazing! They have some fun and decent deals on happy hour drinks and if you have a work party, bring it here!
author: Akvile D.

description:
Love John Colins. Lets face it, good drinks? Check. Cool venue/location? Check. Hip-hop? CHECK CHECK CHECK.  Honestly, why do I feel like hip-hop at a nice venue is so rare in the city these days? Many places are usually advertised as hiphop/top40/edm, but c'mon now, we all know that actually means 50 edm songs that everyone else knows (but me) and 2 hip hop songs in which include "Back that a$$ up" & the occasional "thissss is how we do it..." Each time I've been here, I really have no complaints since I leave happy, but I have noticed that the transitions for the DJ's usually consist of silence. Eh, not a good thing. I wish I remembered the girl DJ that was there a couple weekends ago. I liked her. The dance floor can get pretty packed since its quite small, but if you have your dancing shoes on, it shouldn't stop you. 

1 star off because we all hate that darn bathroom line as I can see other Yelpers have talked about. It always long & in such an awkward spot too. Meh.
author: Julie Ann B.

description:
Love their happy hour!

this bar gives off a really good vibe and the bartenders are super friendly and chill. they also make a mean drink!

i got a mojito (it's really hard to mess this one up) and a cucumber cocktail that made me stumble to the bart buzzed.

thanks, john.
author: Andy H.

description: This place plays stupidly loud music which makes it pretty hard to converse. Strangely, water also drips from the ceiling in the backside of this bar. The price of drinks are fair as far as SF bars go. Our group got kicked out of the seating area in the back because they were making it VIP access only, but nobody came to use it.
author: Marco C.

description: I'm in love with their whisky selections! I had tried some amazing scotch and Japanese single malt whisky that I never heard or seen before
author: Hiro T.

description: My friends and I arrived around 11pm on a saturday. There weren't many people but at least there was plenty of room to dance. The dj was playing hip hop which is always a good sign. We started dancing and around 1230 the club started filling up. I had fun but my only complaint centers around the transitions between songs...they were awful. My friends agreed and a quick glance confirmed that the general public did as well. Nothing makes the dance flow more stale than a good beat suddenly thrown a bad beat for 8 seconds too long. The turbulent transitions ruined my flow once about every two minutes or so and I dislike when a dj can't sense that the crowd is displeased. When people stop dancing and give you a funny look you might want to mix up your style... Other than that, it was free cover, no dress code and space to par-tay.
author: Kristy F.

description: I've been coming here for years and have always had a great time. As if the dope beats, killer cocktails and friendly staff wasn't enough; John Colins went out and got sushi in here now. Tacoba is downright epic! The sushi is super fresh and the rolls are very imaginative and delicious. Also the sake cocktails and the weird sparkling sake shots are out of this world. I love how this place goes from busy FiDi happy hour with great networking(flirting with da ladies) to chill lounge in the 10-11 hours to hip dance party late night. I wish there were more places like John Colins in SF but for now I'm gonna keep coming back
author: Bill H.

description:
Came here for my friend's birthday on a Saturday night and had an enjoyable time.

PROS
+ No cover before a certain amount of time
+ Good Music - Great DJ the night we went (Hip Hop/Top 40s)
+ Crafted drinks that were decently priced

CONS
- Small Venue
- Gets a bit crowded - Super Sweaty
- The cigarette smoke from the outside breezes into the dance floor
author: Vincent L.

description:
Met some ex coworkers of mine at John Colins and I had a decent time.  Although they had no food, the drinks were cheaper than the average over ten dollars price point.  The Happy Hour has $1 off drinks that are already pretty cheap so it's one of those rare bars where it's not super packed during the 5-7pm time frame.

Most of the group seating areas were already occupied so we had to move from the bar to the "dance floor" area that was vacant at the time.  All the bar stools were mysteriously vacant but there were some ottoman seats that were there too.

John Colins seems like the kind of place where a small or large group can have a nice quiet conversation without worrying about blasting music or large crowds.
author: Ben H L.

description:
John Colins is the jam! I've been frequenting this tucked-away Fi Di locale for years now, and frankly can't imagine why anyone wouldn't like grabbing a drink here!

The staff is really friendly, especially the Asian bouncer, love that guy! Now, what do you need to know about JCs as a business ... it's got a cool divey yet clean, somewhat classy spot, drinks are always strong and beer is fresh, and lots of seating the back (where, mind you, my now boyfriend planted his first kiss on me). 

There's a dance floor if you're a dancing queen or king, cool decor, SOMA just-off-work crowd, or art students. Reasonable prices, too. Check it out!
author: Crystal C.

description: I booked a room with John Colins to host an alumni event for around 40 people. The event staff was very courteous and professional. The corner room by the window is the perfect size for a group up to 50, with cozy yet upscale furnishings. I'm very happy with my experience and highly recommend!
author: Daniel S.

description:
John Colins is brety gud.

Went here for a mixer during GDC. They had a demo reel/sports game going on the projector, a nice seating area, and a huge-ass bar with some great beers on tap (Speakeasy Big Daddy, Kona Longboard, etc). The pours were nice n' strong too.

But dangnabbit, the music was too gosh-darn loud. If you're trying to network, don't you think blasting Lady Gaga is a bad idea?
author: Casey S.

description: This place is awesome! 1 off drinks at happy hour, no credit card minimum, and an extra discount when paying cash. An extensive cocktail menu, and one of the largest whiskey selections I've ever seen.  Staff is knowledgable and friendly. One of the only places that still plays some old school hip hop between the current stuff. The sushi from Takoba is fresh, which has been harder and harder to come by these days. Light dress code weekend nights (no ball caps). Games playing on huge projectors in 3 rooms love it.
author: Jamil V.

description:
Wow.  This place has the best Moscow Mule I have tasted.  The ginger beer they used has a nice taste, feel and aroma to it.  I tried seeing what they used, but it was a small bottle.

Good place to hang out.  Could get a bit crowded, but definitely a place to check out for a drink or two.
author: Sedine S.

description:
Great music.  
Asian crowd :)
Try their John Collins drink, dark and stormy drink.  They were minty and delicious!
author: Kay L.

description: It can get crazy crowded sometimes, but it's honestly a great little bar. I love their Moscow mules, even if they don't come in the traditional copper mugs. I hear the prosecco is good too.
author: Kristen T.

description: Drink was expensive and wasnt worth $14. Food was okayish. Ambience was chill.
author: Ananya P.

description: They play good music (hip hop). Bartender was nice.
author: Rameet K.

description:
Cool spot a little off the beaten path, so not too many randoms walking in. Music was good and the drinks were great. The JC old-fashioned was legit and my girl enjoyed her Gin and Tonic.

The bathroom situation was the only thing that was a little weird because two are unisex and single person occupancy, and the third is for women only (translation: guys have to wait forever because ladies can use all bathrooms).

I'd recommend coming here to get your night started, but it gets a little troublesome later in the night, especially for guys not used to waiting in bathroom lines for 10-15 minutes every time.
author: Michio F.

description:
great mixology location with phenomenally good (and strong) drinks

they have a great sushi bar upstairs too that makes amazing sushi
author: natalie c.

description:
John Collins is a cool downtown spot and pretty awesome for post-work drinks and happy hour. It's got a lot of room but gets full fast between 5:30-6. The FiDi crowd definitely likes this place.

The happy hour is $1 off liquor and $2 off beer. It's not a great deal but for some reason we end up here! They do make some hand-crafted cocktails which are tasty and well made. It's definitely a cute bar with charm. It's conveniently located next to Alibi and Novela good places to switch too!
author: Priya S.

description:
Pros

Good amount of room to move
Dance Floor for those who like to boogey
Variety of drink options
Have an upstairs area

Cons

Drinks are simple and lack some originality 
Seating is adequate but limited

Overall Thoughts

A solid bar for straightforward drinks
author: Eddie W.

description:
I came here for happy hour ($1 off drinks) once with coworkers.  Super crowded and super packed, there were literally no seating anywhere. There was only one bartender working, so service gets quite slow sometimes. But the drinks itself are ok, pretty cheap (especially with the $1 off during happy hour). 

(+) Price: The drinks here are CHEAPP!! Especially if you come during happy hour for even cheaper drinks! 
(+/-) Atmosphere: Ok atmosphere. It can be loud sometimes, but very casual. Great music, but very limited seating.
(+/-) Drinks: Drinks themselves are nothing extraordinary, but for the price, it is definitely worth getting them.
(-) Service: Like I said before, it can get super crowded and they only have one bartender working during the time I went. So needless to say, we waited quite a while to get our drinks.
author: Xin W.

description:
This is a nice hidden gem. 

I went here for a private GDC event/demo a couple weeks ago, and was rather impressed with the space and drink options. It's a cozy little interior with plenty of sitting area, a fun menu and decent music. 

In our case, there was also a crazy buffet and a weird caveman-y food truck outside to go with the game's theme - but I doubt that happens on a daily basis.
author: Melissa T.

description:
Cool bar with a dance floor and a disco ball. I can see myself coming here more often in the future. I prefer these kinda places since it isn't really considered clubbing and you're not forced to dress up all fancy in short dresses and high heels. Tried their Dark & Stormy drink with ginger beer, rum, and a lemon on the side. Reallyyy good until it hit me hard at the end.. not to mention it comes in a mason jar! (instagram worthy!). Also got a Blue Moon on tap.. mmmm.

The layout is pretty small. There are only three or so bathrooms sorta out in the open (kinda like at Sloane SF if anyone has been there) and a lounge area in the back of the bar. Bartenders were really nice too! Oh also, they only played hip-hop and none of that EDM stuff; great to dance the night away to! 

REALLY close to the Montgomery muni station if you're planning to dip before the streetcars stop running. Otherwise, it probably won't be too hard to flag down a taxi on Market street.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
So everyone uses the same bathrooms... PLEASE lock your doors!!!  I am glad the dude inside the bathroom was just washing his hands.  That would've been awkward!  

Anyways, this is a pretty good bar.  I bookmarked this place a few years a go and then just walked in since I was bar hopping with a few friends. Decent music and plenty of room to put your drink down so you can enjoy dancing.  Service was pretty good.  It's pretty easy to get a bartenders attention here.
author: Chrissie O.

description:
Great bar for happy hour, but it's so packed these days.  Used to be that you had room to stand around and chat with friends, get to the bar and order quickly, but now it's so damn packed it's hard to stay there for long.

I love their custom drinks but I feel like such a dick ordering it since it takes so long to make, so I end up just getting whisky on the rocks.

I guess success comes with it's own pitfalls.
author: Tu T.

description:
An ideal night Friday night is starting classy at Novella and ending with dancing at John Collins. This tried and tested combination has become a favorite amongst my friends. 

EDM music is fine and all, but hip hop music is still my #1 jam. Music here is usually from the 2000's, and I love how they project music videos on the wall (although sometimes they play completely random movies). So far in S.F. this is my favorite place music wise.

John Collins is a lounge but not a club, meaning there are still portions of the place where you can hold a conversation with a friend. There are definitely times when it gets too crowded to move, which is annoying but understandable considering it's not a huge place. The dance floor tends to get very hot, I wonder if they could change the circulation somehow?

The drinks here are reasonably priced in comparison to other lounges in the city. I've heard the Happy Hour here is good, will have to check it out sometime
author: Ashwin S.

description:
Though I miss the old JC spot on Natoma, I'm a huge fan of the not so newish and bigger location on Minna.

I've been to JC for happy hours only, and has such a cool vibe. On the first floor, there's a loungey area in the front and back with a few tables and makeshift dance floor, and upstairs has a sweet DJ set up and more loungey areas. JC has numerous beers on tap and drink specials like the Moscow Mule at happy hour prices until 7pm. Sweet!

Even sweeter, are the pretzels and goldfish to nibble on while you're hanging with pals at the bar. 

It's been over a week since the Giants won their second World Series in three years, and I'm in baseball withdrawal. I watched several of the WS games here at JC, and it was such a great atmosphere. They had the games on 4 different screens, and had a few projected on the walls (even having to take down some artwork). JC bartenders were even leading the Gmen cheers for Zito, Scutaro, Panda, and I felt like we were down the way at AT&T Park. It was absolute insanity and Pandamonium when Panda hit 3 homers on Game 1.  Anyway, I can't wait for more game watching and fun times when the  2013 season starts. Let's go Giants!! (Clap, clap, clap clap clap)! 

In the meantime, be sure to hit up John Colins. It's a cool spot for happy hours, birthday gatherings, etc.,  Great location and vibe, and easily accessible via public transportation. What  more can you ask for?
author: Gill C.

description:
Still not all that impressed. I've been back a couple of times because my friends seem to like this place-I'm outvoted. I've had annoying experience every time I've gone. 
-Ran out of stuff to make some drinks...?
-toilet seat was missing (weird right?)
-some dude thinking he's cool decides to let two girls cut in front of him when there's a long ass line to the restrooms and then he turns around and tries to get all cute on me. Big F U to you sir.
-if you step out after a certain time to take a smoke break you can't come back in, though the guy was nice if you're nice to let you back in
-they play "older" music maybe like early 2000 music most of the times I've been there
-Umm a plus for the cute guy at the door, Asian-smoking a cigar, I think his name was Suku? He's nice
author: Sophie B.

description:
Nice bar, it had a decent crowd on a Friday night. Good DJ, small dance floor. Large drinks, and decent prices. 

I'll be back!
author: Benny N.

description: My husband and I came with a group friends for the first time last night. We ordered drinks from one of the male bartenders and they tasted great. Later in the night, my husband went to close out and noticed it was taking a while. To make a long story short, the blonde bartender was completely ignoring him for about 10 minutes, even though he was patiently waiting. So I come up to see if I flag down someone else and I'm noticing she's helping every new person that walks up (right next me) and won't even look at us. It was incredibly odd because we hadn't spoken with her to upset her, nor were we drunk. We were quietly waiting to tell her we wanted to close out and she just wouldn't turn her head. So, I got the bar-backs attn and he was kind enough to help me. He went to tell her and she seemed upset. Maybe she thought we were another couple that gave her trouble before? Then, the bar back walked over to another bartender to get our bill. We were so confused and genuinely felt like there was something about us that she didn't like. Anyway, I won't be back after how we were treated.
author: Joyce S.

description:
This place might just take the cake for "Worst Bar in SF".
You get there. You wait in a long ass line full of questionable characters.
You finally get to the front of the line. You pay cover.
You get inside, you have no room to even walk, much less dance.
You can't get a drink.
The bathrooms are a 30 minute wait.

I walked in. I said hi to a friend. I stood in line to pee. I said bye to my friend. I walked out. I want my f-ing cover charge back. Nothing here made me want to stay.
author: Kazu O.

description:
This place has a darned good happy hour (M-F 5-7pm).  $2 off all drinks, which means most beers are $4 & cocktails are $6-$10.  Not bad prices for the area.

It is definitely filled with the SOMA after work crowd during HH.  I haven't visited later in the evening so maybe the crowd is more diverse.  There aren't many places to sit so get there early if you want to secure an area for your group.  I like the bowl of colorful Goldfish & pretzels they provide.  I couldn't stop eating those suckers.  

A had been craving a mai tai so that's what I ordered.  It was too sweet & not very strong.  I tried a sip of a friend's Dark & Stormy which was better but still didn't taste too strong.  I decided to switch to beer next & found the beer selection to be underwhelming.  No amber or IPA on draft.  I wanted an amber-type beer & the bartender said "we have Negro Modelo".  Um, OK, not really what I was looking for but I drank it anyway.

There's an area in the back that used to be a stage but now there is seating & small tables.  Great little area if you can get a spot, but people in our group kept tripping over the unusually high step to get up to the seating area.  This was even before the major drinking started.  I wonder how many people have tripped or fallen up there?  I think a small step is needed for those of us who are accident prone.
author: Erin S.

description:
Perfect place to watch the game last night and then head upstairs for yummy, fresh sushi. Just be sure to get there early to grab a good spot with a view of the large screen. Drinks are a little pricy but poured well. 

Small  place and small menu but excellent and fresh sushi available from the sushi bar upstairs. And only sushi - no other options on this menu.  We enjoyed the game and drinks on the big screen in the bar downstairs and then dinner up. Bar has most of the sushi menu available if you just want to stay down to eat. If not - send someone to get on the list and they will call you when there are seats available. 

Had the Giant, Special Extra and John Collins. All were fabulous but especially loved the Special Extra.
author: Aimee S.

description: Great experience. Had sushi upstairs and then made our way downstairs for an old fashioned. Good cocktail. Had a talk with Colin and he made us some great drinks. Overall a perfect night for our last night in SF. Thanks!
author: Mark C.

description: Best sushi/service!! I love the sushi here and I would definitely recommend it..The bartenders are really friendly and helpful. In the AM they open up a coffee shop in a bar?? I love getting their chocolate croissants and coffee.
author: Sophia O.

description:
One of my favorite local bars in SF. What's not  to like: It's free, drinks are affordable, good music, and a social network of people.

Parking sucks though!
author: Kathy V.

description:
Another establishment I've been frequenting since the late 90's (okay I'm dating my self....)

Since I don't live in the city anymore, it's been a while since I've been to John Collins, so my surprise it's in a newer location! I still like John Collins and what it stands for; a bar scene not trying to be a bar scene, where anybody can come as they are and just be. 

We went on a Friday night past 11p, and it wasn't at all crowded, although there was enough people in there to make it interesting. The patrons were as random as the music being spun. Although mixed, it was more of a "hip hop crowd" and I use that term very generically.

The kind of night you have here really depends on whose spinning. 
The DJ was mashing up music without mixing it. He would play a more current E-40 song then immediately put on Bell Biv Devoe. Thank goodness the crowd was in a good mood already coz folks didn't really know what to do on the dance floor. One minute they were getting hyphy, the next the were running man. LOL. Come one DJ, you can only confuse the party for like 1 song coz after doing that for 6 songs in a row, the floor cleared out and the only ones left dancing were the really drunk and the really freaky. I guess this is the tactic to get us to the bar...

But end being, JC is safe and clean establishment to check out. It was a good last stop on a night beginning 3 bars earlier.
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
Meh. Not too great. Been here a few times now.

Fridays = packed, but you can still hear your neighbors
Mondays = dead silent

Their prices are decent and the environment is pretty lax, but the layout of the place and the amount of seating is kind of lacking. Their drinks are not that great, but maybe that's because I didn't order the John Colins... or, I'm used to places that use fresh ingredients for their drinks. I had a Purple Hooter, a Sangria, and a Cabernet from them.. all of which... not that great! 

They have goldfish and pretzels as bar food, but I wish they had some real bar food here!
author: Joanne Y.

description:
The last time I came here was 2006. If I had written a review back then, it would have been 5 stars. 

Does it matter now? No. I would still be downgrading my review anyhow.

How is this place on a Friday night? Decent. I actually had a really good time. 

YOU ARE NOT A CLUB, JOHN COLINS. 

$5 cover charge.

FIVE DOLLAR COVER CHARGE FOR A BAR WITH 2 TABLES AND A DANCE FLOOR THAT FITS ABOUT 15 PEOPLE! 

Get over yourself!

When we questioned the cover charge, the answer was "sometimes we charge, sometimes we don't"
author: Susy C.

description:
Came here last night with a bunch of my coworkers. We filled the place and there were barely any other patrons throughout the evening, which was fine by us. Those few that did show up seemed to know the bartender...who was awful. It's like it pained him to do his job. I asked for water, he said yes (nodded and everything), and just never gave me any. Did I mention that happened multiple times? Come on man; what's wrong with you?

The one star is for the surprisingly not-that-disgusting bar bathroom, the raised seating area with couches and tables toward the back, and cool artwork.
author: Michele P.

description:
Horrible, horrible, horrible!!!



My experience has been horrible with the unresponsive, unprofessional, venue owner Colin. I tried to reach out to him to set up an event on January 15th, for February 23rd and after several unanswered texts and phone calls. He texts me at 11 pm on 2/10 letting me know that he would reach out to me on 2/11 at 3:30 PM. In an effort not to bother him, I didn't contact him again even though this date and time came and went.



Finally today 2/13 at 1:14 pm he called me and said to me "hey, this is Colin, I don't remember your name, who is this again?" I explained who I was and what I do, ignoring the fact that after I had text him and emailed him about 10 times with my full name he didn't remember who he had even called. After explaining who I was, I was interrupted by, "hey I don't want to leave you hanging on here, we have done a couple of hip hop shows and we are getting a lot of UNFAVORABLE PEOPLE coming to the shows and we are trying to eliminate that element."



Upon asking him if he had even been to my website, which I know for a fact that he hadn't, he said "yeah, and I listened to your stuff and I don't want to make any decisions until after the 23rd of February. I have someone else coming to do a live show and I want to see how it goes before booking anything". I wanted to hang up in his face right then and their, but I didn't.



I let him know that we do not only represent hip-hop artists, at which time I was interrupted with "yeah, I know you also do R&B and that's great but," to which I interrupted, "we also have rock and country artists, DJ's in all genres including house, lounge etc... But, in any case I will get in contact with you in the future if the opportunity presents it's self in the future".



Moral of the story, the unfavorable people that he was speaking of because of his tone, I am sure are including but not limited to Black people, and pretty much anyone who is not white.



Also, if you like to deal with very unprofessional people, this is your spot!!!
author: Kevin W.

description:
I don't remember much about John Collins, but I think that's a good thing. teehee :)  I had some variation of an iced tea (not Long Island - think sweet).  It was out of this world good... and strong.  Two of them and you will be swimming out the club. lol!
My friend and I stopped in on a Wednesday night and were surprised to find out it was a ladies night and that we got an additional complimentary champaign.  Don't mind if I do! lol!
The music was good (for a San Francisco club - sorry San Fran) and the crowd was alright too.  The combo between bar and club achieved a nice happy medium.  Next time I am in town and stay at the W, I will definitely take a stroll back down to this place and meet up with that tea once again... and maybe a friend or two :)
author: Elsa M.

description:
First review of the new year!  Happy new year everyone!!

This is a well-deserved and long due review.  John Colins is my go-to place in the city.  I absolutely love this place!!

The layout is nice (though it gets really crowded in the long hallway area near the bar), there's a small dance floor as well as nice seating, and the atmosphere is chill but fun!  The music is generally quite good (top 40s or hip hop type stuff), but they do have days when they have other types of music (check their calendar).  The people are generally cool, and I'm almost guaranteed to have fun when I go.

After getting to know JC, what I love most is that I know the ins and outs.  I know the door guy (say hi to him, he's super cool).  I know the secret bathroom and how to use it quickly so that people don't yell at you for it.  I know that there's a side bar that people don't use as much as they should (but that's good, because I get to order my drinks faster that way!).

I ended up there last minute for New Year's Eve, and it turned out to be an unexpectedly fantastic night.  Hugs for everyone (seriously, I gave out hugs to EVERYONE lol)!  Thank you John Colins for ending 2011 and starting off 2012 in the best possible way!  Hope everyone had an awesome new year celebration and that 2012 is an equally wonderful year! :)
author: Alice M.

description:
Yay!  All day Happy Hour on Mondays!  What a great way to start off the week :)

SPACE
Decent size bar.  There's a raised platform - I heard they have bands that play there on certain days?  Not sure.. - but when they are not using it, like on Monday, they had couches there to create a lounge spot.  It's pretty cozy.  Also, they have a big projector on one side of the wall for football.. gotta love football season!

DECOR
Dark wood.  High ceilings.  Sophisticated but urban too.  I like random huge paintings of the dogs.  

DRINKS
I don't think they are big on beers because they only have a few selection on tap.  However, I was pleasantly surprised when they said they had Magners Irish Cider.  It's my new favorite cider, thanks to the boyfriend :)  Cocktails do seem to be their specialty.. particularly rum.  They have a pretty comprehensive menu there.  Unfortunately, they do not serve food... bummer

PRICE
Pretty decent.  Their happy hour is M-F 5pm-7pm, and everything is $2 off!  I think a beer was only $3?  Not bad.
  
SERVICE
Quick and friendly.  There was only one guy behind the counter too, so good job on keeping all of us entertained.

BATHROOM
There's only one.. and it's small.  But from what I remember, I think it was clean.. hmm

***TIP: For you Yelpers, check-in here and get $1 off every item!***

Am I missing anything?  Oh well, I like this place.  It gives me something to look forward to on a Monday night.
author: Cecilia S.

description:
This is quite the spot for Happy Hour. I got the Dark and Stormy due to all the rave reviews, and I would definitely recommend! This place gets to be hoppin' once it gets to be 5 oclock, and by hoppin' I mean VERY CROWDED. You don't feel claustrophobic, but there definitely isn't a nice place to sit and chat if that's what you're looking for.

Fun crowd, young professionals in their early to late 20s. Will definitely be back.
author: Molly S.

description: Guy at the door is a dick, ATM doesn't work but they still want you to pay a measly $5 for cover when the place is half empty... ridiculous, won't waste my time with this place again
author: Danielle M.

description:
ehhh.

Was supposed to meet my girl here for her birthday party, but she never showed up haha. My friends and I stayed for about an hour and then decided to leave because it got really packed, hot, stuffy, and ratchet towards midnight. This place is alot smaller than I thought it would be! 

They do have an awesome DJ that plays hip hop, instead of the top 40/house crap. But, the space just didn't do much for me. Thumbs down for $5 cover after 10 freaking o clock.
author: Angela L.

description:
One of my go-to spots for happy hour in Soma. John Collins looks like a hybrid between a dive bar and a cocktail lounge. It's got a pretty solid bar and the bar tenders know their stuff. I'd recommend the basil gimlet.

Like the back lounge part but don't really understand the open area to the right. Generally find the place to either be very empty or very crowded. Better for just a drink with a friend or two for me.
author: Milan T.

description:
This review is for a Saturday night...

This place is actually kinda great. No cover and decent drinks. There are a lot of guys here...no not the most attractive, but after  few drinks you won't care. 

Please be advised, this place gets RATCHET towards the end of the night. I don't know what happens but all of a sudden you see hood rats in the worse pair of leggings crawling all over this place lol. I say all that to say, make sure you leave before this place closes. 

It's a good place to come to if you want a nice drink and hear some good hip hop.
author: Natalie F.

description: Cool atmosphere but bartender disappears for long stretches.  Stood at bar for 15 min waiting to get service.
author: C B.

description:
(See pic)

Came back for some after work drinks at this location. Yes, that's how long ago I had not been back.

The Yelp coupon was good and they have a DJ spinning for special events later in the evening. Busy and good hangout after work spot or a stop before heading for dinner.
author: T L.

description:
This is one of my favorite go-to bars downtown for Happy Hours. Great space, big enough so you can run away from co-workers but small enough so it's not that obvious... Pretty casual vibe. 

Favorite Drink: Dark & Stormy (in a Mason jar of course)
 
Chances are if you have free goldfish & pretzels at the bar, I'm going to keep coming back. When the first thing you have between lunch and 5PM is a drink, any snacks will save you to that post happy hour dinner.
author: Becky K.

description: Two dance floors, a long strip by the bar for dancing, A great DJ who slapped nothing but great rap/hip-hop music, and some great looking women...Yes, this was a hot spot for me and my crew. I'd def come back!
author: Allister D.

description:
I always have a great time here. They play great music on weekends, some nice r&b, hip hop/rap that make me want to get my shoulder bounce ON lol jk.

Overall experience:
Fun meter: 4 stars easy
Shoulder to shoulder ratio: 3 stars
Price Range for drinks: 3.5 stars and 5 when I'm not paying :)
Will I come back?: Yup!


My favorite experience would have been Halloween weekend. I saw a gentlemen with a dreadlocks wig. It was so wild and free, I loved it. My boyfriend has similar hair (dreads, wild & free. It literally flies wherever it wants to go. LOVE) I saw that he was talking to a gal but didn't want to intervene... so I waited around and I couldn't wait anymore! So I politely explained to both of them why I wanted to intrude. I had about 3 drinks in my hand... so i probably didn't look coherent (I have high tolerance though!) and.... asked if I could wear his wig lol. he said yes, he took my picture, i sent it to my boyfriend and showed the couple what he looked like and we all had a chuckle.


drinks are yum, sometimes stronger than I want but... I guess I get my moneys worth.
author: Sweets N.

description:
We ended up spending New Year's Eve here not originally the plan, but we enjoyed it and decided to stay since it was close to our hotel too. It was very crowded as expected. I remember having to squeeze ourselves in between people to be able to reach the bar area. Everybody was shaking their booty while sipping their lovely drinks, fun and exciting night!

On the right side of the entrance was the dance floor that night. The music was  awesome, one those that would make you want to voluntarily take off your clothes. I had a great time dancing that I lost track of the time and didn't realize it was already midnight!  If my man didn't kiss me at 12 midnight and greet me happy new year, I wouldn't have realized, I was already partying till the following year! That kind of fun! And well, if all you ordered was a bourbon on the rocks, couldn't really say much about it except it was pretty bourbony. 

I'll be back, may be for some HH! 

P.S In case you wondered, no I did not take my clothes off but had fun dancing, wildly. :D
author: Lora M.

description:
GOOD MUSIC. Its hard these days to find a place that actually plays hip hop and this place defs does. 

Been here three times and has had to pay cover once ($5) which is a bummer but 5 bucks still isn't that bad. 

Drinks - are okay...? But I'm not really picky when it comes to drinks. So can't really help out there. 

But if you're looking for a place where you want to get your hippity hop on.. this is defs the place to come to.
author: Krystal O.

description: A rare hiphop joint. Small dance floor, beware ratchetness.
author: Inigo M.

description:
One of my favorite bars in SF.  Tucked away in a little alley, this place has bomb drinks, cool bartenders and even a little dance floor.  I've been there a few times and most recently with one of my good friends who's never been before.  I love their dark and stormy drink and the bartender even gave us free shots!

The crowd vibe here is chill and hip and we made some new friends that night just chilling by the bar.  Love it and will be back!
author: Yue L.

description:
First time here and we liked it. The atmosphere is not too divey and has plenty of seating. The bartenders are fast and attentive and the drinks are good. 

Drinks on happy hour come out to $8 a drink. That's with the discount of $2 off. 
Happy hour is 5-7pm on weekdays. 

Plus they allowed my service dog to come in without a hassle or making me feel bad like other places in the area.
author: Luis S.

description: Frustrated that I've watched the bartenders watering down drinks, adding soda to drinks that don't call for it.  Difficult to order drinks in the first place and by time you manage to get one, it's a pricey water.
author: Josh Z.

description:
