Ah yes, my trusty steed of a bar. This place never lets me down when I want to gallop haphazardly into the slightly blurred and definitely dizzying sunset of drunkeness. 

They have everything I need for such a jaunt. An array of unique and dangerously delicious cocktails, a solid draft beer selection, plenty of mingling space, strangely available bathrooms, DJ's playing your typical agreeable bar music, great bartenders with the tolerance of a wall you play tennis off of, and that little extra "full bar window"?! It's wonderful. 

Go for happy hour to get $2 off all the things. Also, do yourself a most excellent favor and get a Moscow Mule. Ginger beer cocktails make my drunken steed ride oh so delicious, and this one doesn't disappoint. 

I tried their sushi offering the other night because sushi is my favorite. While its of course not your Ariake or your Kabuto, it's still sushi in a bar to slake your drunchies. No need to conquer the bar crowd to order it, they'll find you with a menu and a Square swiper at the ready.

Gallop away fellow debauched cowgirls.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
This place is cool. Came here last week with a friend after drinking too much beer at Thirsty bear haha. 

I love how it's in the Minna alley and you have no idea where you're going and there's a hidden bar.

The vibe was cool inside.. mixed crowd and good old hip hop music. 

The drinks were very strong, I loved it!
author: Tiff C.

description:
I'm sorry, but if I have to be metal detected before I can go into a bar, then it is not my scene. Unfortunately, it was not up to me so I had to stick around. 

Drinks were OK as far as price goes, but at some point someone threw a stink bomb on the dance floor, so I took that as my sign to leave.
author: T M.

description: What a great find on a cold and rainy afternoon in San Francisco. I can't wait until I can make this place a regular stop
author: Dave O.

description: This is, without a doubt, my most favorite place to go in SOMA.  I love the crowd, the service, and basically anything and everything about this place.  I'd go here everyday if I could.  Love you guys!
author: Becca M.

description: The boys and i were looking for one last place to grab a drink after being disappointed by Novela a few blocks away. After paying our $5 cover charge we immediately noticed the laid back chill crowd and the hip-hop pumping throughout.  The mixed crowd was friendly and the basil gin gimlet is a drink I recommend you give a whirl. All in all, not a bad joint to unwind in.
author: Dennis W.

description: A brilliant, unpretentious bar. They serve pop-up sushi upstairs on a few nights a week.  Just a warm spot for sports or surf videos, great music, nice art, and a bar scene that isn't an ultra lounge or hipster spot.  It's perfect.  I happen to DJ there 1st and 3rd Fridays, 6-10p, where we spin rare groove, soul, funk, hip hop, afrobeat, latin and more.  Check it out...  We're great, but you don't need us in this bar to make it the best in Soma.  If you are looking for a club or meat market, this isn't it.  This is just filled with happy, real people in a friend atmosphere.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: I hadn't been here since they moved...or at least I think they did because the one I remember was teeny tiny.  This place is much bigger with more room to breathe.  I thought the service was good and the drink selections were great.  Only complaint if you call it that, is that it gets a bit narrow and so if you're in the middle of the bar you're pretty much in everyone's way.  That's to be expected though.  Definitely a good HH spot though.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
It was around 10pm on a Saturday night and a couple of my friends and I just came from a sushi restaurant. We all didn't want to head home so we decided to go out and have a couple of drinks. We all agreed John Collins was the spot.  
John Collins is a bar where you and your friends can grab a couple of drinks and catch up and if you want to dance they have a dance floor and a DJ playing some hip hop music. This bar is usually a sausage fest which is probably one of the reasons they charge guys a cover fee (I paid $5), while the girls get in for free. It gets hella crowded after 11pm so you have to be careful not to spill your drink from bumping into people. Cool spot if you're around the financial district and want to grab a drink.
author: Anthony N.

description: Good happy hour spot in the city, they get really crowded during weekday happy hour after about 5:30(HH starts at 5), so don't expect to get a table unless you're there early. The place is mostly filled with 20 somethings grabbing a drink after work, I haven't been there on the weekend so don't know much about the weekend scene. Their drinks are good and they offer $1 off specialty drinks during HH. I personally don't think their drinks are amazing but they have a lot of options and the bartenders are usually pretty quick to serve even when it's crowded, assuming you can squeeze your way into the bar. My only complaint is that the music is always super super loud and it get be annoying trying to carry on a conversation. Aside from that drinks are good and reasonably priced for SF, service is decent and it's good for a younger crowd.
author: Teju S.

description:
This place deserves a thumbs up. I had 3 drinks and was knocked out. The drinks and the order in which you should have them to see how cool your intestines look when it comes out of your mouth are: 1-Old Fashion (Whiskey with fruits mashed) 2- Long Island 3- Long Island. There is a dance floor where couples go to show that they are couples and a normal bar for the non creeps/singles to hang out. 
Apart from all that, its a fun place to scream and talk to your buddies, listen to some usual music, and see everyone having a good time. This place gets better if you are in a small group. Over all, this is no college student dive, its a place where working people come to let off some steam. I will be back for sure.
author: Ambu S.

description:
Absolutely one of the worst bars I have ever been to in the city. First off my party of 8 and I are waiting in line of a group of 5 guys and I heard the door guy say it was $5 each for them. So when it was our turn to be carded he asked me "how many in your party?" I answered "8" then he tells me "$10 each please" I immediately replied with "why $10, I just heard you telling those guys $5 each" He just responded with "its $10 each please" I was very upset at this point. If it wasn't one of our friends bday I wouldn't have even bothered with this place considering the hot mess of not good looking people that were hanging around outside. 

So we pay(mind you there were more females in our group than guys) I go straight to the restroom. The in no designated waiting or line area therefore random people were just cutting in. Poor air circulation, the music was ok. The staff aside from the douche bag door guy was pleasant. The crowd was an ok mix of good looking mid 30's to not good looking. But all in all I would never ever come back to this place.
author: Edie R.

description:
This bar is located on Minna near Mission & 2nd street, so it might be tough for first time patrons to find this place. Once you get into the bar, it's a small establishment with a small dance floor but 2 places to serve you drinks (one main bar in the back & another minibar closer to the entrance).

Each time our group visited this bar, it wasn't too crowded on weekend nights, but popular enough to have enough party-goers come and go. There's no cover, especially if you come early enough, though they do tend to restrict men from entering if the ratio of men & women isn't close to 1:1.

Come here for drinks if you can find a parking spot nearby on Fridays or Saturdays.
author: Rob L.

description:
Ok let me start by saying I  drive up from Millbrae to go to this place & I was expecting a bit more from what I've read on yelp.

 On a Saturday night this place was barely opening up at 10pm which was fine & open til 2am. If you come in at that time & expect to judge the place fair warning you'll probably just leave,but  by 1130 it's pretty packed. 

A couple of Tips:

No Cover  ++
3 (1 person) restrooms - All unisex
Located on Minna St (which is an alley between Howard & Mission) It's easy to miss.
Park in the structure on Mission (between 4th & 5th) = $1.50 6pm - midnight & $2 midnight - 6am
Venue space is small


Top 4 topics I'll be honest about:
* Drinks & service ++
* Venue Space  +
* Music - +
* Parking -+

Drinks & service:
Didn't wait long for drinks but trying to squeeze in between bar stools to get our drinks is a bit of nuisance.  There is a little window the left of the bar that you can order drinks from so I'd suggest to hit that up instead of going directly to the bar itself (Duh!! Wish I had seen that before hand).

1 person = 2 Shots, 2 cocktails = $30 + tip is a not too bad in my books, especially in the city!! Both Bartenders was nice, no complaints there.

Venue Space:
 Be aware this place is about as wide as the alley street you walk along to get to the place. That's small in my books. I'm talking about decent capacity would be about 100. Standing room only unless you get bottle service, which only allows 2 areas to be in, and it's pretty much the only seating space you'll find. 
Immediately on the right as you walk in you'll find a small dance space, Eh that's fine. We ended up dancing anywhere within the bar anyways cuz it was just small. A fight broke up that night & they actually had to stop the music for a while just to clear out. BOO!! Don't spoil the night for everyone else. If this place had to shut the music off for a party foul & you started that ...BOOOOOO to you!!! If this place were bigger I don't think we would have noticed it, but....

Music: 

In addition to that the music was all over the place. I'm talking about 20min intervals from one genre to the next. A few songs in sequence were Reggae, then switched up R&B, then switched up again to 90s, then switched up again  

Parking:  This is the city so as far as parking goes...it's a hit or miss. Plan to either park on 5th & Mission. It's less than $10 to park for 4 hours & only a 2 block walk (cut through Yerba Buena Gardens & the Metreon) otherwise take the Bart in. 

Overall a decent place & depending on your groups vibe this isn't too bad. It's more of a happy hour type place than a dance club.
author: Riz B.

description:
Good service.
Good music.
Good crowd.
Great times!

This was my first night out in the city since I moved to the Bay Area almost 2 months ago. My coworkers took me out here during the last hour they were open last night. It's not a huge huge establishment or anything, but I hate losing friends in big places anyways so it was just my speed. High ceiling gives a nice feel of space. 

It was also exciting to see the crowd consist of a lot of laid back folks real similar to where I grew up in Hawaii. Everyone having a nice time and a lot if good looking people. Even the art work and this painting of a red nose pit or something reminded me of the town I grew up in. Every few neighbors had one or two of them awesome dogs. 

If I ever move closer to the city, I'll be making it back to Jon Collins more often!
author: Evan H.

description: Wish the music was better.. I mean they had old jams but I wanted to really have a poppin' night on the dance floor and the music wasnt doing justice. I like wine and stayed with that cause its the best in my opinion. Moscow mule was alright.. Would I come back? I dont know... It was like a meh type of place. I go for music/dancing and singing a sick song. But no. This place was just aight.
author: Alessandra E.

description: EXCELLENT GREETINGS FROM SECURITY!' Especially the ones named Jackson and sabu, started the night off great by being welcoming!! Plus they are good looking for all you single ladies out there or taken ladies who need eye candy!! Great throwback hip hop music and drinks were on point. Definitely not the last time I'll be coming here for a good night out ;)
author: Heilala S.

description:
This bar has moscow mules and dark and stormy's in ball jars! I have come here twice actually (the first time I can't I didn't even know where I was because I hadn't moved to SF yet).

We had an alumni happy hour here and they let us reserve the front area. The drinks are reasonable, and they have goldfish and pretzel snack bowls! They also have a few seating booths towards the back of the place so it's good for a group of people.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I absolutely love this place. 

Yes, we got cut off and yes, it's way too crowded with not enough seating, BUT I cannot wait to come back & here is why:

- Amazing happy hour (I believe from 5-7)
- Super attractive bartender (this will probably only matter to those who are into males)
- Great list of original house-made drinks such as the "dark & stormy"
- Wonderful Moscow Mule (gotta love that ginger beer!)
- Excellent selection of alcohol - don julio shots, that's what's up!

I definitely want to return, I just hope they have forgotten my face by then ;)
author: Junel S.

description:
Pros: No cover, cool artsy fartsy vibe, nice artwork on the walls, okay priced drinks.

Cons: Parking is a bitch. We circled round & round because we didn't want to pay to be in a lot, almost already knowing our pursuit of nightlife would probably fail, yet again, during our trip. Bathroom situation looks problematic (good thing we didn't need to use it) and the DJ that night (a Saturday) was wack. He kept playing salsa/latin music, which is fine in bite sized portions, but song after song after song? I thought this was supposed to be a hipster cool indie hip hop loungey type place? I mean, you do have Big Poppa on the walls, but you've got salsa on heavy rotation on the 1's & 2's? 

Say what??
author: Joy B.

description:
This joint breathes San Francisco.  I really enjoyed the diversity and the laid back atmosphere.  You'll meet people from all walks of life here, and it really is a melting pot of different cultures.  Got kind of sick of hitting up my usual nightclubs, so gave this a shot.  Its almost like the redheaded stepchild of a lounge and a dive bar.  When you walk in, there is a tiny floor with people dancing, and there was a live DJ.  The bar itself spans all the way to the back (not that its really far).  In the rear, there is more seating area just to lounge around and chat.  The ambiance is really nice, and the bartenders give off a great energy.  The drinks are real stiff, but they run the average price of drinks in SF.  Don't expect a nightclub.

PROTIP:  Bring a few girls in your party and you won't have to wait in line at all.

PROTIP2:  Get pretzels!
author: David C.

description: We were here for a Dreamforce party so I can't rate the normal experience but in general I thought this bar was great.  I like that there is a small dance floor so if you're in the mood you can bust a move to decent top 40 music.  The drinks were good as well, and I did feel for the bartenders as this was open bar party so of course it was insane.  The place is not so big so beware - also by the end of the night, people have been spilling drinks everywhere and the area close to the bar is especially dangerous.  I unfortunately ended up with a giant bruise the size of a small novel on my left shin from hitting the step up near the back of the bar ....
author: Kay C.

description: I came here wanting to hear my ghetto good music and boy did they serve me. There was a $5 cover on Saturday which was fine. I had walked from Novela to Local Edition and finally to this place around 11:30 or so. I was welcomed to MY JAM- dont tell em jeremih. I was so damn happy. So right when you enter to the right is the small ass dance floor. To the left is the bar area which is super crowded. Pretty much this whole place is super crowded. Oh well. The music was bomb though. It isnt Raven music where it is older hip hop, 90s music but this is what you would hear on 105.7, 102.1 and 106.1. I heard Main Chick, Loyal, Body Language and bunch of other goodies :) I have been looking for a spot that played this kind of music in SF but I couldnt find. However, it was super crowded in there and unpleasant. I read that this place had a lot of Asians but that was far from true. The attire is dress in whatever but you will see some of those girls wearing slutty tight dresses and such. I dont think I will visit this place again and I am sure I can find a place with my music and a good crowd.
author: Amy H.

description: The ambiance is good and it gets pretty crowded, so it's a great place to socialize. Their mixed drinks are ok but don't get an Old Fashioned from there, I saw the bartender pour hella sugar in it and it tasted pretty gross. I wouldn't be surprised if it was Splenda!! No thanks!!
author: Eva D.

description:
I really wouldn't rate this 3 stars...but I rounded up.

Overall, the venue is small.  the drinks are good... there's no cover (always nice)... but the DJ was horrible.  My friends and I head off to the dance floor and no matter how hard I tried..i just couldn't get into it 'cause the DJ put on some really bad mixes...  

I read that some ppl said the DJ was great..maybe I just went on a bad night.
author: Jane L.

description:
"Hey Girl, I need to see your ID" - says the creepily cute guy at the door who wasn't the bouncer.... because there isn't a bouncer at the door at the door at 9pm on a Friday nor is there cover this early. 

I came here with a group of friends on a Friday night as a pit stop to get our night started...We came at the awkward transitional time of the night, where they're coming out of happy hour and switching to getting the dance party going. So... everyone was clumped over at the bar, the 'dancefloor' was dead, and ultimately it sort of left my friends and i standing in the middle of nowhere in the bar (not much seating or wallflower space inside this bar based on it's longer rectangular design... ) chugging our drinks so we could move onto somewhere else. 

So I'd come back at more defined times, either happy hour or once the party actually started kicking up.
author: Christine B.

description:
I really enjoyed my night here.

Pros: Mixed crowd jamming to a variety of music but mostly hip hop. No grabby guys, everyone was smiling and having a good time. The best/quickest bartenders ever. I swear we didn't wait longer then two minutes each time we went to the bar despite the crowd at the bar. Everyone was turned up! =)

Cons: Small VIP section. The bathrooms were very awkwardly placed so the line overflowed into the bar area and made it hard to walk from the (very tiny) dance floor to the bar. It's the city, so parking is ridiculous, but you already knew that.

Overall, however, this place although tight was actually pretty nice. The doorman was very chill (and handsome) and surprisingly friendly. Where they do that at? I've only ever met one nice door man; all the others are lightweight power hungry/shady characters. 

Anywho, I'd like to check this place out again one day. #TurnUp
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Always a good option whenever I come back to the city. Good music, reasonably priced drinks, and no cover is a recipe for a good night!

I'd agree that the crowd varies depending on the night you check this place out (Friday/Saturday are its busiest days). I came here on a Thursday night and was pleasantly surprised. I'll be BAKK. (In my terminator voice).
author: Herb A.

description:
I love John Collins!!! It's my favorite happy hour spot! I always feel that the financial district is full of vapid, stuck-up corporate snobby, former business/marketing majors that strut around in their suits and boots. Not gonna lie... They do look quite good in their suits... But anyway, John Collins is right in the midst of all the corporations and startups... But the people are actually pretty awesome! The owners, John and Collin... Fabulous! They are so good with their customers and are able to cater to everyone, especially when crowded! I want to come here so often that I just have to look at the bartenders and they will have my John Collins coming right up! Their happy hours are great, reasonable and they even cater sushi on some nights. I love the interesting people I meet and the delicious drinks! Love that whiskey! :) 

They also have a small dance floor and it doesn't get to crowded. I have enough elbow room to bust out my moves. Happy Hour Power! :)
author: Leena B.

description:
The new John Colins is better than the old, but has the same aura, really.  Except it's less crowded is the only thing I can come up with. Oh, and I can almost hear you.

One night, recently, there was a pork bun truck parked out front.  Not a taco truck, which is what I desired, but a pork bun truck. And even though they started handing that out free, we let it be.

It must be said that I've only ever been here on a Monday or a Tuesday night, so take that into consideration crowd-wise.
author: Meg W.

description: Hiphop, casual atmosphere. Not my favorite, but the drinks were pretty good and pretty strong.
author: Heidi L.

description: This was the only place the was open on Monday night at 11pm.  Great place for drinks, chill vibe, and very hospitable bartenders!
author: Victoria C.

description:
"Last night I got served a little bit too much of that poison baby..." - Carrie Underwood

John Collins is conveniently located close to my work so I am here regularly.

What's good- 
Strong drinks 
Location
Strong drinks
Spacious interior
Strong drinks
Great people watching
Strong drinks
No cover
Strong drinks

A cautionary tale-
If you head to the back, consider yourself warned!  The seating area is elevated.  Loosely translated that means, climb to the area at your own risk.  I've seen several people face plant in front of tons of people who pretend like they didn't just see the disaster and secretly giggle in their groups.  The falls range from slow tree timbers to intricate Steve Urkel falls.  Just be careful, especially after a few drinks.  Did I mention their drinks are kinda strong?
author: Melanie T.

description:
After "Dark and Stormy" day at work, the ginger beer filled booze mix at this place is awesome! The bartenders are friendly and their "pink juice/ vodka cranberry" hits just the right spot as people hang out at this waterhole for FIDI youngsters.

Yep, a fan for sure!!!

Barely any reception for cell phones.
author: Eva Y.

description:
This is the place to shake your tail feathers! (They've got Top 40's music)

* Friday Night

* $5 Cover charge, no line @ 11pm

* Music: Top 40's

* Scene: You'll have fun if you come with a group of friends, but not if you're looking to meet someone. Not the young professional kinda crowd when I went (young but without the professional). 

* Dance Floor: Tiny & to the right after you enter. Got realllly crowded (with pockets of space and in the back) when I was leaving around 12:30.
 
* Bar separate from the dance floor
author: Emily C.

description:
John Colins is a nice place in SOMA where I had a great time in between drinking shots of Goose, dancing to songs like "I Get Around", listening to friends tell me about bar fights and how "sometimes guys with smaller ones work it much better than guys with bigger ones", and seeing guys named after sexual lubricants  desperately try to feed hot dogs to drunk girls.

It's also a trap for clutzos, so clumsy girls in heels beware. The bathroom is a dangerous place.

It can also be a dangerous place for guys who do NOT like to be molested by intoxicated girls. Thankfully, Mr. Tiny Rooster and I are not among those who do not enjoy girls grabbing our junk.

Of course, the girls will claim this never happened. Denial is not just a river in Africa.
author: Eric W.

description:
My go-to bar now. Was there for their 10th anniversary party, and it was extremely awesome. I first came here back when I first started drinking, and it still holds a place in my heart. My 21st birthday was here! That's how much I love it :)

Please go! The service is awesome, the atmosphere is nice and the drinks are amazing!
author: Kimihiko S.

description: My favorite bar in San Francisco!  While hipsterism and EDM is taking over the city, it is nice to still have a chill bar that you can go to just have a drink and hangout and dance to good ole hip hop!!!  It's a small spot with a little dance floor in the corner, but there is no cover, and they always have different specialty drinks.  Love, love, love John Collins!!!
author: Truth H.

description: Pretty good Financial District happy hour spot. I met a college friend here, and grabbed a couple Trumers (my new favorite CA beer, and it's brewed in Berkeley, so have to represent). Space is huge, with a bar to the side of the entrance, a long bar in down the length of the floor, and then some couches in the back that let in a lot of natural light. The one slightly perplexing thing is why someone walks around asking if you want a sushi menu. Seems out of place for a happy hour bar that doesn't market itself as a sushi restaurant.
author: Dan M.

description:
I used to work in the area, and this would be my default bar to go to after work. I highly recommend their special cocktails, but the martinis and gin & tonics here are quite strong and always got me in a happy mood to go home. Plus, they have snacks and goldfish in small cups in front of you and for some reason I just excessively eat them...

It's a relatively quiet place if you just want to be able to socialize with your friends.
author: Tony H.

description:
I came here for a random night out with friends.  Girls night to shake my booty.  I was in the mood to dance.  The DJ was GREAT.  Played some old hip hop that I totally loved. One song after the next I was just sooo into it.  Drinks and bartenders though were lacking.  Places like these I just tend to get straight up drinks and shots so you don't have that issue...that is if you can get someone's attention.  I seriously was at the bar for over 20 minutes waiting to be helped.  My recommendation is you have to drink up early and get all your drinks in then dance the night away.

This place is a tad small but definitely would go back with a couple friends to dance.
author: Kim D.

description:
I am so not a happy hour person. If I need to unwind, I go home and maybe get a cheeseburger. That's how I unwind. Not with a bunch of people two-thirds my age who can swill shots down like breath mints. But John Colins I like. The high ceilings in the back, I guess. The exposed brick. It's relatively comfortable for an urban bar.

Naturally I came here for an office-related function. It was a colleague's farewell soirée, but luckily I don't work with an army of social extroverts. The hardcore drinkers are in front in the seen-to-be-seen lounge. The low-key ambiance is all in the back with the empty banquettes and cube seats. I had a couple of Maker's Marks and was starting to feel no pain. By the time I was standing on the bar with my undershirt looking like the veil on a nun's habit... oh wait, that was last week.

DRINK - 3 stars...happy hour prices if this is your after-work ritual
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...wallflowers should head to the back of the bar
SERVICE - 3 stars...bartenders more present than the waitresses
TOTAL - 3 stars...if I "need" to go to a happy hour, this one works
author: Ed U.

description: Beware of bartender Jamal or Jamil (whatever his name is).  He'll add a dollar to his tip, regardless of what you sign if you pay by credit card.
author: Mitchell K.

description: Great buzz in the place during happy hour. Terrific service, top bartenders , and the best California Roll.
author: Mary B.

description: Really pleased we stumbled across this place for happy hour.  Drinks are good, bartender service is super friendly, and the sushi is fantastic!  Sushi?? who knew.  And it's really good.  Fish was fresh and better than average... plus they show Warrior games!  Perfect combo.  I will definitely be back.
author: Austine M.

description:
Holy shit son. Here a douche, there a douche, everywhere a douche douche. Old John Colins had a bar, D-O, D-O, douche.

My review, sans comments on the crowd:

"Wow! 5 stars for sure, the spot is amazing. The huge open space, the exposed brick. I love how it's got different areas to lounge, a huge bar. They even have free trail mix like shit for christ sake. Loooove this spot, dim lit, kinda swanky feel. I was digging the tunes too, good stuff!"

So I guess I'll be settling on three stars? And no, I'm not being harsh on the crowd. I didn't say a got-dam word aloud but could hear others amazed at the bro crowd too. I love being shouldered out of the way because some dude, nay multiple dudes, don't want to unflex their chest and arms for a split second so I can walk by. We get it guys, you hit the gym. Kudos, now stop being a dick about it.

Maybe I'll make a sign that says:

"Free flip-flops and Dave Matthews Band CDs, 1 mile this way!!" with an arrow pointing towards the bay. Throw the bros off the trail. It's a damn shame when I find a location I like a lot just to have the mood pissed on my lametards. C'est la vie.
author: Justin N.

description:
So unfortunate 2 friends we're let in for free but the rest of the party was denied. Hmmm  the place was dead! Won't return people that power trip before 10pm don't know how to have a business. Just wanted to
Check it out never again. My friends were down to spend to celebrate my wedding
author: A P.

description:
I was always a fan of the OG John Colins (not on Friday or Saturday nights, though!), and while I *think* I like the old digs better, I'm sure the new space will grow on me slowly, but surely.

The old JC just had this worn feeling to it, where new JC still smells like lacquer and has more of a chain restaurant feel to it than a warm, swanky lounge. Granted, it's much larger and there's a lot of potential to pack that sucker in, only time will really tell how much I like this space, and miss the old room.

There's tons of room for you and your pals to get hyphey (do the kids still say that in 2010?), and there's a pretty large upstairs area for 20-40 people to rent out and do their own thing. Overall, I can only imagine the move makes sense for the bar, but it might take a few months for fans of the old joint to fully wrap their arms around the new spot on Minna.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
John Colins should be a go to to everyone who works or goes out in the SOMA. 

This place used to be located a little up on Minna but I think this location is much better lay out wise. John Colins is good for either Happy Hour or Night time and that is rare to find in a bar. The major upside of John Colins is that they have DJ's that play Hip Hop! That's a huge plus because it always draws huge crowds plus it's free all night! I don't know how they do it but it has worked well for them over the past couple of years. 

Depending on the time you go the crowd can either be the work crowd of college students. The prices are reasonable and you don't have to wait a long time to get a drink since they always have enough bartenders manning the bar. The place doesn't get too rowdy but it does get too packed sometimes especially the dance floor. The people are diverse and there is hardly any incidents that happen. The sound system is great and they have space to sit or dance plus an upstairs. The dress code is casual but most girls dress to the 9's, just throwing it out there.

All in all this is definitely a great bar to check out and one you will go to over and over again.
author: Javier G.

description:
John Collins was often a choice for our office Happy Hours, Going Away Parties and any other excuse to grab cocktails after work. I have to say that the popularity on Fridays were keeping me away, as I do not like to feel crowded and like a mix of standing and sitting areas. 

The new location is much more spacious and inviting. I like the balance of modern design with some historic looking features, blending the old and the new with a sleek simple design. I saw they had a small private party room which is good to know when planning the next event.

I crashed the Yelp DYL last Friday to take advantage of the Happy Hour and chit chat with fellow yelpers. Glad I stopped in and introduced myself to the new location.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
This is why, this is why, this is why I'M NOT -

giving John Colins a good review!!

"I put my left leg in and my left leg out, 
put my whole body in and attempted to shake it all about,
I felt this place was bogus and I turned myself around,
and walked right the F&%$ on out!"

The music was so lame I HAD to leave! The vibe was just all bad, reminded me of downtown Stockton at the ol' Candy Shop spot all the kiddies used to flock too before the numerous shoot-outs ran them out. I know it's a club and all, but it was sweaty as a mug in that Batch, I had to cut my Halloween time at this stop short. I literally walked from the car, inside, right back on out and off to the mission I flew.............
.....................................
....................
..........
...
..
.
author: Honey B.

description:
I was here to celebrate something with two other people. Picked it because it was the best option with a lot of information about happy hour. We planned to stay an hour or two.

My experience involves a bartender who, years later, is still employed there (I was forced to go to the venue in its new spot a few blocks away from where my incident happened, for a work function), which is shocking to me. 

Get ready, we have some bad behavior to discuss.

On 3/16/09, around 5:30pm, said bartender overcharged me, then claimed that I was charged for a premium alcohol (only $1 more? really?), then claimed that serving well drinks at happy hour was not the default and that if I wanted a well drink I had to ask for it (I ordered a rum and ginger ale with no further instructions and was not asked for further instructions), to me asking if I was over charged, to him literally SNATCHING the drink out of my hands, screaming at me about how if I wanted my overcharged dollar back, then he'd "make me a well drink," yadda yadda. 

I started the whole conversation as a "hey so sorry I think I might have gotten the wrong change" kind of thing, to verifying the drink costs during happy hour, to him trying to back peddle. Eventually he grabbed the amount I was overcharged from the *tip jar* and *threw* it back at me.

Terrible. Worst bar experience ever. Totally inexcusable. Also, douchebags abound. Go back to the Marina??
author: Caroline C.

description: Perhaps this place might be good for happy hour but I found the drinks to be on the expensive side for being so generic. Also at 11pm on a Saturday it was extremely crowded and full of Asians. They also charged girls $5 for entry ($10 for guys).
author: Jess C.

description:
This was crime scene number 2 on a night full of drunken karaoke as a pre-celebration to my graduating nursing school. Oh boy. This was a night indeed. All I remember is walking to this place, speaking in cursive, and having to leave my water bottle with the bouncer. 

Oh yeah. I also remember good music to dance to, not waiting for a bathroom, and a nice area in the back to sit and catch your breath and soak every thing in. 

I can't really say much about the drinks. I think my friends cut me off en route to this place. 

Friday night. Best time to go. Get ready to dance.
author: Grace L.

description:
*** $20 credit card minimum.

This place looked awesome! Great prices on beer and wine, friendly staff, conveniently located right next to the Westfield mall yet concealed a few blocks down on Minna conveniently in stealth mode from the tourists..

- DO NOT go here on a Tuesday! It was completely empty and literally died by 9PM. Apparently I went on the wrong day. Thursdays and Fridays are supposed to be the happening nights. I'm looking forward to experiencing a happening night and hopefully giving a 5 star review next time.
author: Kathy S.

description:
I was a fan of the old John Colins, but this one's growing on me. I've celebrated my birthday here a couple of times so it's a good size if you wanna do something like that (unless you roll deep), but still small enough if it's just you and a couple of folks.

The bartenders are cool and make the cocktails fairly well. The music has always been good when I've went (live DJs), and there's a solid dance floor to the right of the entrance for everyone looking to cut a goddamn rug.

You can tell they tried to keep the feel of the old John Colins with the brick walls and the ferns, but with a more modern feel. I approve, still miss the old one, but I approve. I'll definitely return, probably to try their happy hour this time around.
author: Stan A.

description:
I've been to John Colins a couple of times and this place is always packed! 

Mixed crowd, mostly twenty somethings with the occasional older wallflower dude standing by the dance floor. The music is always an interesting but fun dance mix and every single time I've been here the DJ has played some kind of TLC song - throwback!

Bartenders seemed to be confused about prices for drinks but the drinks themselves are ok - not the strongest but not the worst. The bartender accidentally mixed up the ingredients for a drink I ordered and quickly remade another one. He did this while simultaneously yolking up some chicken who was yelling at him for water. Shrug.

They do bottle service here?! Who knew?!

Friday night - $5 cover for the gents.
author: Kim-van T.

description: Close to work decent drinks - very eclectic. They have a dance floor and regular bar.  Upstairs sometimes has sushi - served out of a plastic cooler... yeah...  Happy hour is $2 of cocktails and $1 beers, not bad.  My old fashioned was muddled (which is not my style) but it was ok.
author: Kyle I.

description: I have only been here during the night on Friday/Saturday and always enjoy coming. The music is usually a nice hip/hop mix and the drinks are good as well. My only complaint would be how crowded it gets but that is expected in the city/ Interested in stopping by for a happy hour one day.
author: Amani S.

description: Such amazing sushi and a great bartender. Highly recommend the minna sushi and the Giants.
author: Golbue B.

description:
great spot!
nice mix!!!!!
going back!!!!
drinks are good!!!!
author: Dorothy M.

description:
I heart JC!!  This review is way over due because I have had so many great memories here. It's a great spot for Happy Hour in Soma.  I also really enjoy the Hawaiian surfing vibe they have going on, accompanied with great music.  It doesn't seem contrived or fake like the other bars that open AND close in the area.  

Also, all of the bartenders are great, especially Wyatt.  He definitely makes the best drinks and is super patient even if there are a lot of people crowding the bar and rudely thrusting their cash forward.  They have also started serving sushi (from an outside cater) on Thursdays and Fridays which is just another added incentive to head over after work!
author: Ronita J.

description:
Great happy hour place! Love the vibe. Everyone just stands around mingling. There's a couch area if you have a big group and want to sit down. There's a large painting of a dog and the actual dog came out and was just standing among us! What a surprise right?! 

Anyway, love the drinks. It's even better during happy hour when it's $2 off!
author: Connie Y.

description:
When I was tipsily wandering around by myself one night, I stopped to talk up the Japanese bouncer at John Colins. I told him that I could never figure out why John Colins was so popular, nor how it was different from any other bar. Here is what I got out of him:

-  There is dancing later on in the night so it doubles as a bit of a club.
-  The bar is generally open to the public and people don't have trouble getting in, unlike 111 Minna down the street, which was hosting two private parties at once.
(I've seen John Colins' dance floor taken over by a private party several times. BUT everything was still open to the public.)
-  There's a very mixed crowd, and not dominated by suits. I'm not sure whether this still stands during the popular happy hour, though.
-  The owners make a mean Sweet Leilani (sp?), named after the ex-wife of one of the owners. It's nigori sake, Calpico (an Asian yogurt drink), x, y, z, & mint. Very refreshing; can't taste the sake but it's there.

What I've learned on my own: 
-  The service is great (no rude bartenders or bouncers here!)
-  There's a small, hidden VIP room where an insider might stash her stuff
-  WARNING: Be careful of leaving your drink on the bar. It's curved and drinks are ALWAYS falling off!
-  There are little bowls of goldfish and crackers on top of the bar. Just ask the bartender if they are untouched and then take one.
-  It's a great place to meet people. Something about the casual atmosphere. Guys will walk right up to you and start a conversation.
-  The bouncer doesn't like men who pat his back-buddy buddy-schmooze schmooze. There's no need for that here anyway. Unlike Ruby, but similar to Slide, the line stays relatively short and there's no cover.
-  The bouncer DOES like cigars.
-  The owners are John and Colin...in case you haven't already figured that out. ;)

UPDATE: A friend said I failed to note that I met her here, so let me just say that this is ALSO a great place for meeting fellow awesome gals who also just happen to be out bar hopping by themselves.
author: Fawn B.

description:
Happened to drop in on this place last night after feeling too under-dressed at Harlot. I've never been to their old spot, but their new spot was definitely sweet! It was big and comfy - I'm always a sucker for brick and wood. The layout was better than a lot of bars I've been to; the dance floor is really small, but it usually is in SF.

The best part was the DRINKS. I highly, highly recommend the Sweet Leilani - sake, muddled mint, ice, some fruity stuff and CREAM. It tasted like a pink cloud or a pink starbust. Yeah, it's super girly but it is DELICIOUS. The bartender has to work to make it, but it's a bonus to see the cute, charming staff sweat :)

It may get crowded during happy hours, but it wasn't too bad on a Friday night. I definitely recommend it if you want to take a break from Minna or a drink after Osha Thai. Plus, the dress code is super laid back and the crowd was laid back.
author: Dyanna Q.

description:
This is always my GO TO happy hour spot when I need a little relaxation after a long day of work.  I used to work at Embarcadero 1 and it was worth the little walk, now I work on the corner of Mission and New Montgomery and it's still my go to spot (only a block away).

the drinks are made to order, they have great HH prices and the format of the bar is made quite well so that people can spread out and have an opportunity to talk away from the DJ.  Yup, they have a DJ on the more crowded nights and you never know what type of music to expect.

You want to sit?  You can sit on their benches/love seats.  Want to stand?  There's plenty of places you can disperse yourselves.  

Another bonus, THREE BATHROOMS!  You'll never have to wait too long when you need to break that seal.

I think my only complaint is that it's difficult to order drinks.  They have seating all along the bar so not only do you have to wait in line with the standing folks, you have to lean over and annoy the people who are sitting down at the bar.  They should really change up their seating arrangements during HH because it's like breaking through a brick wall.  

Overall I'm a huge fan!  After writing this I kinda wish I didn't write it because I don't want the spot to get any more crowded than it already is!
author: Sandy L.

description:
I attended an event on a Thursday night for a co-worker and 15 of us were seated in the back section that had ample seating for all of us.  The place was packed. It was 25 minutes before our drink orders were taken by a very frazzled-looking woman.  There was 1 other person taking drink orders, so it wasn't her fault.  I ordered a Moscow Mule and we did receive our drinks pretty fast.  By the time we finished our drinks, most of the bar patrons left and the noise level was a lot more tolerable.

The place had a Hawaiian surfer vibe and there was a tv showing surfers.  Overall, large drinks (based on what everybody ordered) and decent prices.  I was very comfortable and able to socialize with everyone.  I will definitely come back.
author: Liz M.

description: Crappy place. The drinks were awful . The bartender read the recipe back and forth and took forever just to make disgusting drinks . We had two sips and left the place. It was just a Friday spoiler . I spent 22$ for drinks+10$ entry fee for +1 and left in about 8 minutes, after the doorkeeper misbehaved with me. Such a disaster.
author: Rimi K.

description: A couple years ago my sister and were to go here and meet a friend.  I walked in John Colins and the bartender yelled out that they are not open until 5pm.  It was 5 to 5.  For real!  He was rude the way he said it, and so I decided I will not wait outside 5 mins to give this bar my money.  We went to another place instead.  Until last Wednesday, I stopped by with my sister and a friend.  We attended a Network event happening there.  I like the decor, lofty with surf boards.  There are also paintings of cute bull dogs.  The energy was off, maybe due to the netowork event happening so I will have to come back another night after work and check out the scene and the folks.
author: Liz D.

description: What can I say? Stopped in 'cuz Yelp identified it as a "sports bar" . Looked like a nice enough club but if you're looking for a sports bar you won't find it here! 4 stars just so I wouldn't mess up their average ratings.
author: John H.

description: This place is easy peasy - chill spot, chill people, decent priced drinks, lots of seating for old ladies such as myself, and it is NOT run down. Hard to find all that in one bar.
author: Cookie M.

description: Ok, Ok... Last review was a bit harsh... Yes, this place is still a sausage fest however, last visit (about a month ago), 1/2 of John Colins (Colin), was working the bar (Yes, John & Colin are 2 separate people/partners). Though they were busier than all-hell, this guy operated with extreme efficiency & worked as if he had eyes on the back of his head. Most bars/lounges keep you waiting 5/10+ minutes to get a damn beer. I don't recall waiting longer than 1 minute before I was seen, order placed & beer plopped on the counter. Needless to say, I tipped him quite well...
author: Bryan R.

description: Stupid. They have a huge ass Giants flag hanging outside, but the bartender refused to turn on the Giants' game because he was watching the basketball game.
author: Daniel B.

description: Great spot.  It was really quiet which was fine because my homie and I had some catching up to do.  Drinks were fine, decently priced.... nothing out of the ordinary but I would be curious to try more cocktails and see what they got up their sleeves.  Our two different bartenders were friendly and attentive.
author: Brian G.

description:
John Colins is best Monday - Thursday.  There's a good selection of beers and a nice loungey area at the front to relax in.  

Friday nights can get packed with people you really don't want to hang out with.
author: Margaret I.

description: Drinks were reasonably priced and strong. When the bartender accidentally took our half drunk drinks away, he apologized immediately after we drew his attention to the error and offered us a round free of charge. DJ and crowd were great on this particular night. Management was clearly hands on and attentive.
author: Tracy P.

description:
The old Natoma location was awesome, pretty chill vibe.  The new location is a straight up night club on friday night, not the "bar" experience I expected and had before at the older spot.   

I don't know if I'll be back, as far as clubs go theres a lot in that same area.
author: Jeff W.

description: I've had my birthday here the past 3 years & have always had a blast! Great drinks, great people & great atmosphere!
author: Casey L.

description:
John Colins is a great after work spot for those working in FiDi. I used to work a couple blocks away, so it was easy to skip on over and grab a couple of drinks with friends during HH! Their sweet tea vodka lemonade is awesome, so definitely dangerous!! All their drinks aren't bad and all average priced, but hard to go wrong with alcohol after staring at a monitor all day long. They have stools along the bar, and plenty of seats in the front and back of the bar. So plenty of sitting space for you ladies who love heels! 

Been here a few times on Friday/Saturday nights, and the atmosphere is a bit different. It's filled with more youngsters and is more lounge/clubish than the usual chill spot on the weekdays. It's not a bad things, just an FYI. No wait. No cover. No complaints from me! 

DIRTY DOGS 100 feet away from the exit during the weekends -- SCORE! The perfect way to end the night, drunk or not! 
Dirty dogs - bacon wrapped hot dogs served on those gas operated tray carts =P
author: Ellen N.

description: Mediocre bar always crowded with a ton of dudes.  Typical SF Tech scene, but it's ok.  Never have had a good time there.
author: Jay H.

description:
I don't know why I keep forgetting to give John Collins some well deserved Yelp love...

I was in my new favorite 'hood last Friday wandering around with my peeps.  Oh dear, so many bars to choose!  But whaddya know...we made a swift move through the alley way to see our old friend, John Collins.

Love the casual, loungy vibe of this place.  Great crowd, friendly people, awesome bartenders.  Dress up or dress down, it's all good.  Oh, and upstairs is a sweet little spot if you want to take it down a notch.    

Last thing...don't be scared off by the bouncer.  He's your friend ;)
author: Angella S.

description: GIRLS. the bathroom lock was broken, a girl walked in on me and a girl and guy walked in on my friend but when we told the owner he was indifferent and brushed us off !
author: Clara S.

description:
What the hell. This place is killing the level of confidence that my friends have in me, and I am pretty sure I am no longer allowed to decide which bar we go to on a Saturday night because the last two times I have insisted on going to J.C. it happens to be on crazy 80's nights and while this is okay for a song or two...its pretty wack. 

I swear, the first time I went here it was nice. The typical shitty top 40 hip hop/radio hits and regular people dancing. Maybe it's just my luck...I only show up on nights that they have these "NOW THATS WHAT I CALL 80'S" horror flash backs that remind me of my mom doing work out videos in the living room when I was like 5 years old. 

Maybe next time?
author: Frances H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night and damn this place was packed.

People say it is larger after it has moved to this location but this place is still small.  It was hard to maneuver around the bars and the bathroom is extremely limited.  There is a dance floor but it is fairly small.  DJ did play good music though.  Reception is killed inside so don't expect any of your booty calls to go through, especially if you are on AT&T.

Even so, I love this place for the whole feel of the place.  The bartenders here are nice and will listen to any special request.  Prices for the drinks are good, lower than your average club prices.  Good mix of people.  On the wall there are these customized bottles of 1800, which is pretty cool!

There are lines throughout the night but it was never more than a 10 minute wait, at least for my friends and I, since we all arrived at different times.
author: Duke C.

description:
I absolutely love this bar, especially on a Friday night.  

For the most part:
1.  No cover

2.  No dress code

3.  Super diverse 

4.  Can't complain about the past 5 DJ's I heard here.  Typical top 40, old school hip hop, reggae, music that will make you want to dance (after a drink or two for some).

5.  Never a majority of fresh 21 year olds.  I've been here a couple of times and I have yet to see a fight, someone throwing up everywhere, etc.  AKA, this is not Holy Cow.  (Thank God)

6.  Really good drink specials.  The bartenders here make pretty strong and delicious drinks.

7.  Easy street parking

8.  There's always a hot dog lady outside.  For some heifers, such as myself, that's something to look forward to at the end of the night.  

Such a nice, cozy, and chill spot.  +5 for sure.  Don't change John Colins.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
What a great spot for all around drinking! 

My friend and I started off at Local Edition, then to Alibi, and finally John Collins.

I started the entry by handing my ID to the bouncer and asked if there was a cover. We got in barely around 120 so they weren't charging a cover (though by the end I wouldn't have minded even if I did). 

You walk in the hallway and see the dancefloor on your right and the lit bar on the left. This place was seriously awesome. The bartenders were kind and the drinks were good. The DJ was playing a really good mixture of hip hop and top 40s (came on a Saturday night). 

The thing I liked most about this place on that specific night is that there were not a lot of BATS (Bridge and Tunnel Sluts). That is one of the main reasons I hate coming downtown and this place had hardly any of them. Plus there weren't too many creeps trying to get on girls. 

The only thing I would complain about here is the bathroom situation but it's a hard fix so they deal with what they have. 

Totally worth it at the time we went!
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
Fifty of my closest friends and I recently threw a party at John Colins to celebrate a few birthdays.

I have a few deal breakers when it comes to bars:
-An over-abundance of drink spillage (particularly near the bar area) due to over crowding
-Random, sweaty arms brushing up against me because a place is under-ventilated/under-air conditioned

These things were definitely not issues at John Colins, which had:
-Good music (there was a live funk band followed by all night hip-hop music) 
-Pretty speedy bar service
-Nice space downstairs, private upstairs by the DJ booth
-Comfortable table seating, with service
-A fun, mixed crowd

We reserved space downstairs for the party, and the staff quickly ushered out a group of Cougars who were unwilling to move from our reserved spot! And, wow!, did these Ladies bring out their best nastiness. But the JC staff stayed professional and got those cats out!

A BIG thanks to Leilani and the great staff at John Colins. We all had a crazy fun time.
author: Pamela K.

description:
***Good***
Dance floor is always a plus. Bigger than the average SOMA bar.  

***Bad***
Getting drinks is slow. Crowd gets sketchier as it gets later. 

***Recommendation***
Go for a happy hour, not any later.
author: Nick K.

description: This used to be a work regular happy hour place before we moved offices.  Just went here recently with some coworkers who were in town for the week.  The prices are great and the drinks are good.  The place a little small but it's refreshing to have something not costing an arm and a leg in the area.
author: Amanda K.

description:
Cons: Small dance area and small hallways. Crappy DJ. Slow bartenders. Pretentious Asian bouncer. Weirdest crowd...

Pros: no cover, strong and cheap drinks, free and open seating areas.
author: Christal T.

description:
I can't believe how many high reviews my fellow yelpers have given this place.  Maybe it has changed since they last visted or maybe the weekday nights are better than a Saturday?  Meh, who knows.  But who would have thought a bar existed in this section of the Minna alley?  No cover if you come early enough.  This isn't a hipster SF bar but luckily the crowd is largely young.  A friend that invited us was having high school reunion/b-day celebration with some old friends.  The bar has a big with a mirror that practically extends the length of it, allowing you to see the face of anyone who is sitting at the bar... convenient.  

The bartenders are nice and I didn't drink too much that night so I can't attest to the quality of how the drinks are made.  I wonder how they react to someone who asks for a Tom Collins. The music seemed to be a mix of 90s hip hop and random popular 80s music, I suppose that was nice for a change.  There are people dancing, and the dance floor itself is limited to one small front section of the joint.  The restrooms can get busy and I remember there being at least two separate single bathrooms; big enough and pretty clean.

The bar and lounge combined take up more space, which is kind of a downside.  They started to play a mix of mostly old and some new hip hop stuff later on...not so used to that. Don't know that I'd be back, but I'm kind of curious how this place gets on a late Friday night. I know I've had more fun at real clubs in SF, so I wouldn't recommend this place if you're looking to dance a lot or plan to reserve a lounge area with bottle service.
author: Kenny P.

description:
Dear John,

I believe you possess every quality needed for a 5 Star Happy Hour Bar in my book:

*Good drink specials
*Friendly/efficient bartenders
*Interesting, ecclectic crowd of all kinds and colors
*Ample sitting and standing room
*2 separate bathrooms
*Pretzels and GOLDFISH(!!!!) to munch on
*Active busstaff to make sure every little nick-n-cranny is clean

Go at 5:30 on a weekday and get yer buzz on....

Mucho amor,

Meredith R.
author: Meredith R.

description:
Maybe it just wasn't what I was looking for that night...

Music was too loud, but there was no DJ yet.  We were there from about 9-10, it was hard to get drinks and hard to hear conversation.  I would rather come at happy hour, where conversation was possible, or later in the night when I was looking to dance.
author: Shelby B.

description:
The one star is for the overcrowded space!

I love John Collins--the music, the ambiance, the décor, even the bathrooms are nice!

However, I do not love how pack it gets. I'm all about crowds and people watching, but this place takes it way too far. It feels like you're stuck in human bumper to bumper traffic--most uncomfortable and unsafe. What if there was a (god forbid) fire or some sort of an emergency??? I'm sure they're not within safety codes! I suppose it's greed that keeps them packing the bodies in like sardines.

I do plan on writing them a letter about this because I feel it's important that the owners hear from the general public about this. 

But other than that, it's a cool spot.
author: This Is M E.

description: Love this place. They play good hip hop music and great drinks. I love the ambiance. Great place to chill after work.
author: Nan T.

description:
One of my very best girlfriends had her birthday/going away party here.  
They reserved a few tables near the front of the lounge for the party.  I had an awesome time!  I loved the old school hip hop beats that they rocked all night long.  The vibe is super chill and laid back.  I will definitely return for happy hour next time!
author: Christine P.

description:
you know, i normally hate bars but this is one of the best ones i've been to.  I love that the dress code is pretty chill, one time i went in a dress and wedges and another time i went in leggings, boots, and a top.  both times i did not feel either under dressed nor over dressed.

4 stars for: 
-dancing!! normally bars you can't dance, but everyone is dancing here!!!
-places to sit
-a great DJ
-no cover, even on weekends
-huge bar, never a long line for a drink
-a wonderful hot dog stand in front of the club which really makes your night on the way out

really sucks that there's NO PARKING!! its sooo hard to get parking on weekends, maybe they should offer valet?
author: Sonam B.

description:
After a not so great time at Mr. Smith's, AKK suggested we go to John Colins. At first I thought, why in the world would I want to go to a bar for the elderly? That's what John Colins sounds like, right?! But she kept insisting that it was a good place to grab a drink. 

So we head on over, pull up a bar stool and place our order. I told the bartender, who I later learned was one of the owners and the John in John Colins, that I like dark rum. He made me an amazing concoction with plenty of it and it is my go to drink now and John Colins is my go to bar. 

Great service. Good music. Good place to watch the Giants! Live music on some nights. DJ on other nights. Can't beat it!
author: Jen D.

description: Came here for a group function ..... 45 minute wait for a drink via a server,  half hour wait in line to get a drink at the bar with quite possibly the slowest bartender I have ever seen.  Way too many people for the minimal staff on hand and not even sure if the staff was very well trained.  Awful experience and obviously management needs to actually schedule and train better especially when several groups are scheduled in advance.
author: tammy c.

description:
Oh please!  I came here several times and it's always difficult to get a drink, Why? it's a bar, well the bartenders have that tunnel vision, they know you are trying to get their attention and yet they pass you by ignoring you, pretending to be busy.
 He finally decided it was time for me to get a drink, so he approached me and I ordered a beer, he turned around socialized for 10 seconds, stocked several glasses and then finally my beer arrived, there was never any greeting or smile, no "thank you", just super sorried mediocre service.
  I decided to never return, there are better fresher neighboring bars, with better scenes and service.
author: Undress G.

description: I've come here a few times now and i think it's a cool spot. Seems like a lounge but they have a little dance floor with a dj. I prefer coming on a weekday to just chill and have a couple drinks. I like the look of the place and the service is always good!
author: Christian D.

description:
John Colins is so cool that it can spell the second half of its name with just one "l" despite the fact that intuition tells you there should be two. It also projects surfing movies on the wall above its front door and garnishes its cocktails with flowers (simultaneously quelling and exacerbating my homesickness for Hawaii). Quirky, intimate, and centrally-located to both FiDi and SoMa, it's no surprise that this bar ranks high as the young professional's after-work pit stop. I just wish that not EVERY SINGLE young professional were there during Friday afternoon happy hour. While I'm not entirely turned off by or even apart from the yuppie scene, it makes me enjoy a cool place less when I'm squished between 100 of them in a small room.

However, when I get here early enough to be able to move and breathe, I immediately take advantage of:

1. A fresh bowl of crunchy, salty goldfish crackers and pretzels
2. A Dark 'n Stormy--ginger beer, dark rum, lime--served up in a jar (yes, before it gets too crowded and they run out of them, they serve this cocktail in a jar, topping it with a pretty orchid of course)
3. The interesting view of San Francisco as if you were sitting somewhere in the bay around Treasure Island, courtesy of a huge, beautiful wall painting of the entire city
4. The loungey music, and the surfing films I can see but not hear (I like pondering over whether or not a particular plant in John Colins that casts a peculiar, artsy silhouette on the wall where movies are played has been positioned intentionally for this very reason)

Dead after 7:30 pm. You possibly might want to come then.
author: Kate V.

description:
Everyone always raves about this place, but I just can't say it's my favorite.  It takes a long time to get a drink, because it gets packed during happy hour.  It is a great spot to meet friends after work due to the convenient location. But, it's loud, busy, and if you're thirsty, it will take a while to get a beverage.  

The DJ's I've seen here are OK, but again, nothing I can rave about.  I wish I could give John Collins another star, but alas, 3 is simply the best I can do, regardless of how many times I come back!
author: Taylor L.

description:
2 words for you:

EL MUERTE
author: Rachel G.

description:
Went with some friends for Happy hour. The good group tables were reserved so we had to sit at this awkward group of stools - which wasn't the worst - until we were surrounded by a enormous group of loud men.  acoustics weren't that great. eventually we got tired of screaming at each other and left. 
meh.
author: leah n.

description:
i never would have known this place existed.  the space is awesome because there's tons of it... and it's sectioned off really nicely, too.  DJ booth up front, looks like space for dancing, comfy and casual seating up front, big bar, and a lounge area in the back.  the happy hour time doesn't ever seem to be awfully crowded but i could see how it might get busy on a friday or saturday night.  if John Colins doesn't do karaoke, they should think about it... SUCH great space for it.

strong drinks.  nice bartender.  free pretzels and goldfish.  interesting art.

one gripe: they really need to properly learn how to make a moscow mule.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Another gold star for another great bar in the Soma district. 

I decided to try this place out for happy hour since I keep hearing great things it. I was expecting a packed crowd since it was the Thursday before the three day weekend but I was pleasantly surprised to see it was quite empty. 

They had happy hour specials from 4-7 pm in which we took full advantage of. $3 well and beers on tap! Can't beat that price in the city. Nowt only was the drinks cheap but they were also provided cups of bar snacks consisting of pretzels, gold fishes and nuts. Our bartender John (I think that was his real name) was hilarious! He defiantly made the experience awesome by drinking with us, cracking jokes and even coming around the bar to take a pix with us. 

Thank you bartender for making me experience at John Collins. If only more bartenders in the city had your attitude!
author: Jenny H.

description:
I checked out John Colins new spot. It looks exactly the same but bigger.  I've always liked this spot - no cover charge, no strict dress code, cool music, bartenders are friendly and know how to make drinks.

It's a great spot for Happy Hour or for a Friday/Saturday night hang out.  Checked it out this past weekend and...I'm not sure if it had anything to do with the Chinese New Year parade, but there were HELLA ASIANS up in that place!  Don't get me wrong, I'm cool with Asians but all I'm sayin' was that there were HELLA, including myself!  LOL!

Anyway, it got super packed - I couldn't walk in and out of the bar without literally rubbing against people.  I do believe I saw a sign that said "maximum capacity 99 people".  There were well over 99 peeps!  Even though me and my girls got table service, we cut out around midnight. It was ridiculously packed.

Owners are cool peeps...
author: Diana M.

description: The DJ provided a great set and had the dance floor live at all times. Drinks were also creative and delicious (a tad pricey but what do you expect)
author: Megan S.

description:
Great place for a happy hour.  However, it does get packed and can be difficult to get a drink.  And when it is packed, the place tends to get really hot.  

A DJ spins a good selection of Top 40 / Pop / Mixes on Friday and Saturday nights.
author: Dipesh G.

description:
Last Saturday night was my first time here. After a disappointing crowd at 111 Minna down the street, my friend (a birthday celebrant no less) wanted to hear some good hip hop. A friend of hers directed us up to the joint. 

Thank the skies above her friend directed us here! It was exactly the kind of spot I like to hit up when I go out. The music was great, got people moving, really relaxed crowd and there's a little window where you can buy drinks if you don't feel like posting it at the bar.
author: Emerald M.

description:
Keeping this one short and simple. 

Monday - Wednesday - Great for a pre-date drink. 
Thursdays - Great for Happy Hour
Fridays - Excellent for After Happy Hour 
Saturdays - Crackin dot com.

If you need to get away from the just turned 21 crowd, you appreciate good 90's music, you still get hyped with the club bangers, and you have no shame in doing the running man to Bel Biv Divoe --- John Collins' is the place to be on the weekend. This place is always a good time. :)
author: Lisa T.

description:
Haven't been here yet, but let me explain my 5 stars.

On the night I was supposed to go here with my friends, we got here a little past 10pm.  The place was already packed way over capacity, to a point that the fire marshal came and threatened to close the place for the night if they did not start kicking people out and stop letting people in.  

My friend had planned his birthday party to be held at this place for the past couple weeks and all of his friends were showing up at this place.  So if we couldn't get in at 10:15pm, none of his friends were going to be able to get in later on in the night.  So my friend explained his situation to the manager of the club, who was very sympathetic towards the situation, that it's too late to change the invite and that he won't be able to call everyone on his invite list to make new plans.  The manager explained what happened, was apologetic, and gave my friend (the birthday boy) a $100 voucher for drinks on another night.  Yup, you heard me right, a $100 drink voucher to use another night.  So we all gathered and went over to 111 Minna.

So although I have not been to this place, yet ... I believe it is safe to say that if it is cracking before 10pm that the fire marshal came out AND the manager gave my friend $100 drink voucher, that they try DAMN hard to make their place crackin and their guests leave happy (even if they couldn't step into the place).


===============
When I do get a chance to make a stop at the lounge and really experience it, I will update my review.  But the above event that occurred will still greatly effect my review =).
author: Pia V.

description: Fucking love it!!! Can I say the F word on yelp? Uhmmm well loved it! The Music was on point, drinks need to a little better, felt like my Dark and Stormy was watered down.
author: Amy R.

description:
Just like the 3 star rating.. "A-OK"

Went here on a Friday night. Got in line about 11PM, didn't get in until 11:30.

Nice thing was there was no cover.

For those wanting to know the demographics.. I would not necessarily call it a "mixed" crowd. The majority was Asian/Pacific Islander. And as another reviewer stated, it did seem like a lot of JUST TURNED 21 crowd.

The music was ok. I felt the DJ went in the wrong direction when he had the crowd dancing, then he would just throw a track that made everyone relax and off the dance floor.

Was there another dance floor? Or just the one towards the right as soon as you get in? If so it is not that large, and can get crowded quick. The bar area however was long, but not narrow. It housed a good crowd.

It was HOT in there, don't know what was up, but the ventilation needs to be worked on.

Drinks were about $11-12 for AMF/Tokyo Tea. more pricey then I usually pay, we are in the city, but I have found places that sold it cheaper around here, and also much stronger. They did not make it that strong here.

No cover on Friday even at 11:30, no dress code, dance floor with DJ.. 3 stars that it deserves..
author: Eugene N.

description:
Came here the evening of Black Friday.  Was in town for the Union Square tree lighting and a buddy had a $100 bar tab certificate so off we went for some libations.  Very cool joint, with plenty of room, we grabbed one of the couches in the back.  Waitress was attentive, and it was not too loud, we could carry on a conversation.  Dance floor was small, but perfect for the size of the club.  Drink prices were not too bad, 3 of us drank on $100 and there was $30 left to tip.
When I am back in the neighborhood, sure I will will give Mr. Collins a repeat visit.

That's my story
author: Steve S.

description:
We went here for a friend's birthday and had a table in the back.  Service was pretty decent for a super crowded venue!  Music was good-- I was impressed they even had a dance floor! No cover charge, relaxed dress code.  Me likes! ;)

Only glitches were the drinks seemed to be somewhat inconsistent.  The first two mojitos tasted great! Then a couple more came, and we noticed the quality had changed.  It seemed as if it was mostly club soda, and the mint/lime was not added in correctly.  However, the bartender quickly remade us a new one!  Thanks!

On top of that, the bar area was pretty small and got filled pretty quickly though.  There was a line outside if you got there past 1030-11 pm, and it was hard to navigate throught the crowd.  

Overall, great location though! Hard to find parking, but thats not a surprise for SF.  Relative to other bars in the area, this def tops as one of my favorites! ;)
author: Tramy V.

description:
The best nights are on Hump Day, make sure it's around 5-6pm-ish. You still get the cozy-loungy vibe, friendly bartenders, strong drinks, a mixed crowd, have a place to sit, etc., - but without the crowds at all hours.

Montgomery BART is close by. Very useful for some of us, lol.
author: Peter L.

description:
Unhappy with bottle service, I like the music they play here both times I came I bought bottle service and my second experience wasn't very pleasant. I requested a large area by the bar for my girlfriends birthday and it required me to buy 2 bottles for that area. No problem. 
I got to the club and they seat us to the smaller area I had gotten the first time I got bottle service with the purchase of only one bottle. I quickly asked to speak to the manager and made it really clear that this was not the table I requested. He didn't believe my word that I was promised a bigger area and I had to show him the email that confirmed me I would be getting a larger area with the purchase of 2 bottles. He then said I didn't have to get two bottles if I didn't want to anymore. At this point I'm upset with him and made it clear that my party of 20 will not fit in this small space that I had gotten before with only 10 guest and that was already pretty tight. I told him I enjoyed coming here the first time and I like the music and the club and that I would like to enjoy myself again and that I can not be cramped and that there must be something he can do for me. He never once apologize to me or tried to calm me down or tried to reason with me. He only looked at me and listened until the host for bottle service came up and made it clear that there was a larger area reserved for me and that they had mixed up my party (this still wasn't the area I had requested but it was big enough for my party). Still the manager never apologized to me and only thing he was useful for was to move some chairs out to make more dance room after, And that's it. Over all I still like this place but will never get bottle service for $600 to be cramped and receive this quality of service.
author: Julieta C.

description:
Great spot.  I had a wonderful time here for a friend's birthday.  After dealing with the evil bald guy at Harlot, John Colins was a dream.  No wait, no cover, and awesome tables/couches to hang out at with our big group.  The dance floor was packed and the bar was crowded, but the people were awesome and so were the drinks! :)

Always been a fan of HH here and love it even more at night!
author: Cheryl L.

description: Its hard to believe it has been so long since Colins moved over to the new location.  But its spirit is still definitely alive.  The happy hours are great and always have a great vibe with great people and great music.  The ample room allows it to hold more people without everybody on top of each other.  Bartenders are really down to earth and genuine people.  One time I showed up a little too early, and they hadn't opened yet.  One of the guys told me to come back when they open, and they'll get a me a beer on the house.  Awesome.
author: Veasna H.

description:
Great for HH.  My friend organized a HH for me when I was visiting SF.  We kind of took over the backroom and the drinks were a flowin.

Maybe they flowed a little bit too hard because I thought my credit card had been closed out by someone other than me.  My friend may have yelled at the bartender for giving it to the wrong person which he swore he gave it to me...anyway I may have found that credit card in my bag the next evening..

Hahah either way, good times at JC!
author: Christine K.

description:
Awesome place to drink afterwork or before a Giants game. Some days they are crowded beyond belief and other days there's hardly anyone there. Drink selection is mostly standard. I remember them from the location down the block. The space is definitely bigger here but the vibe is stil the same. Best thing about John Colins is the CHEAP HAPPY HOUR. 

The best part about this bar is that you'd probably have a hard time finding it unless you knew where you were going. Seats/tables are hard to come by but stop complaining and go get what you came here for - DRINKS!
author: Dennis L.

description:
was in town for work last week and came here twice with co workers.

big fan.  really good service, good beer/drink/wine menu and perfect balance of noise.

crowd was after work peeps and everyone was laid back and fun.

will go back again when in town!
author: Dan L.

description: It's a nice bar, cool place to hang out after work. Plus, they serve up musubis which are really well made. Doesn't get ridiculously packed, but there's generally a good crowd there whenever I've gone.
author: Ross I.

description: I really like this place, came on a Friday night after work for a friend's birthday. I wasn't planning on going from work to play that day so I was completely underdressed, however I still had a really great time. I went in and got a jamey and sprite, hung with some friends and sat down. I stayed until about midnight and got a drink with the birthday girl. This place had great music (hip hop mainly) and decent priced drinks ($7 for a jamey and sprite). Despite my attire, I still danced and had a good time. I'll be back. PS, they do have a room to the right of the entrance that is the dance floor.
author: Briana W.

description:
Cool bar! I came here for the first time with some coworkers (after hearing so much about it!) on a Friday and it was pretty packed.

Dirty martini was good and the bartender was very nice.

Only gripe is the long line for the individual restrooms. Never a good thing when you've had too much to drink on a Friday night.

It is a bit hidden but just look for the Chipotle and it's right in the alley way.
author: Mia N.

description:
Not bad if you go there on an off night, or really early, but it tends to get really crowded with annoying people very quickly.


Dos Equis on tap is nice though.
author: Michael E.
