It feels like there is only enough seating for 25 people (not including the bar) when there are always 2 to 3 times that many people there. Given the proximity to Gap, Schwab, and all of the financial services places in the area, the happy hour scene is always crowded. I have had mediocre cocktails every time I have gone -- not the best but certainly not the worst.

This place has a lot of potential. With better drinks and a more sane layout on the inside, I would make it a regular destination.
author: Charles H.

description:
I do have to say, I fancy John Colins. Located in a small alley in SoMA, John Colins is a nice, comfortable place to grab a few drinks. I especially like the brick building and huge skylights.

I've been here twice, once before Christmas (to scope it out as a possible New Years venue) and once on New Years. I guess that tells you I liked the place, liked it enough to spend a significant night out in the city which is highly unusual when it comes to NYE. Both nights offered a comfortable, laid back, UN-pretentious environment.

Though I was with a good group of people on NYE that I could have enjoyed a night with anywhere, anytime, I felt that there was something  particularly special about this place. Wanna know? It's the staff. I'm not sure if Colin just manages the place or if he's a partner, but he is hands down one of the sweetest, most personable bartenders/managers I have ever met. He is always a pleasure to deal with, whether it's ordering a drink or a business transaction. I ESPECIALLY loved that he was only willing to sell a set amount of tickets for New Years, assuring the comfort of those choosing to spend their time there. The place was comfortable, not over packed, easy to get a drink, all with good attitudes and positive vibes! Thanks Colin.

I will definitely be back as I have friends who have a DJ residency there on Wednesday nights. But even if I didn't, the experience was such a pleasure, I will not only return, but be sure to bring newbees with me and continue to recommend the place to others as well.

p.s. the pictures posted here do the place NO justice. Seriously!

************************* Update 3/2/07 **********************************
I invited 6 friends here on Wednesday for happy hour, all of whom absolutely loved the place!
author: alexa c.

description:
Be good to your fellow happy hour people! Please do not hit on them unless it's welcomed!! We're just enjoying a drink after a LONG HARD day at work..... oohh... long and hard.. hmmm.... 
Sorry back to the review! 

LOVE this place for happy hour. Great prices and great drinks! 
Sweet Lalani is an awesome drink! Not to mention they make a mean kettleone tonic. Happy hour Wine is only $5. Not bad at all! If you're planning to spend less than $15, please bring cash. If not start your tab there.  The music is great too if you enjoy the groove... there are times when they would slip in a little R&B old school. 

Since I'm not drinking for 10 weeks, I'll miss you John Colins... be back soon.
author: Judi K.

description:
Free pretzels and good drinks.

Let the good times roll.

Plus tonight they were playing the movie Breakin' on the wall. 

Word.
author: Geoff W.

description:
What area is John Colins? Downtown? FiDi? SoMa?  It's on the cusp...

I've hit up John Collins a few times, either for happy hours or as a pre-game to dinner and get-togethers in the area (art shows at 111 Minna come to mind).

I like places off the beaten path, yet in reality, it's like 25 meters from the busyness on 2nd St.  Good happy-hours/post-work crowds, good drinks, and who can complain about bar snacks?

$15 minimum for credit card.
author: Jason R.

description:
Hit up this bar last weekend for a bday. Its one of those chic "alley bars", only this one has a surfer theme since the owners are surfers. The ambience had a cool vibe and the crowd was very diverse(at least it was that night). The DJ played mostly hip-hop and R&B, and one of my boys spins there on certain nights, so I definitely recommend this bar to anyone lookin to chill, socialize, and have a few cocktails. 
The bartenders(john and collin and some chick) all mix great drinks and don't skimp on the alcohol....that's the kinda bar I like!
author: Frank V.

description:
My bartender buddy took me to this place one night.  John Colins is the perfect low-key bar with a relaxed, intimate vibe.  I love the cool art on the walls!  The interior architecture of the bar has wonderful ceilings, brick walls, and a pretty bar.  

For such a small place, they have an extensive drink menu.  I love anyplace that has house infused vodka but is not above serving a Guinness.  

If you are brave enough or just into self mutilation, try the Muerte (habanero infused tequila).  I had a tiny sip and I thought my tongue was going to burn off.  They don't call it "fire water" for nothing.  Definitely an acquired taste.  

The bartenders are really sweet, attentive (even with a crowded bar), and work fast.  

I'm glad to find a bar that I thoroughly enjoy and is close enough that I can crawl back to my home when I need to.
author: Monica L.

description: Pretentious is the word to best describe their Minna location. Door guy likes to power trip. You're not a Las Vegas lounge. Get over yourself... really. Good thing there's numerous other spots in that area.
author: Gil A.

description: Who changed the bartenders??  We arrived 15 mins before 5 pm.  Doors open - she says we open at 5 pm and no we don't have quarters (who doesn't have quarters for patrons who are going to drink at your establishment?).  We leave and come back 5 mins to 5 pm...thinking it's only 5 mins I'm sure they'll at least just let us sit down.  No!  She says in 5 mins I'm going to close up for 5 mins.  Wait...you open at 5 pm, but you're gonna close at 5 pm for 5 mins...are you f*cking w/ me really right now??  Who close the doors at the time they're suppose to open, I'm confused.  F*ck that we're going to 83 proof...pounded 12 cocktails biatch!  83 proof is nicer, cleaner, drinks are bigger, better, and cheaper!!!!  Alcohol selection much better too! The bartender even bought us a round.  10 cocktails=$64 WHAAAAAT, LOL!  EVERYONE HEAD OVER TO 83 PROOF!!
author: D C.

description: I love this place! Ive been here for a private party and for just a night out and Im never disappointed. It does get super crowded on busy nights so be prepared! Also my only real suggestion is when I attended a private party up stairs there was no system in place for keepin random people from comin into the room and taking a look around... it was kind of uncomfortable and could have at least used a sign that read private party to keep random people from wondering through
author: Vero V.

description:
When its not crowded its pretty awesome. Cool artwork, nicely made drinks and the projector shows the most hilarious/interesting things, for example an 80s show that was all about break dancing. I was mesmerized.

UPDATE:
My bff and i had a game - we picked each other's drinks. mine was white with a red bottom it was ok. there was a bday party going on - i asked the bartender to snag me a cupcake - the four of us indulged. i wish this place was a tad bigger - it'd be a tad better.
author: Anita C.

description:
I kinda like this place - it is close to my office and a great escape if I just don't quite feel like going to the gym and need a drink to give me the "oh, I can't work out, I have a buzz on!" excuse. 

I didn't really notice the clientele.  Seriously.  I was too busy watching the surf videos.  I would go there myself just to drink a glass of wine and zone out at the videos, but the roofies comment and the fratboy reputation make me think twice.
author: Maria C.

description:
My inaugural visit was for a  private party last Saturday night, which opened up to the public at 9pm.  Why hadn't I found this place before?  Everything works... great space, comfy yet hip, good drinks (and cute bartenders mixing them), nice people to talk to while in line for the bathroom.  Can't really ask for much more.  

BTW... loved the SF skyline painting, but me and my nerdy friends (okay, really not me, just one of my nerdy friends) noticed that the map is inaccurate as masonic is not, in fact, the end of the panhandle.  Or something like that.  I forget... I was drunk!
author: Mara H.

description:
Did I go here?  I ask not because I was drunk (hardly!) but because the place was so unremarkable.  Situated on a quiet, comatose part of SOMA, I wasn't surprised that when we got inside, the place was small and not at all exciting.  Luckily, I wasn't paying so I just got handed some mystery chick drink that I barely sipped (I like drinks that don't taste like drinks; I like drinks that taste like dessert!) and sat and talked.  

They were showing some movie overhead against the wall but I didn't know what the hell it was.  There's no theme here - it's just a bar.  

Did I mention it was fucking hot as hell inside?  Outside, the air was pretty brisk; inside, an old-World style schvitz.  The only thing missing were the fat, hairy guys with towels wrapped around their waists, pouring water over hot stones.  

I hate going to bars to begin with so I guess I'm not the best judge of character here but even I would have wanted a little bit more...  If I didn't get dragged here by my friend, I wouldn't have even gone in.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
Definitivamente sin dudas one of my favorite bars.  I just love the brick walls, the skylight and the surfer mode. 

BTW, get there early! This places packs up fairly fast!
author: N. C.

description:
Probably my most favorite bar in the City.  Great vibe and fun staff.  I always have a good time.  Don't be fooled by the big guy at the door - he's a teddy bear.  

Narrow bar with brick walls and seating areas - you'll always find me at the bar.  Tip well and buy a shot for your bartender!

This is where I usually get my evenings started.
author: Marsizzle M.

description: By far the best bar in the city.  From music to videos projected on the wall to the great selection of wines and spirits, you cannot go wrong with this place.  Lately it has been more crowded than I care for but this remains a local staple in my neck of the woods.
author: Javier O.

description:
I have to admit, I didn't even know this place was there.  I couldn't be sure I wasn't being led down a narrow street to be beaten and robbed, but I went along anyway.

To my surprise and pleasure John Colins truly did exist, and it was pretty hip to boot.  The ambiance is pleasing - except for the blinding yellow lights that accent the artwork.  Seriously, put a muzzle on those things.

The crowd was chill and quite attractive.  Combine that with moderately priced drinks and good friends, and John Colins was a good time indeed.
author: Chuck C.

description:
Came here recently with some friends for happy hour.  I work way out in Noe Valley so coming down to SOMA for happy hour is quite a feat.  After a slow J ride and blistering winds, I arrived ready for a drink.  Its a pretty nice place with cute decorations and a good amount of seating.  Apparently they usually play a movie on the big screen but it was super busy so all we saw was somebody's iTunes imposed on the screen.

The happy hour prices are awesome!  And although the bar was pretty crowded it didn't take too long to get a drink and friendly service.  I would definitely come here again!
author: Angela S.

description:
I like this place.  I have been here several times and it has a nice vibe.  Happy hour, a spot on the weekends to drink and chat with friends (pre and post going out for the evening).  

It's nice, low-key and NOT ghetto - I'm down for this place.
author: Brenda H.

description:
Its an early crowd, but this place has late night potential.  
Really picks up between 6-8.  Don't remember how strong the drinks are, which probably means strong.  The music is loud.  The decor is perfect for SOMA, and the location near 111 Minna and Osha make for a good trifecta of a friday night, or a wednesday.
author: Christian W.

description: You must order the, "Pear of Panties," cocktail. It IS as fun as it sounds!!
author: Julia N.

description:
John Collins has become one of my favorite bars/lounges in san francisco.  Whenever my friends and I wanna go out to the City, we usually end up going here because the drinks aren't too badly priced and they're delicious.  The bouncers are very nice and the wait is never long.

Go here and have a good time.
author: lasok o.

description: For such a great location and so much potential, this place disappoints time and again. The space arrangement is kind of wacky... they could have done a much better job and provided much more seating. Also, the hard liquor is SOOO watered down. Anything you order tastes more like water with a splash of ___ then an alcoholic drink. Music is OK - sometimes obnoxiously loud and unfitting for a 6PM happy hour session.
author: Janie Y.

description: We got here around 10.30pm on a Saturday night.  It wasn't too crowded yet and a little mellow.  We grabbed a few seats at the bar and really enjoyed our drinks.  The bartenders were really cool and friendly.  The whole place has a great vibe and I liked the asian inspired decor and exposed brick walls.  The house music was decent.  No cover at the door and the doorman was even nice and funny.  I will definitely be back.
author: Lidiya B.

description: Nice and laidback, especially for happy hour when it's packed. Sorta reminds me of Mr. Smiths without the awful frat basement.
author: Leily P.

description: Came here after Osha Thai.  I would have never thought that there would be a cool little bar like this in an alley.  It's just one of those types of bars where you go Wow!!!  Kinda reminded me of New Orleans' Bourbon St.  Service was quick.  The only have two restrooms.  My friends had a longer wait on  the men's than the girls.  hahahaah.  They had a dj up top spinning some pretty cool tunes.  Nice vibe, good mixed crowd, I would come back.  A very chill, happy hour type crowd.
author: jason g.

description:
I was happy to finally see someone doing something with this space. The interior is cool, and the bar selection was comprehensive. I was there late on a random tuesday evening, there weren't too many people there, but I could tell they probably get a good happy hour crowd.

go down and check it out!
author: Kai H.

description:
Bar was way packed on a Friday night but then again the place is too darn small. Got drinks spilled on me. Parking sucks but then parking sucks everywhere in the city. Parked for 12 bucks at the lot on howard street. 
There was only one bathroom for each gender. Not my scene...dont think I'll go back.
author: Bren L.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!

First visit on a Friday night with my husband.  Great hip hop, casual atmosphere, friendly people and good drinks.  Didn't hurt that the owner is HOT, cordial and personally served us.  Even the doorman greeted us like old friends and said goodbye with the care and concern of a best friend that you would like to see more often.

Due to the warm experience and approval of my husband, we moved my birthday party from Harlot to John Colins.  WE received the best treatment at an affordable price where I could comfortably sit with friends, blow out the candles on my birthday cake and drink champagne while listening to funky beats with classy people without attitudes.

THANK YOU JOHN COLINS FOR BEING MY FAVORITE NEW LOUNGE SPOT!!!!!
author: Marnie C.

description:
Not worth your time.  Too crowded, not enough seats, bartenders that dont give a damn and mix terrible, flavorless drinks, no good snacks, obnoxious yuppie patrons who have no problem shoving you out of their way and acting like it's your fault, and DJ music that is ho-hum.  

If this is your scene, it's all yours.
author: brewgirl b.

description:
The company I work for does a "Thursty Thursday" each week where we head to different bars around the city.  The first TT just happened to be at John Colins, and I was very impressed.  The exposed brick warehouse feel is great, and I love the paintings and the narrow space.

True, this place gets crowded later on, but I like going here after work.  The mojitos are a must and are some of the best I've had around here.  The bartender even made me a black cherry mojito one night with real cherries, none of that syrup crap... yum!  Overall, I think this place is fun for happy hour but head somewhere else once it gets too full.
author: Jessica C.

description:
I have been here twice now and really love this place. Don't come here if you are looking to dance. John Colins is a nice little lounge that is great for drinking cocktails, chilling and socializing with your friends. It's perfect as a first stop for a night out.

I love that they play underground and old school hip hop. I love that the guys running the door are friendly and address you by name. I love that the owners of this place aren't too cool for school and actually hang out at the bar and talk to their customers. The boot-shaped shot glasses are a very quirky and nice touch.

The later the night gets, the cheesier the crowd gets. I guess that can be pretty typical of any bar you go to in San Francisco. But both of my times here, I found more of the "local-city-type-after-work-crowd" then a "Bridge and Tunnel" flavor. No party busses in sight here. I dug it.

You have to know where you are going when you come to this place. It's slightly off the downtown beaten path.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
I swear I thought maybe Yelp was going hardcore corporate and sponsoring bars.

Just look at that flower by the John Colins name.

Anyway, JC goes in the good but not great category, again Yelp needs to get the half stars going here as this place should be 3.5.  

Despite being in SOMA, it had a very Financial District feel inside, but the vibe was mostly cool.  It's almost tragic this place is so small, given the cool DJ who was also playing great music I was sure there would've been some major dancing going on.  Beers (at least the Trumer Pils and Pyramid Hef) came in at a Mission-esque $4 which is a welcome change to drinking in this area.  The bartenders were actually really cool as well.  After ordering one drink, the bartender remembered my exact order and asked if I'd like the same the next time I came up.

There wasn't much bad about which to write, but for some reason this place didn't strike a chord with me.  One thing that absolutely killed me was the bathroom situation.  I know it's probably considered "classy" to have a bathroom that is just one room with one toilet, but for high volume (male) crowds, two urinals and a crapper works much better.  This way when the guys who have to do some lines (you know what I mean) or take awhile messing with their hair are busy, the rest of us can enjoy getting in, urinating and getting out.  Also the guy/girl who came out of the bathroom with mussed clothes was pretty raunchy, don't you guys have apartments?  

I could also stand to see a better variety of draft beer as well (where can't I get guinness in San Francisco?).  

Overall it was a great night, but I don't know that JC offered too much to make me come back for that I couldn't have experienced/drank somewhere else.  Maybe if Yelp actually sponsors this place, I'll come be a groupie.
author: Steven R.

description:
This is a cute tiny (but cozy) happy hour bar spot that always get a good crowd (CUTE men all dressed in their suits - yum!).  Girlie cocktails choices, beer and a small selection of wine. Unfortunately the wine selection are not good - cheap wines.  It's narrow so when it's crowded there are NO easy way to move from front to back - bit annoying. 

I'm giving it only 3 stars because I don't drink girlie sweet drinks & their wine sucks = only can have hard liquid (not that I'm complaining). And because I hate crowded bars where people are rude & pushes through without saying "excuse me" and spilling drinks.
author: Lily W.

description:
Overall I really like this place.  The DJs are always on point playing great hip hip circa late 80s early 90s.  They also have a projector screen showing and every now and then they'll play this 80's dance show similar to soul train featuring a Run DMC performance.

My two main gripes about this place are:

Every time I go here the DJ always drops hip hop classics, but the crowd here doesn't seem to care.  Considering most places out there play crappy hip hop, I'd wish the crowd would be more in tune to the music or that people came here cuz the music was dope.  If you don't really care much for the music than this won't bother you as much as it bothers me.  Next time they play "Drop" by the Pharcyde, I'd like it if more than just me started bobbing their head to the beat.

We ran into one bartender than was a jackass.  So when you're vying for the attention of the bartender on a crowded weekend, you don't expect to hear "what the fuck do you want?" from a bartender.  Let's see Mr. Bartender.  I'm at a Bar.  It's Friday night.  I'm trying to get your attention since you are behind the counter and taking drinks..I actually just wanted to say how nice your hair looks today!  Anyways,  after I got over my initial shock at this comment, I proceeded to order my drinks and promptly didn't leave the guy tip.  I won't hold this against John Collins as that dick was probably mad at something and taking it out on me, but if it happens again I'll have to take a star off my rating.
author: Brian A.

description:
Forgettable....

When I heard of a bar that plays surf flicks, I wanted to jump right on it and scope it out....so I made my way this weekend.

Funny thing is, I've been here before and did not realize it until I stepped foot inside.  Goes to show I wasn't impressed.

Not really my scene.  While they were playing a surf flick and I was enjoying my company, it was crowded and too wannabe hip for my liking.  The drinks were basic,  DJ was pretty sweet, bathroom was janky....  It wasn't anything too special.  

I won't seek this one out again.
author: Inga B.

description:
I've worked in the area for several years now and this place has always been solid for mid-week and Fri night HH....one of my favorite places to get my favorite drink in the city that is until 2 weeks ago when all the bartenders were chicks. 

I like my gimlets up sans ice and my drink had a ton of ice in it and filled half way...wtf! 

Went back again last friday - opted for beers - seemed like a safe choice and AGAIN the chick bartenders effed it up- they served a warm beer. It's in a friggen bottle...you knew it was warm when ya pulled it outta the fridge...jesus. And we didn't even get the little bowl of snack mix...ugh

You still get 4 staaaas but seriously....bring back the boys behind the bar.
author: Lauren D.

description:
I love this place, I don't know how I haven't written a review of this place yet.  I adore it.  The "cucumber drink" is my all time favorite, it is refreshing and tasty and just plain heavenly.  Srsly.  Some nights when the crowd gets out of work it can get quite packed, but its always a good time.  

I just realized its been a very long time since I have been here, and I kinda miss it.  Was just suggesting it to someone in town for the Oracle thingamajig, and needed the real address.  

If you're in the area and just want a cool, casual place to have some good drinks and chill, this is definitely one to check out.
author: Meredith N.

description:
Only reason this sexy, cute bar didn't get a 4 stars from me was because it was ALL asian people! where are all the cute white boys at?!  The bar itself was dark, not too packed, and had awesome graffiti paintings up on the walls, a small stairway leads up to a smaller room, where the DJ was playing at.. 

 It was playing mash up/hip hop, and playing on the projector wall above everyone was "Breakin'" AWESOME 80's dancemoves and wardrobe? haha my eyes were glued to the vie the entire time i was there!
author: Lulu C.

description:
Hands down one of my favorite happy hour spots downtown. 

I really like the location...it's kinda tucked back away from the main streets and those pesky bridge and tube kids looking for a night out:)

The interior is kinda funky and laid back (they usually have some type of random movie playing). 

The drinks are reasonably priced and the wait staff is super friendly!
author: Summer C.

description: John Colins is a gem of a bar tucked away quietly off the beaten path. With its exposed brick walls, sky high ceilings and cozy leather sofas, there is no better place to undo the deeds of the day with an industrial strength Hangar-based salve.  Sure, the crowd is two parts FiDi, one part SOMA, but I've found even the suits here to be friendly and mellow.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Pretty cool place to hang out.  I might change my review after I've been here more times but for the few times I've been, it's been a solid 4
author: Tony N.

description: Noticed this bar one day on my way to lunch at Zebulon.  It's a great little bar in one of the many random alleyways in the SOMA/Financial District.  Great place for happy hour.  The bartenders are friendly and make great drinks.  I usually don't drink mojitos, but the black cherry mojito I had here changed that for good.  One thing: if you're ever sitting in the little upstairs area, make sure you have a nice cold drink with you because it gets super hot and stuffy when the place is packed.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Nice Happy hour joint, had a few mojitos, I'll probbaly go back this Wed for a friends party... Oh yea.. the bartenders are cool, but can we get a female behind the bar also? :p  

Did that homeboy said he pissed on his pants at JC? ........
author: Daniel W.

description:
I went to this bar for the first time on Saturday night and given the lack of activity around that area, i was surprised on how many people were at the bar.  It's got a cool feel to it with it entrance on a small side street just off a second (almost speakeasy but not quite).  Music was good and drinks were strong.  I'd be giving it 2.5 stars if i had the option though.

Drink complaints:
Like most crowded bars, it took forever to get the bartender's attention, but once i did, the guy that served me and my party was really nice and responsive.  My only complaint was that one of their specials, the lychee soju martini pretty much tasted like sweaty feet.    But I'm pretty sure it wasn't the bartender's fault, just crappy alcohol.  After that I stuck with the Red Bull vodkas which were prepared quite nicely!

Bathroom complaints:
Apparently the Men's room was "temporarily out of service" that night so everyone had to wait to use the one ladies restroom.  When it came near my turn, I decided to just see what all the fuss was about with the guy's toilet and found that the door wasn't locked so i just went ahead and used the perfectly good, perfectly clean toilet.  After I broke through, the rest of the line caught on and started to do the same thing.  I later asked the bartender about it and he confessed that the leave the sign up so the staff can use the restroom if they were in a hurry.  SCAM!!!!  So if youre ever in a "gotta go NOW!" situation and see that sign up, i say go for it, chances are its fine.
author: Jason W.

description:
Popped into John Colins last week for happy hour. The place was mega crowded, lots of office workers ordering blueberry mojitas or something. There was a loft upstairs with a DJ spinning, so we went up there. The folks upstairs looked really bored, I even spied a white boy with a mohawk, who had no clue how ridiculous he looked. Good times.

After the place died down a bit, we went downstairs. The pints are decent, happy hour Guinness goes for $4, tap beers are $3 - pretty good. The place has a sweet painting of San Francisco, would love to get a smaller version for my place.
author: Joseph T.

description:
I think I discovered the secret to having a GREAT happy hour:


 On any given Tuesday, bring a hot friend and a game of SET, and then give monosyllabic answers to any strange male that comes within a 3 foot radius [anyone outside of that radius can be simply ignored on account of ambient noise that makes it incredibly difficult to hear stupid questions].


 EXAMPLE: [lay out SET on a table, and occupy a whole corner of the bar/lounge with your game/bags/etc. Play SET. Don't forget your drinks] 
Random guy: What are you playing? 
You: [silence on account of 'ambient noise'] 
RG [5 min later]: What are you playing? 
You: [silence on account of aforementioned 'noise'] 
RG [5 more min later]: What are you girls playing? 
You: SET 
RG: What is that? 
Your hot friend: A game.


 Works like a charm. :)
author: lizok

description:
John Colins is the best bar in town! I love going there because all the staff remembers me and knows what I like. Every time I have visitors from out of town I bring them here. They enjoy as much as I do! It's a great place for happy hour or get the night started!

Way to go John, Colin, Chelsea, Leilani and Pavel!
author: David C.

description: Came here for Happy Hour on Monday.  Nice and chill.  It's a cozy venue with plenty of seating during HH.  Yummy drinks, pretzels & goldfish.  Street parking is usually pretty easy around this time. Came here for my bday last year too cause I wanted something chill with no dress code.
author: Stacey L.

description: I love this bar. It's so kitschy and intimate. They bump good music and I can't wait to go back!
author: Mika D.

description:
Came here on a Friday night and a Wednesday night with friends....my advice: avoid Fridays! yeah its popular, but way too crowded those nights.

Wednesday was much more chill, conversations more easily had,  and you can actually move around without worrying about spilling your drink on someone. Nice vibe, music, and comfy lounge couches if you could score them.
author: Barbie D.

description: We come here all the time for drinks...Actually, we come here a little too much.  Nice cozy joint located close to Osha and Zebulon.... They mix up some good tasting drinks.. not too strong, not too weak.  You can listen to some good music, watch some surf vids and meet some cool peeps.  The place is a tad bit dark, but overall.. a cool place to meet up with some friends to have some drinkies...
author: Alan N.

description:
Very cool brick and timber space with a nice big bar and cool sitting area in front.  i was there on a Friday night around 7:30 before going to Salt House and the crowd was pretty cool.  There was a super rad Sam Flores art exhibit and another huge piece of the city by one of my favorite artists. 

There is a DJ and the music was really good.  One star off for the preoccupied bartender who was more interested in hitting on some chicks then taking money from me.

Cool bar, I will go back.
author: Tony A.

description:
Went here for happy hour after work. Good news is that it's only a couple blocks away from my work. Bad news is that after 2 drinks I had the biggest tummy ache I've ever had. In fact, I ended up having recurring aches for the next 2 weeks. I think it was acid reflux or something. I don't know if it had anything to do with John Colins, I'm just saying.

I'd still go back though. Seemed like a good place with lots of people. Bar was easy to get to and service was fairly quick. The ladies like to park at the bar, which is great cause they're parked, but they get between me and the alcohol too.
author: Mike C.

description:
I'm really surprised that anyone says this place has good drinks especially since they require alcohol! Weakest drink out of any place I've ever been to.
They get a star for having the "Boom Dizzle" drink.
author: Jess R.

description:
1. 18 bucks for a 14yr old Oban, really? F*CKING REDONKULOUS!

2. THe "vip" area, fun cool neat o woot woot

3. The crowd... eh, i guess if you like mid west guy and gals in the financial district uniform... and I do.

4. The fact that the bar tender was more drunk that I was... on a Wednesday... what the flying founder?

5. Reggae that wasn't all creepy and full of dread locks... thank goodness.

I guess I've been back, but lower your price of your oban, you are trippin, 18 bucks, craaaaazy.
author: danny e.

description:
I've been here on a Friday night and it does get packed. It's a small bar with a big projector screen on the top side wall playing videos which is cool and entertaining. The small stairs on the side lead to where the DJ has all his DJ set -up and its pretty small up there.DJ was playing HIp-hop and some other smatchups....pretty Kool. I dont even think one can go up there.. Ne-Ways there is no cover charge to get it which i thought was pretty cool... The only thing is that no one really dances here.. i didnt see no one dancing...i like the lounging seating on the side so if you get there early this is a cool and nice place to conversate with friends or co-workers and have a couple of drinks.... 

the drinks were good... I didnt have too much to drink but the one that i did drink was pretty good....
author: elia g.

description: This place is really small.  I had a flashback moment cause the dancing area looked like a frat house living room.  Was I at a house party or something?  The drinks are reasonably priced so I can't complain.  3 vodka tonics and a sparkling water for 28 bucks is cool.   The bartenders are super nice and uber cute.  The bar area serves party snack mix but really...who the hell wants to eat from those bowls.  I don't know where everyone's fingers have been.  ICK!
author: Cindy B.

description:
Lifting the curtain to enter the bar felt very MTV-ish..gaggles of GenX hipsters scattered here & there in their clicks, casting cool glances at you while scoping the crowd. 

The revealed brick interior & skylight cast a nice light on all during happy hour. And as you drank further into the night, much like my 2 gf's & I, the candles were lit & then a sexy mood spread over everyone.

The staff was entertaining, flirty, & pretty damn sexy. Meow. 

Minus a star for not having SKYY90...oh wait, I finished off the last bottle.
author: jen w.

description: Came here on a Saturday night and it wasn't too bad. Waited in line for about 20 minutes with another female friend. When we almost got to the front, a bouncer took us out of line and let us in. It's good to be a girl. =) $5 Absolut shots were cool. Crowd was pretty much Asian and White. The place wasn't too packed, which I really appreciated. Good music (mostly hip hop, top 40's, and reggae), but small dance floor. I definitely wouldn't mind coming back for a night out.
author: Diana Y.

description: Super crowded and a long wait if you get there at 1030-1100, be prepared to wait quite a while. Music is a great mix of old and new. The bar is PACKED on busy nights but they will serve you eventually and the drinks will be mixed well.
author: Tara D.

description: I've been a fan of happy hour at John Colins and I'm an even bigger fan now after throwing a little shindig here for the boyfriends birthday.  We had the upstairs Sunset Lounge reserved with bottle service and had a grand ole time!  The service was on hit.  They came up and checked on us so many times and made sure everything was up to par.  We had 2 bottles with all the mixers (red bull, sprite, cranberry juice, pineapple juice, soda water and all the fixings) at a reasonable price.  The birthday boy had a blast so mission accomplished.  Thanks John Colins! You guys rock!
author: Michelle D.

description: This is a bar where prep meets art. Tucked away in a SoMa alley, this popular neighborhood lounge attracts a hodge podge of characters from the over-dressed cougar women in their high stiletto heels to the tight jeaned, plaid topped hipster designers from south beach to the "suits" from the financial district stopping by for an after work drink. This bar is always crowded and the music spun from the mezzanine level (kind of like Boards of Canada meets El Ten Seven) can be a little loud. But it's a popular bar in the area that's worth checking out if you like scenes.
author: Alex H.

description:
Good. not great.  You get what you pay for, or in this case, not pay for.  Prices of the drinks are resonable, though I think the drinks are a bit watered down... no cover, so... there you go!

I loved the bondage/spanking 50's movie (semi clothed) they were showing.  Crowd is decent. 

We had a good time hanging out with our friends people watching; and that's really all that matters.
author: Chon Q.

description:
I know, I know, I'm the low-voting bastard tonight, but here's the deal:  This place isn't too bad.  Considering how few decent places there are to grab a drink downtown, especially later in the evening, this place does alright.    The problem is it's way to crowded, way too "look at my striped shirt", and on the weekends it's god-awful (think bouncer and velvet rope - ie - ghetto, as it were!)

Later on a weeknight, this is a 4 star place, but the rest of the time it's pretty undesirable.

I miss Mr Ralphs!!!
author: Nick A.

description: Cool bar.  I was attending a conference near by and went on both Sunday and Monday evening.  It was quiet, but that's understandable for a Sunday and Monday.  Good drinks at a good price and a nice couch area to hang out (I bet on a busy night it's almost impossible to get a seat though).  I would like to visit again, but on a Friday or Saturday evening.
author: Tony H.

description:
Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy hot chick Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy older lady Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy hippie Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Mick Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Dj Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy bartender Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy Fratboy.

Gotta give an extra star to the bartender who saw my shirking grimaces and gave me a free drink. I also gotta say, i may have stuck around for the pretty cheap Happy Hour prices. I just couldnt take the constant Hugo Dark Blue versus Happy for men cologne battle inside my nose.

It was like a misty flammable, less threatening version of West Side Story.
author: Mick F.

description: I love this place!  Super cool loungie vibe, great drinks, cool art, and bartenders that know how to make drinks.  Looks like it would be a great place to have a private party too as there are a couple of VIP lounges separated from the main floor.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Adam S.

description: Great bar in SOMA.  I came here for a friends birthdays last night and it was perfect for a medium sized gathering.  I was skeptical at first as we made our way down the alley, but once inside I was loving the old school hip hop, sleek atmosphere and kind bartenders.
author: Stacy R.

description: I came here for happy hour on Friday night. It was bumping. Definitely a yuppie crowd. I liked that they had a cocktail window which allowed you by pass the crowd at the bar. Some good music was playing. The drinks were strong although it didn't seem they had any happy hour specials.
author: Polina S.

description:
Kew kew Kewl, this place is kewl.

I like it, although it's not really a club, more of a bar, in my eyes, they BUMP the music at about 10ish or so, fine with me, but still it really isn't a club. The crowd here is cool, seems like it's a mix of people who work in the Fidi and are out drinking after a hard days work......
author: S A.

description: 1 star for good drinks, 1 for great prices, 1 for the sweet bartenders and everyone that works there and 1 more 'cuz I work just down the block so my favorite happy hr spot is just a hop, skip, and jump away. I generally get here at 5ish and before I know it and probably a few too many drinks later its 10 o'clock and the party's still goin!  While I wouldn't spend my Friday or Saturday night here its a pretty good spot to do some predrinking (esp. if you're going to Harlot later cuz the drinks at John Colins are better, cheaper,and stronger), and happy hr is never a disappointment.
author: laura q.

description:
I've been here twice and both times were great. This is the new John Colins (at Minna and New Montgomery) and the space is way bigger. It still gets crowded but not like the old John Collins. The decor is very nice and it has a great vibe. I haven't had any of their cocktails (only wine for me) but my friends were all happy with their drinks. 
I had to take a star away because there is no cellphone reception which makes it difficult when you're trying to coordinate with people, but otherwise this place is great!
author: Roz B.

description:
I find it interesting when i don't go somewhere ever...then i find myself there more often than not.  Such is John Collins.
It started out after my first DYL.  Went to John Collins afterward, had two stiff drinks, and stumbled out.  Happy hour prices were no longer, but i enjoyed the scene, and never had to wait very long for the bathroom.
Flash forward 5 days, we meet up with some other yelpers for happy hour pre-Supper Club.  Thanks to some awesome thread writing by Matthew S. we got a pretty good crew there and i was able to chat with fellow yelpers in a quieter environment, and with just a few more seats, we would have been perfect.  This time the drinks were stiff and cheap.
Yesterday, less than a week later, I met up for some one on one cocktail hour...also enjoyable.
I think that this might be a new favorite happy hour.  Men in suits, down the street from the job, cheap drinks, good conversation.  Sounds almost perfect to me.
author: Lauren F.

description:
a trusty little spot after work.  

small but with enough seating along the walls and tables to rest your drink.  cool but laid back.

and its got a trusty loyal following.  so much so that even with the bathrooms and water out of order on a saturday night...the place was still packed.

we left harlot after cheering dj solomon a happy b-day and headed over to john colins.  but no bathroom is a buzzkill for this lil lady so we stayed but a wee bit before heading to xyz.

minor glitch so once they have it all fixed up, i'll be back sipping a drink in a jiffy.
author: Anh V.

description:
terrible service. examples: 
1) went to bar, stood at the end for a while. bartender finally comes over and takes our drink order while he's delivering another patron's drinks. gets that patron's change, and turns to the dude who had JUST approached the bar, and takes his order! and proceeds to make that dude his 2 mojitos! THEN we got our drinks. wtfuck? 
2) ordered a bourbon (their well is jim beam, and i'm fine with that.) and soda. bartender pours a maker's mark and soda.  tries to charge me $7 for it. 
3) bartender takes drink order, and goes to the computer at the end of the bar and starts changing the music. waited a few minutes for him to finish before he poured my drink. 

i used to bartend. when it's slammed, you don't stand behind the bar and do shots with the other bartenders, with your back to the crowd. it was like a mini-frat party back there. hey dude, check out that hot chick at the end of the bar. 

also, too crowded. nowhere to stand that's not in the way. 

maybe i just shouldn't go to places like this. maybe i'm like the vegetarian i've mocked who writes a disparaging review of the house of prime rib. why would you go to the house of prime rib if you're vegetarian? and then write a negative review? that's just fucking stupid. so maybe... 

vegetarian : house of prime rib :: sarah : john colins
author: sarah g.

description: This is one of my favorite happy hour places. It has a relaxing atmosphere with great decor and their lychee-tinis will make you forget about that long day you had at work. And not to mention they have bottomless pretzel bowls. What more can you ask for?! =)
author: Maryann B.

description: This review is for the NEW John Collins, I like it! I like the atmosphere, cozy but not too small. It's like a secret spot in the alley of Minna. I was there on a Tuesday night, not too crowded, not empty, just right! If this place gets crowded, it might get too hot inside. I had wine, friend had a STRONG rum and diet coke.
author: Karen T.

description: I love having drinks after work here with friends. We meet tons of new friends here. People are friends and drinks are reasonably priced.
author: Do L.

description: The location is great and the decor unbeatable, the crowd though is your typical group of after work, financial district, suit and tie type of clientele. At one point I was a bit confused and thought we were in the Marina, but soon realized that simple mix up was due to the tequila shots previously ingested at a very inexpensive price. No room to dance but we made do with what little space we had near the back, close to the bar (of course!).
author: Stephanie J.

description: Soho meets Soma here on Natoma. Casual and class bounce together to the smooth grooves of the DJ as you sip on sophisticated cocktails. Leave your pretension at the door at this loungey,hip, and lively joint. I strongly advise a visit to this up and coming new hot spot.
author: Cassidy w.

description: One of my favorite places to lounge in SF! I've gone to John Collins on a Wednesday, a Thursday, and a Saturday and on all of those days they had really good music playing. The crowd is a perfect mix of people from all over and the bartenders are always really nice. They will chat it up with you and come up with different concoctions for you to try. The only complaints that I have are that on the busier nights, its hard to find a spot to sit and that one of the bartenders made a really bad dirty martini once...but hey, it happens.
author: Jessica S.

description: Homemade hot pepper infused tequilla shot called 'El Muerte.' Holy shit you have to let it kick your ass at least once. Other than that, I'm sort of lukewarm on this place. It's always super crowded at happy hour and they don't have a whole lot of seating. Not a bad place, just not my favorite. The have an original Sam Flores painting and some other cool art, so I guess that makes it okay in my book.
author: Michael E.

description: Sexy , sultry , romantic .... just a really cool bar , with a lovely barman ( he put a flower in my stella now that deserves five stars in itself! ). Definitely a sexy bar in Soma ... great for being with friends .... being on a 'date' ( although the people who have got to know me know how much i despise the whole dating thing) or just for chilling after work.
author: Amy W.

description: I enjoyed checking out John Colins and had a good time for happy hour while meeting up with some friends.  Decently priced drinks and good crowd.  It wasn't too crowded when I went but I hear the place can get pretty packed.  I really liked the ambience of the place...except for the all-black bathroom with super-intense lighting, so you can see all the wetness everywhere...that was pretty gross.
author: Justin L.

description: Oh mylanta, what an interesting melange of people. Okay, okay, some nights, I'm sure, are probably more homogeneous (i.e., a bunch of suits and single women looking for a suit) than others. So, my co-worker turned art confidant and friend turned me onto this Natoma joint because they constantly have art hanging against the brick wall, which saves any place for me. You know, there's something to look at if there's nothing interesting in the room. Overall, it seems like a pretty laid back place and I would return for an art opening.
author: Dorothy S.

description: I walked in here with a group of folks, and we walked right back out.  I could see coming here with a date and hiding out in the crowd, but there was no way we were all going to get drinks and be able to talk in that loud zoo.  I liked the bricks and the decor, but that's about all I can rate at this time.
author: Andi T.

description: This bar is pretty chill, it has a great vibe because the people there are really friendly.  I feel like I can go in on any given night and find a great conversation that I can spark.  Also very close to BART so I can bring my surly ass home safe and sound!
author: Harry F.

description: I dig the sky lights.  I dig the corner couches.  I dig the Hoegaarden beer.  I dig the bartenders. I dig the happy hour.  Dig it.
author: ellyk E.

description: This is a cool little bar, nice interior and great signature cocktails. It can definitely get a little crowded sometimes. If you can sneak out of the office early enough to grab the upstairs loft, I suggest doing so... wait, maybe I shouldn't have said that...
author: Donna V.

description: Yay.  Great drinks, cool space, and the sweetest staff I've ever seen at a bar (I think it helps that most are the owners).  Colin was walking around talking to people and picking up empty glasses.  So nice.  No cool-kid bs here; it's the kind of place where it seems like you could drink way too much and someone would make sure you got home ok.
author: Pammy C.

description: I love the Weekly Yelp! I went to JC after seeing it mentioned, what a cool find, nice work Neyah (the person who reviewed it below)! Smooth scene, I went right after work on Tuesday so it wasn't too busy, but I have a feeling it will the place to be soon. I of course had to order a John Collins, but my friend tried a Tom Collins. Next time, I'm going to ask for Nish Collins to see what happens.
author: April M.

description: Spacious and new, John Collins definitely got a face lift.  Came here on a weekday, and it was not busy at all.  I miss the cozy feeling of the old JC, but I'm sure on weekends, the space here is much appreciated.  It still smells like fresh paint inside, but otherwise, still a chill and comfortable place to hang out and catch up with friends.
author: Maxine C.

description: happenin' happy hour....various folks.....sippin' beers after a long day of work.....busy....packed....but...good place to meet up with some buddies after work...sip a beer or two...and decide where to go next.....$3 beers....
author: Hen A.

description: I know this place can get super packed, but I don't care. The bartenders are friggin amazing. I've never had such great service from someone who didn't know me. Every single bartender took great care of us, remembered our orders, and offered a smile each time we went up. Excellent!
author: Monika M.

description: Update: This bar has a nice restroom.  That's all.
author: Christina S.

description: It's okay as far as bars go.  My Sidecar was too sweet and not boozey enough though and that's never a good thing for me.  There were a lot of "like OH MY GOD" chicks and " Sup Brah?" dudes there but my girl Patticakes was DJing a set and I had to represent her and support the incomparable style she's got.  I wouldn't seek this place out but if my friends DJ there then I'll roll through out of respec'.
author: Jill D.

description: The bartenders were pretty awesome (and sex-say)!  They would even notice you past the counter whores who never moved.  Yay for great bar service!  And yay for cheap happy hour drinks!  The space was also cool - one big open room with exposed brick and projected video.  The place was packed, but we were placed in the loungy upstairs area.  Score!  Also, thanks to the girl who let me use the girl's bathroom.  I was fast, right?  And I didn't even pee on the toilet seat.
author: Vicente G.

description: This is a pretty cool happy hour spot. It's got potential to be a cooler spot if people went there on Friday nights. The drinks always seem pretty strong and I can't seem to recall ever walking out of the place sober. It seems like good pre-111 Minna spot.
author: Srinivas R.

description: Decent happy hour,  great bartenders. I really like the feel of this place. Sort of swanky but not pretentious.  Kicked off a star for the random dudes we always seem to meet here though.  And by random I mean the type of dude who talks about his cat's funeral. Or his dead mother. That sort of random.
author: Amanda B.

description: Where do I begin? How about the massive anxiety this place causes? Or the fact that it's 1000 degrees? Or that there is no place to stand? Or that it is impossible to get a drink. Maybe I came here at the completely wrong time (Saturday night at 11pm), but I really have no desire to see all the "good" facets that people are raving about.
author: Veronica W.

description:
ok, so what the hell happened to this place!?!??!?!

it used to be a cool bar you could grab a few drinks at with coworkers, but in the last year, it has morphed into this pretentious, crowded and horrible place to get cocktails after a stressful day in the office.  Instead of being greeted by good music and a chill atmosphere, you literally walk into a meat market of i-bankers and the chicks that want to snag one to secure their financial future.  

The last 2 times I went here, i thought i maybe caught it on an off night. but this last time was the 3rd strike. the instant i walked through the door with my friend, we looked at each other and were quickly reminded of why i dont like this bar. 

too bad because it used to be a great place.  

The drinks are still good. that is, if you can even get one.  expect to have to fight your way through 7 layers of people to get to a bartender that will just ignore you.  There are plenty of places to sit so i'm still trying to figure out why folks just camp out at the bar for 4 hrs straight.  Maybe that's prime seating for screening the clientele and handing out business cards without any real effort.
author: Carol T.

description: Great happy hour, some of SF's best DJs providing toons and friendly owners and staff that know how to run a bar. It's hard to beat. Sure you get an after-work crowd, but what do you expect with its proximity to downtown. Nevermind the haters (EMO EMO EMO EMO EMO EMO EMO EMO EMO EMO EMO EMO EMO EMO EMO) and go check JC out for yourself.
author: Chris R.

description: Excellent drinks and good ambiance.   After many years of abuse, my jaded liver can only handle "high-end" libations and John Colins did not disappoint!  My only vent is that the bouncer repeatedly *shushed* us on our way in and out of the bar.  Something about the neighborhood condo's.... Whatever!  I don't think we were *that* drunk.... ***hiccup*** ... or were we?
author: lulu p.

description:
Below is the email correspondence that resulted in a happy hour spent at John Colins:
Scott: Drinks on Friday?
Me: Totally.
Scott: Any ideas on the place?
Me: ....Um? I've gotten really bad at this picking places thing. You have any ideas?
Scott: How about John Colins? Some people at work recommend it. (Mind you, everyone I work with is under the age of 25.)
Me: Sure. Might be good for some laughs. 

So, of course, after this is decided I proceed directly to Yelp and Yelp the shit out of John Colins and am confronted with information both alarming and comforting. Crowded (alarming), good happy hour (comforting), frat boys (alarming), cool space (comforting), lots of bad cologne (alarming). Anyway, the decision was made and I really do need to try to go out to new and different places every now and then. 

I sent Scott one last email reminding him to splash on the the Drakkar Renoir and headed down to Natoma. 

I was greeted by a wall of people and loud sounds and unless those sounds are some seriously rockin' rock and roll, this combination makes me grumpy. But I soldiered my way to the bar with thin hopes for decent gin. 

Oh! Lucky day! They have Hendricks AND No. 209. Furthermore, the bartender who prepared my yummy martini for me was friendly, efficient and made a killer cocktail. The entire bar staff were not only clearly good at their jobs, but they also seemed to enjoy working there, which, take it from me, is the key ingredient in a good bartender. Everyone behind the bar had great energy and a little flare, but nothing flashy. Once I had staked my claim at the stooless bar, I had a chance to examine the room. 

A wide skylight filled the room with evening light, comfy-looking setups of cocktail tables, banquets and footstools comprised the seating in the narrow bar. The brick walls were hung with decent art, predominantly featuring American Bulldogs (I think) in a variety of poses and sizes. The crowd was hit and miss. I heard a lot about shoes and purses and guys from the ladies bumping into me on the right and the Warriors game was on, so the masculinity was at an expected high. The crowd was a little young, but everyone was definitely out of college and solidly in the workforce, which is encouraging. 

Scott and his lady met me shortly. The excellent bar service persevered despite the hefty number of people jammed into the bar (the sign on the wall said maximum capacity 49. Whatever.) and when Mary traded in an experimental cocktail that was too bitter, the bartender was void of attitude and graciously replaced the offending libation. 

I will certainly go back to John Colins. Hell, I had a good enough time to bust open the iron-clad martini rule and have three instead of two. But when I do go back, it'll be on a Tuesday night. It would be a fabulous place to meet a couple of friends for a weekday nightcap--but I think I'll skip the happy hour.
author: Sage R.

description:
another rainy day, another swanky lounge in the city. will it ever end?

i need to get into the lounge furniture business.
author: frisco j.

description: When I ordered my jameson neat with a side of ginger, the bartender somehow knew I was a fellow drink slinger without me having to say a word. About 1/2 hour later, he came over to me with a shot for him and I and said, "you should have told me you were a bartender."  I was in shock to say the least.  I've been to this bar 3 times, and each time I've received free drinks from the barstaff.  It's my new "cheers" even though I don't think they know my name.  Even the security guy was a sweetcheeks.  Venue is chic, yet you can be dressed up or down and not feel awkward.
author: Michelle C.

description: If you like waiting in line or large crowds, this place is for you!
author: Tim G.

description: Came here for a b-day party and they had reserved the corner on the right hand side after walking in. It was a cool space and they bubbly was flowing. The vaulted ceilings help give it a more open/bigger feel. It can get crowded since the space isn't very big but the vibe is super cool. You have to be careful when carrying your drinks after leaving the bar since that area gets super crowded. They were playing Flash Dance on the large projector and the DJ had some good jams. If you don't feel like walking or driving around for parking then just park in one of the adjacent lots for $10.
author: Adriana G.

description: The bartenders here are far and away the best in the city, as far as speed, attention to the customers, and friendliness. I don't go in for those fruity drinks they have on the menu, but the $2 happy hour miller high lifes will keep me going there until the place burns down or my liver explodes.
author: mario b.

description: ok, this is my favorite bar in the entire city! for one it's close to my home, for two the atmosphere is upbeat and friendly- can i compare it to Cheer's, well sorta ..."i want to go where everybody knows my name, and they're always glad you came..."  the scene, not Cheers- but the staff, makes you feel welcome! They play cool music, have old movies or videos playing on the wall- drinks are not badly priced. Happy hour specials are pretty good, some nights there are $2 beers. Snacks, well if you get hungry the only thing you are going to be chewing on it your pinapple piece, your cherry, your lemon zest, possibly your mint sprig- only snack is some goldfish accompanied by pretzels in a bar cup.
author: Ricquel N.

description: If you find yourself South of Market toward the end of a workday, check out happy hour at Jon Colins just across the street from Zebulon on Natoma. The vibe is casual and funky and the folks crowd the smallish space and are generally a really amiable group. Lighting is dim and decor is minimal, but the fun globe lights, bright Christmas-type lights near the high ceiling, upstairs DJ and lounge area and hip bartenders add a lot to the ambiance. Happy hour runs from 5 to 7pm and features $4 well drinks, Guiness and Boddington's, $3 imports and draft beers, $2 domestic bottled beers, and $1 off all other drinks. Wine by the glass runs around $6 for happy hour and the list is short but I imagine you'll find something you enjoy. The Pinot Grigio was refreshing and light. There aren't any food offerings but there are many tasty spots nearby. Enjoy.
author: Leah B.

description: They have a new location but it's still my favorite bar in SF. This place rocks, I'm just a little bummed its more crowded now, but hey, thats good for them...keep it going John
author: Nick J.

description: This is a really slick lounge-ish bar. Big comfy chairs, cool music, strong drinks. Surprisingly relaxing. I've been there on weeknights and it's not crowded at all which I love. Definitely worth checking out if you're looking to have a conversation and not a shouting match.
author: David K.

description: So these days, I pick bars that don't make me feel like a grandma---I'm 30, but I think a young 30; some of you 20-somethings just make me feel ancient.   What did I like about this place---it was ok, decent crowd, decent music, decent drinks and drink prices.   What I didn't like was having to wait outside to get in, and the bouncer trying to play that game of making my guy friends wait longer, since we were short on girls.  I know they were probably trying to add to the mystique of the bar, making it look cooler than it is, but come on people, the bar is in an alley!  No one who's not specifically going to this place will notice how many fools are waiting outside!  Anyway, at least after all that, there was no cover.  I'm too old to pay a cover to go to some random bar.  And there was space to sit.  Us old ladies need to rest our tootsies.
author: Danielle B.

description: I don't know why I don't come here more often- I really love the overall vibe of this place and it's so close to work and home.  I like the seating against the wall, the dim-lighting, the quirky art and the fact that they have thick curtains around the door- which keeps the cold air out of the front area (why don't more bars and restaurants do this...makes so much sense).  I'll have add JC into the mix more often.
author: Sonia S.

description:
Not a place I'd go back to.  It was mediocre in most regards and some aspects were negative.  In such a high traffic area, there's no reason to go to a substandard bar. Went here because Flytrap was closed for a private party.

Atmosphere:
Atmosphere was mediocre.  Visual aesthetics were fine, nothing great and nothing wrong with the look or layout.  There were a couple of tables in the front corner and seating for about 7 people.  Lots of seats at the bar, some secondary bar seating at another counter opposite the bar.  There is a small dance floor (would fit maybe 6-10 people) in front of some turn tables.  A DJ was at the decks, though the music selection was pretty generic.

Drinks:
Prices were average.  Alcohol selection was average.  Drinks were poured a bit weak, and not mixed particularly well (had to ask to have one of three remade).
author: mike b.

description:
Walking in to a bar by myself is not always my favorite thing to do, especially when a private Internet start-up holiday party, of which I am not a part, accounts for 3/4 of the clientele.

Unbeknownst to me, my friend was running late in meeting me for happy hour, so I walked in to John Colins and looked high and low for her with zero success.  I must have looked scared, or intimidated, or uncomfortable, because one of the bartenders (John? Colin?) motioned for me to come over.  Upon his greeting me, I assured him that I wasn't a skirted spy on a reconnaissance mission to steal the secrets of the start-up--I felt like I looked suspicious.  He laughed and offered me a drink, and I felt immediately more at ease.

The happy hour at John Colins is a great deal, the architecture and the art is, for lack of a better word, cool, and the staff (John? Colin?) are even cooler.
author: Hannah J.

description: It's true, the crowd was just "meh," but the attentive bartenders and dark-but-not-seedy decor are bringing me back. Good location for after-work cocktails.
author: Gretchen T.

description: Inexpensive, unpretentious, cool bar with a good vibe and friendly staff. The only real downside is that it can get very, very loud, so you'd better bust out grandpa's old ear trumpet to make sure you can still mingle ;)
author: Hazel Grace D.

description: I love coming here after a stressful week at work with great friends.  The only drawback is that it gets super crowded with the FiDi crowd and its a pretty tiny place, I tell ya!!  Gotta get there early to score a table so you don't stand shoulder to shoulder with total strangers.  The place is known for their flavored mojitos and I personally love the guava mojito that this one bartender made for me the last time I was there.  Super good and definitely a creeper drink since it tastes just like juice!  My new favorite spot for Happy Hours now!! :)
author: Mina L.

description: John Colins Smith is his real name, basically Mr. Smith's older brother!  It's a great bar to stop by during happy hour right before you go home (and shower then change into your sexy party getup) and head over to Smith's for the real happening hours.  They both have the same crowd, same ambience, and AWESOME bartenders.
author: Wendy H.

description: SOMA gem. As usual, I prefer the off-nights. It's a really nice space, friendly staff, attractive crowd. The location makes it hassle free to get there and park and it's in one of the least shady areas of the SOMA. I wish they had a better drink selection, maybe the bartender the night I went was new...
author: J-Meoww W.

description: My favorite bar in SOMA!  It's a great spot for happy hour.  I like the fact that they have a unique selection of beers: red stripe, tiger, hoegaarden, ohana, etc. It also has a great cozy atmosphere with surfer movies playing on the wall and a DJ spinning up in the loft.  The bartenders are friendly and attentive. There's usually a nice mix of people from fin district suits to artsy SOMA folks. Love the cheddar goldfish and pretzels too!
author: Andrew C.

description:
i love the brick walls, and the music was great on saturday night.  the mix of old school and current hip hop was class.  it was extremely stuffy on that hot friday night.  they desperately need ventilation or fans in the back.  luckily our bachelortte party snagged seats along the walls right near the door.

the bartenders need to do a better job pushing out the drinks.  there were tons of people, and they were dilly dallying around and taking their time mixing the cocktails.  luckily i befriended one of the bartenders, and was able to get my drinks a bit quicker.
author: Sheri N.

description: I want to like this place.  It's a beautiful bar, well decorated, with various "sections" and could have a great vibe.  However it's WAY too loud and the bar service was terrible.  I waited well over 20 minutes to get a drink.  I wish they would make up their mind and either be a dance club (as that's what they are trying to go for with their crazy loud music with speakers 5 feet from your ears), or the happy hour lounge, which is the design, but so not conducive to any conversation.  I would give it another chance on a non Friday night happy hour, but the rude bar tenders put me off completely.
author: Nolwenn S.

description: GREAT FOR HAPPY HOUR. No yuppies. It's a very chill spot with very nice bartenders (some bartenders are such bitches now days) and great decor. The venue is a little small but there's adequate seating for its size. I'd highly recommend getting there early because it can get really crowded.
author: Jamie Q.

description: This place does get super packed...but if you get there early you are in BUSINESS! I can't say enough nice things about the bartenders. There is one dude that always serves me and he is SO friendly. I tell him everytime I go in there because he always delivers fast service, a nice smile and a friendly attitude! That's what I like to see buddy!
author: Jen G.

description:
yuppie bar nestled among the crowded soma nightlife.
easy to get in, no cover.  small dance floor
small cozy atmosphere, little loud, relaxed entry, projected images over the entry, they were showing some old school breakdancing...
can be a little crowded but gives off the feeling of a hip happy hour social place, the type of place to meetup before moving elsewhere.
author: Rob C.

description: Cool bar, great service from the bartenders, someone stole my drink off the bar, seriously are you that bridge & tunnel.
author: Rob H.

description: Cool happy hour spot. Very chill place, cool bartenders, kinda small, comfy couches, music, and drink specials during HH. Ladies get a orchid flower on their drink - cute touch. They serve pretzels and goldfish as bar snacks - awesome! Close to other bars too so you can hop around.
author: Linda C.

description: Chill vibe on a Saturday night...which is hard to do when the place is packed. Usually you feel like fighting people when you're that packed in. But nope, everyone there was cool.  I've always encountered a good mix of people here...most aren't out to get some ass. There was a live band playing R+B and soul music of their own and also of their interpretations of various Top 40 songs. I was still able to boogie given that I was totally in a food coma from dinner. Also, they have great artwork...don't forget to check out the walls when you're in there.
author: Mary L.

description: This bar is way to packed at HH. If you like waiting 20 mins for a drink, getting shoved around in a sea of people, screaming at your friends so they can hear you and sweating, this place is definitely for you. This place will move again, but I don't think it will be to another location.
author: Jim S.

description: Well, what can I say? It's a bar lounge with a d.j. spinning music from the second floor. The crowd was mature and friendly and the drink selection was good. It's good for chilling out with friends while enjoying the ambiance before heading out to another location. It's just not too exciting to hang out here for more than two hours.
author: herm p.

description: Love this bar. Great atmosphere. Very upbeat and well lit. Get here early on a busy night as you might have to wait to get in during happy hours. Gin and tonic is great! Their specialty cocktails are pretty awesome. I will they made a better mojito but I'm not complaining especially with their prices. If you come when it's pretty quiet, it's actually quite relaxing. Bartenders are friendly. I like the free servings of goldfish and pretzels. Tossing them in the air and trying to catch them semi-drunk is always an amusing thing to watch.
author: Jonathan L.

description: My friends and I came for happy hour on a Friday night. Mixed crowd, charming decor and not pretentious at all - great atmosphere. However, it took an eternity to get a drink and we opted to stand by the door because it was unbearably hot everywhere else but there.
author: tessie n.

description: Okay, it's obvious that I'm going to give this place 5 stars. Why? First of all, because it is a relative of Wish, my other favorite SoMa bar. Same great crowd, same amazing happy hour drink specials, and same great attention to detail that only owners John & Collin can offer. Secondly, they have boot shaped shot glasses. Who doesn't want to do a shot out of a boot? And an added bonus? John told me that he had a recent Nish sighting just last night. Don't get me wrong, I will still always be a fan of the ladies over at Wish that have served me well for so many years. But John Collins will definitely be be next up on my list.
author: Melissa W.

description: What a posh place....HOTTIES everywhere!!!!  I worked Oracle Open World & maybe that has a bit to do with all the options as far as men.  Oracle put on an after party @ 111 Minna Gallery, which started at 7.  While we had time to kill, the door guy recommended us having a drink @ John Colins.  I really enjoyed the crowd.  It wasn't too overly crowded, but did attract the right people.   My friend & I thought it was a cool place & would love to go back. Not to mention, we met some hot men sitting right next to us @ the bar.....you never know what you're gonna find ;)
author: Carrie P.

description: Noisy, but great music.  Crowded, but awesome upstairs area if you can get it with a bunch of friends/co-workers. This place is really fun to hang out in, lots of great things to look at - people, art, even film!
author: Katie U.

description: Overpriced cocktails. I would pay for a $10 cocktail anytime, except in a place that is borderline a sports bar where the bartenders are having to wear advertising to promote alcohol sponsors. Either one or the other guys. Subsidize the drink costs by advertising to me. Or create a classy atmosphere and charge more for the drinks. But not both cause that's just lame. If they don't fix this, I recommend going to 111 Minna around the corner instead.
author: Esso E.

description: Great on a Friday night.  The place was busy, but not super crowded.  The music was also great, and the bartenders were really nice.  I think I even saw two of them dancing in sync to the music at one point :)  I would go back again.
author: Akshay S.

description: I had heard a lot about this bar, so I had high expectations.  And, they were met!  This is a really cool, chill, interesting bar.  I like the decor, the warm brick walls, even the quirky dog paintings on the wall.  The people who were there weren't cookie cutter San Franciscans either.  The bartender made some delicious lemon drop shots, with fresh lemons.  On another night, the bartender was into my girlfriend, so lucky us, we got free shots.  I came here later on in the night, so it was not the Happy Hour scene.  It was not too crowded at first, yet not empty either.  Later on in the night it got pretty packed.  Good times.  They play really good music here, and I loved the 80's breakers on the flat screen.
author: Sarah F.

description: I'm a fan of the John Colins. I'm originally from SoCal and, yes, I do surf. So it is nice to roll in to JC and have a pint, rap with some friends and then watch surf flicks at the same time. It's a nice oasis for a beach kid living in San Frandisco.
author: Chris G.

description: Cool little loungy bar that is down the street from where I work so I am often stopping by for post work cocktails.  The crowd is alway unpretentious and is pretty low key.
author: Cameron M.

description: I went to John Colins with some coworkers who knew the owners from back in the day when they were at Wish. John (1/2 of John Colins) is a cool surfer guy with a great vibe. He made me this great cucumber drink that you must try if you like mojitos. A great happy hour alternative to 111 Minna. It's much cozier and has that hip SOMA neighborhood bar feel.
author: Connie C.

description: I have mixed emotions. Happy Hour there, I'm not a big fan of.  The bartenders in the evening are cool and on Tuesday nights they have hip hop with Dawn of Sound. It's a chill environment Tuesday nights. The nights I like to go. Beers were like 3 or 4 bucks. It's worth going on Tuesday nights.
author: monika l.

description:
nice atmosphere and bartenders.  excellent happy hour.  gets a little crowded on friday after work though.  try it on another night if you don't like crowds

they have a really excellent alcohol selection. even their well liquor is hig quality for the money.
author: Steve S.

description: Now I know where all those Marina girls and boys go after work for happy hour. Blah.
author: Richie K.

description:
mmm john and colins are hot and don't mind taking pictures with a bunch of drunk people. 
that being said, i really had a great time at this bar. met some people for happy hour and before i knew it... it was 10p. bartenders are extremely nice, the place is pretty spacious, and it really wasn't pretentious at all. i talked to EVERYONE from the trendy/bohemian chicks to the suits who had just come off of work in the financial district. nobody was bitchy or snobby. i loved it! also, john collins has this great signature drink called the sweet laylahni (spelling?). sake, mint, some juice of unknown origin, and an edible flower? i'm in. i liked this place because it was comfortable and friendly. you really don't find happy hour spots where you can stay for longer than happy hour. i think i'll make this a regular friday thing.
author: Aly L.

description: just had my birthday happy hour here last friday and it was a hit! the nice people at JC reserved me a table without charge (before 8 pm the deal is first come first serve but mine was already reserved when i got there and they didn't take my money when i said prior to the event that i would put a credit card down to reserve the table) and JC let us bring in food at the 8 pm transition range to fuel us for the rest of the night! we ordered domino's and had the rest of the champagne (good selection of roederer and schramsburg but they were out of moet -- please add veuve to the selection and im yours for life!) and were ready to go out all night.  while my body hurt the next day, in the moment, i was happy as can be!
author: Cathy L.

description: Ventured into the cute neighborhood bar on Natoma St and I liked the interior with the big palm trees. It wasn't so crowded which made it less stuffy which was cool. Bouncer was friendly, interesting people and a laid back, unpretentious bar.
author: Yan M.

description: Good happy hour spot in SOMA.  Chill decor backed up with solid bartenders.   Been down here a few times, always had a good time.    Gets crowded real quick.
author: Dan G.

description: Cheers to Colins for building a stylish brick bar with trendy (but welcoming) atmosphere and some of the hardest-working bartenders in the City. Went here on a Thursday night, so as far as weeknight hangouts I'd say it's a winner. They also serve Tahitian beer, which I had never encountered before.
author: Andrew K.

description: Six girls at Harlot, having a good time. Telephone call from 3 male friends - they've been waiting outside for half an hour and the bouncer just told them Harlot is at full capacity and they can't come in. Girls look around and see that the bouncer is actually telling the truth (unlike at Slide or Vessel, damn those lying, pretentious bouncers).
