Good friends that we are, we leave to meet our male compadres and head over across the street to John Colins. No wait, no fuss, no pretense. A good time is had by all.
author: Deb I.

description: I love John, Colin and beautiful Leilani. These guys run a wonderful bar with great drinks. If I ever have time to go and have a drink I will always stop by here. They make you feel so welcome and serve up great drinks without a wait. The space is beautiful and music is hot.
author: A L.

description:
This place has two selling points, hence, two stars:

(1) Excellent look, atmosphere, nice sophisticated crowd

(2) Excellent place to go when drunk because the drinks contain so much water they instantly sober me up

I can't imagine why some people consider their drinks to be strong. If you want strong drinks, go pretty much anywhere BUT here: Dada, Steff's, Eddie Rickenbacker's...
author: Jared S.

description: Get the El Muerto Margarita.  Habanero chili infused tequila.  If you are feeling brave or drunk, try a shot.  The best drink in town...
author: Deep S.

description: I love this place! It's a perfect place for after work cocktails as well as for random late night SOMA fun! They having amazing mojitos and the bartenders don't grimace when you ask for one. It can sometimes get really loud but otherwise it's a hip, yet unpretentious bar that I recommend all the time!
author: Andrea S.

description: This is easily one of my favorite bars in the city.  I'm from Southern California and it really has a SoCal vibe to it.  The drink menu is fabulous and they have a huge selection of exotic beers!  I absolutely love that they project surf movies on the back wall for you to watch while you sit at the bar.  The DJ is amazing here as well!!  Can't say enough about it. Only negative is that there is only one bathroom.
author: Amanda T.

description: Great setting - soaring ceilings, exposed brick and an open, airy feel.  Lots of after-work banker types better dressed than me.  Bar service slower than it should be.  Props to salty snacks in bowls everywhere, a small thing that makes a huge difference!
author: Matt S.

description: I hate to be the old guy at the club but will someone please turn down the music?  This place is generally great but i can't seem to figure out why the bass is cranked to 11 at happy hour on a random tuesday when there are 4 people in the bar.  I'd love to go there for a casual drink after work with friends but there is just no way to have a conversation.  For future, I will reserve as a go-there-after-i've-already-had-3-drinks destination.
author: Jason M.

description: i looove no cover and no line! :D it did take a while to get drinks, but they were really cheap (or maybe i just got a deal because my friends are hot). ;) everyone was really friendly, the music was good (we were in the upstairs room, and whiled away some time being mesmerized by the electronic turntable/mixing DJ equipment), and did i mention no cover, no line, and cheap drinks? ;D it IS pretty small and there's no dance floor, but it's a fun loungey place to chill with friends.
author: Clara K.

description:
Not the place to go on a Saturday night (flashback Saturday?)  Maybe this is only a happy hour place.  It was DEAD.  I thought maybe it was because we got there slightly before 11, but then it got to be 11 30, and then 12, and things were not picking up.  

The drinks were good, the bartenders nice, the crowd ... not that enticing.  Although, the drinks were pretty cheap :)  

Maybe I will try again on a weekday happy hour trip.
author: Alison K.

description: It's just like any other bar,  but with super friendly staff.  I like the pit bull paintings on the wall and surf videos.  It's also really dark inside.  I got a couple hugs from people mistaking me for a friend, or maybe they were drunk.  Oh well, we were in a bar!
author: Jeanne C.

description: I've only been here once, but I liked this bar.  The crowd is chill and a nice mix of friendly people - grown folks rather than coeds.  Despite the small space, it's a great atmosphere.  The music was chill, and the seating areas were lounge-y and comfortable.  Lot parking is available down the street for $7-10.  Would've been 5 stars if the bartenders were more attentive, didn't mix up people's cards, and take forever to return them. Overall, I really liked this place.
author: Karina C.

description:
3.5 stars and climbing
drinks are good.
atmosphere good.
the owner's are the best thing about this joint so far...meaning it will be great soon.
author: Tracy E.

description: Typical bar near SOMA....not as fun as nearby 111 Minna...but more of a lounge bar to relax and chat.  Suggest all bars upgrade their complementary snacks....snack pretzels and gold fish do not belong in a SF bar.
author: Laurence H.

description: When its closing time at the saltmines, and I needs me a little adult refreshement and a mental vacation I go to....Hawaii? Well, maybe in my head, but I definately feel closer to it by coming here. With the super friendly bartenders, ridiculously tasty drinks, and the surf videos projected on the ceiling, how can you not love this place? It can get as packed as my Jimmy hats after work though, so you best get there early to snag a seat.....
author: Tim V.

description: Not bad...the place is pretty cool and chill.  Only been here once and it's not the most memorable place.  The few things I didn't like about this bar was that right when the bar closes, the bartenders, bouncers, and security guys keep harassing you to leave and get off the premises.  One guy even gets on the phone right where we were outside and pretends to be talking to the police.  I think he's faking it, because seriously...it's a bar!  What do you expect from operating a bar??  When it's 2am and you start kicking people out, they will mingle outside for a while.  There's no way every day when the bar is open he has to place a call to the cops to force us to walk away.  How ridiculous!  So annoying...not loving it.
author: Annie S.

description: This place is a welcome addition to the Financial District.  A sexy decor in a historic building make for a great atmosphere, not to mention some of the best bartender/owners in the city!  John and Colin are fantastic hosts who always make you feel at home.  Sweet charm, strong drinks and killer music make this new hot spot one of my new favs!  Not only do the best DJs in town play here but the best drinks are poured.  Get your a$$ in here now!
author: Chard M.

description: I've only been to this place as an after work happy hour spot and must therefore acknowledge my uncertainty with 4-stars.  Good, friendly  bartenders.  It gets really packed during weekday happy hours but my friend and I found peace in the little loft area (DJ area) that overlooks the main bar.
author: Yen P.

description:
i'm not super picky about bars.  actually, yes i am.  but it doesn't take much to make me happy.  as long as the people are nice, the bar is accessible and the drinks are decent, and the music can, at the very least, be tuned out, then i'm good for a couple of hours.

john colins definitely scores above average on all marks.  the music selection probably scores the lowest on my list of criteria, but it's not the kind of place where you're going to Party Like A Rockstar, so it's all good.  definite kudos to the friendly bouncers and bar staff.
author: brian w.

description: ooh tropical delight!  I've always wanted to check this lil place out - and today's dreary day was turned into a sunny afternoon over at John Collins (are all my reviews this cheesey ? - please feel free to alert me)!  I digress - I dug the decor - the skylights - the bev options (many a fun fruity drink were being passed around) and the staff.  The floor space isn't huge but the ceilings are high; feels kinda like youre in a fun bungalow full of 20/30something fun seekers.  I will definitely be back for one of their events - 80s nights and so on.  Oh and the snack mix is a concoction of pretzels and goldfish...need I say more.
author: Melissa H.

description: great location. a little off the beaten track of the usual financial district haunts.  John & Colin are fab guys and their spot reflects their personalities a little rough around the edges, but sweet on the inside;) definitely hit this one up. also good for after the giants game if you get tired of momo's and paragon.
author: Angela N.

description: Soooo this is probably one of my favorite bars in the city...located off the beatin path you'll find this spot only if you know where to look.  It used to be an old train station and is proably going to have to be torn down soon so if you haven't gotten to see it yet now is your opportunity!
author: Jason W.

description: Cool spot.  Awesome bouncer, awesome bartenders.  Nice vibe goin' on in there. I like it.  I'll be back again and again.
author: Christine Y.

description: You need to go to this bar now. I mean right now, drop your stupid mouse and go get a drink. How could you not love the surf movies projected on the wall, the awesome tunes provided by the DJs, and the comfortable atmosphere almost unheard of this close to downtown. Any time is really the best time to come, but second Saturday nights is when you can catch me on the decks. A great mix of business types and hipsters, all gathered in this location to make peace with the weekdays behind them and enjoy being in the belly of the weekend. The only stiffies you'll find at this place are the drinks.
author: Tal K.

description: I like the space here, but it used to be way too crowded.  Would take forever to get a drink.  Sounds like this is still a problem a year later.  Good for them!  I guess I just need to get there early so I can get a seat at the bar and camp out for a while.
author: Pele N.

description: This place gets a big thumbs up for all the surf and skate videos they project on the big screen. That and great cocktails!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: The first time I went here was before they moved and my friends and I were ending our night, but wanted one last drink.  No cover--always a plus.  Since the night was winding down I can't really speak of the crowd and vibe, but from the short time we were there, it was pretty chill and the music was definitely good.  Why didn't we come here instead of where we went?? Oh yeah, we were supporting a friend of friend who was performing at another venue not too far away.  The bartenders were cool, again, another plus.  I hate it when bartenders, bouncers, (the crowd even) act pretentious.  The next time we paid JC a visit was at their new spot--again, no cover, yay!  The venue is much bigger than the last and has a separate room for folks to dance.  If I remember correctly bathrooms are unisex?? (if so, negative points).  It was really crowded in the bar area but nothing overwhelming.  The music again was really good--props to the dj for playing the good shit.   Definitely one of the better places to go to for a night out if you're looking for good music, a chill vibe, and free (for the most part) from the young and dumb crowd you'd find at Temple or Suite 181.
author: Tess E.

description: Been here a few times now, must say its a great little neighborhood lounge.   Decent drink prices, nice little dance floor and cozy couches to relax with friends.
author: Ray M.

description: Nicely designed Loft. Lotta artsy stuff to look at. I should come here more often.
author: Nicole O.

description: Great bar! The bartenders are great and the drinks are fresh. Went on a Friday night and by 10pm it was packed. A little hard to get through to the back where the bathrooms are, but the crowd was nice so it didn't matter. DJ was terrific. Nice place!
author: T Z.

description: Yay!! fun fun fun! My co workers and I came here after watching Wicked, and it being St. Patty's day, we had better get our green beer on! The music was soooo good! and everyone in the bar had their just amount of buzz instep, because everybody was singing and dancing!!
author: Maureen M.

description:
a chill place to chill.

not ridiculous like harlot or hipster-doofus like 111minna (review coming..)

you get in, you get a drink at the bar, listen to the dj, yell at the top of your lungs, and with any luck have fun with friends and make a few new ones.

but... after a while the place can turn into a bit of a sausage factory if you catch my meaning. more girls at harlot (the asscrack bouncer is bit more discriminating there so more chicas caliente).

here's the gameplan. grab a bite at one of the various restaurants on that block of 2nd street, then head on in here before it gets too crowded and silly. drink, drink, and drink to your heart's content. then head off to some other joint.

rating: 3 paper towel dispensers.
author: dave tastic fantasmo x.

description: When our group first got there, there was a line so we went around the corner to a sports bar and just had some drinks before going back to this lounge.  We got a little corner spot and settled in with our drinks.  I really liked the atmosphere and vibe of this lounge.  The music, however, was pretty low for clubs/lounges.  We found out that they can't turn it up any more because of the "neighbors."  How funny is that?  Regardless, we still had fun dancing and drinking with our friends.  Good end to a great night!
author: Beverly C.

description: I was going to write a nice review as they have a great happy hour. But since I wasnt able to get a damn place to sit after standing for about 40 mins the last few times, I am going to stop writing now.
author: Sav B.

description: We were there on a Friday night and the DJ was spinning great music - mix of 90s hits and hip hop. The crowd was a bit dorky that night, though I probably wouldn't have minded if I was plastered and if they had at least a tiny bit of a dance floor like at Hi-Fi. But, I was hungry and not buzzed...so we ended up at Mel's (mmmm....onion rings and patty melt).
author: Thu S.

description: I saw David Hasslehoff here once. I dont know if that's a good or bad thing.
author: Scarlet S.

description: I remember brick on the wall, some funky art, hipster bartenders, drinks coming to our table from one hot guy, is this a str8 bar, i don't think it matters?! Suddenly life has new meaning to me- no, not bad 80s music- but a cab is whisking me away to a night full of jolly romps. Yes- John Colins is the perfect primer for a night chock full o'laughs.
author: Braden B.

description: If you want to follow the exact formula for a 3-star bar it would be:  mid-sized space, limited seating, exposed brick wall w/ concrete floors, no food, fully stocked bar...not bad, not bad at all.  And that's what you get with John Colins...not bad, not bad at all.  Its a cool enough place to go for a drink or two.  But dang, this place gets busy and getting a drink is rough in these parts!  I do appreciate the gold fish to munch on...but I like some apps with my liquor.  Of course I'll go back...often...but it's not tops on my list.  Good enough, JC...
author: Susan L.

description: I'll go to a bar just because I like their cocktails, and John Collins has the best-est Effen Black Cherry martini EVER with a splash of grenadine and fresh black cherries (!). When I'm having a particularly numbing office cube moment my mind drifts back to that happy place with the nice cold cherry martini. Oh martini, I love you! Plus the bartender/owner guy was incredibly nice and patient. I can't wait to go back...tomorrow?
author: Masaye W.

description:
cool bar setting for happy hour, but it is waaaaaaaaaay tooooooooooo packed. i will probably go elsewhere.

i didn't notice that there was old school porn being projected on the wall b/c it was so crowded with tall people that i could not see...... sigh....
author: Irene C.

description: Im having a hard time remembering anything really specific about the many times that I've been here (which is a testament to the good drinks), but I will say this: (1) I've never had a bad time here, (2) the bartenders rock (especially that time that they started handing out name tags with unilaterally chosen nicknames), and (3) this place is pretty damn conducive to meeting new friends and ex lovers.  Beat that combination.
author: Jason S.

description: Came here on Friday after all of us got kicked out of Harlot because of some "private" event. Been here before although the last time it was right after work and I hadn't consumed quite as much alcohol. Good crowd. Nice set up. Wish it was a bit closer to the home front. But a cool place to kick it when in the area.
author: Heather L.

description: if i counted how many free drinks I got here one night, youmight have to hunt me down for AA meetings.  That's all I'm saying.  Of and I you thought I was drunk, you should have checked out the bar tender.
author: Moi S.

description:
This place is the perfect setting for a sensual, relaxing happy hour after a long shift at your job down in the Financial District. 

What makes it nice, you ask? 

Only the sultry, romantic, dimly-lit atmosphere, great decor, good music selection, and stiff drinks, to be exact.

I spent several memorable evenings here with co-workers, and it's definately the perfect launching pad for an epic night out on the town.
author: Alex G.

description: I go here from time to time for a nice happy hour spot.  It's not a fancy bar, but the happy hour goes until 7 and unless it's Friday, it's not horribly crowded.  If you get there early enough you can grab some seats and chat with some friends.  The Friday crowd does turn into a packed meat market, so if that's your thing you're all set, otherwise, it's Friday, accept that is how it is.
author: Jared W.

description: This is the "it" bar for me right now. They make good strong (but not too strong) vodka tonics. And I'm not just saying that because the bartender hooked me up - which was very sweet of him, by the way! The music is a great mix; the brick walls lend a nice touch; and there's always a good mix of folks - hip 20 and 30 somethings. Great for happy hours too.
author: Jill T.

description: I have to admit that I don't come here on weekends and generally try to come early or on a random night. If it's not crowded, this place is *perfect* to hang out with friends, enjoy the huge Kim Cogan painting on the wall, and drink too many dark n' stormys (in a frosted glass!). However, I haven't been in a while and I fear it will never be like the early days again.
author: Emily L.

description: I work in the SOMA so John Colins is the perfect location for meeting up with friends for happy hour.  It's usually not that crowded, the drinks are strong, and they're right next door to Osha Thai.  They turn up the music a tad bit high but it's really not a problem unless you're trying to have a heart to heart with someone.  And if you are, you probably shouldn't be doing it in a bar.
author: Kimmie N.

description: I really like this place a lot. It's reminds me of your total neighborhood bar, but done right and with good music. First time I came here was with friends on a random night and have gone back like one or two other times because I really like the environment. Its fun, unpretentious, and the drinks are good and very well priced. Been here on a Thursday night and Friday night only, and the crowd was pretty chill and local (at least the people I talked to, whereas weekends I hear the crowd tends to be more outta towners. And by outta towners I mean people who live more than an hour's drive away, so I would probably avoid coming here on a Saturday night as the ego inside this place probably blows up.
author: Joey C.

description: I was a big fan of this bar when it first opened ... when there were 20 people on a good night (weekend that is). Wow have things changed. If you plan on coming here even for one drink, call ahead and get a little area reserved... it's worth it. This place ..excuse my bay area talk but -is off the heeeezy on weekends. Good and bad.. the crowd can be a little on the thuggish ruggish bone side. The "leave your attitude at the door" goes directly to you people. My biggest complaint would be that they allow JC to get too packed. On a positive note, the bartenders/owners are very very quick behind the bar and make sure you get taken care of quickly & with a stiff drink.
author: flo t.

description: Love this place, good mix of people and some great bartender/owners.  Big ups to Colin and Leilani!  Space is fairly wide open which is nice and there are benches along the walls to relax or get intimate.  Bathroom line can be hell, but heck, its a bar and it gets busy.  See you there . . .
author: Rick V.

description: Came here on a Tuesday night after the "Google Open House San Francisco". Easy atmosphere. And the bartender told me he didn't like the Google badge I had forgotten to remove.
author: Rob T.

description: Uh-oh. John Colins, my favoritest spot in the city, you are on notice homie. Took our friends from New York here last Saturday night, ordered drinks, grooved a bit to some old school hip hop... Had gin and tonic #2 thinking gin and tonic #1 hadn't hit the spot and I tell you after an hour,I felt nothing. Nothing! WTF? Is that what $5 a drink buys me these days at my beloved bar? Say it ain't so...
author: Genevieve R.

description: Enough with the frozen beer glases!  I needed oven gloves to pick up my pint last nite!  Please don't ruin the taste of your great beer.  Otherwise, everything else is just right.
author: David H.

description: My friend took me here one night and I really loved the ambience. We only stayed a little while bc we all had the D from this whack french food we had earlier. The lighting was cool, and I was hella stoned and so I majorally got into this painting on the wall of SF burning. There was good music, hot 20 somethings and really good white russians. My friend projectile vomited in the bano so we peaced, but I'd def go again.
author: Lacey P.

description: Lively happy hour.  It does get crowded because the place isn't very big, but there is a small upper level.  Drinks are very good and prices are alright.  I'd definitely come back.
author: Nilar H.

description:
Great bar. The interior is very modern but cozy with lots of plants and sky-lights.

Speacialty cocktails were delicious, try the Lychee martini.

Hate to see the bar moving becuase of the new transbay terminal, but the new space is supposed to be equally as cool.
author: john w.

description: You know a drink is some serious trouble when it tastes like there's nothing in it, only for it to hit you like a b*tch slap to the face a few minutes after it's finished. That's exactly how I felt when I had a Long Island here the past weekend. I have no idea who made it for me since I placed my order with one of the servers, but whoever you are, HIGH FIVE! Most of the people who were around when I arrived had been there since happy hour. Their unsteadiness and minimal slurs pretty much gave it away. The dance floor area is small, and despite a little technical difficulty, the DJ played some good music. I do agree that it would be nice to not have the music blasting all around the place, or at least lower the volume a bit around the bar area so we can hear ourselves talk. For a bar, the line to get into this place on a Friday was insane to the point where they had to stall it for a while until people would leave. There's no cover, but the price of drinks will make up for that fact. Trust!
author: Rhia R.

description: Bright during the day and dark at night, meaning your there for a while.  It helps that the staff drinks with you.
author: Nate B.

description: This little back alley spot is sick!  The crowd is mixed and they serve Hinano!  I ventured to this place on a Tuesday and was surprised how crowded it was.
author: chris c.

description: Probably one of the most friendly bars I have ever been to. Good times on the rare occasions that I get to get out! I usually drink whiskey or beer but they have much more. You should check this place out for sure!
author: Life L.

description: Don't think I got the true John Colins experience since I went here for a private party last night. I was also more than slightly intoxicated when I got there having just gotten off the Grey Goose booze cruise around the Bay... but the crowd was fun, space was too small to really dance and the upstairs was closed off, but Solomon spun some fun music that we all gyrated to. The drinks were good, average price, and the bartenders super friendly actually look like they are having fun working there. One bad thing though...the one bathroom stall for women really sux. Why don't bars these days accomodate us with an appropriate number of stalls? Seriously... alcohol = frequent pee breaks... and when you have a packed bar with only 1 bathroom available per sex... makes it a very uncomfortable evening.
author: Marina K.

description: Out with some old college fraternity brothers, after we had some wine and homemade limoncello, we found this place after it was recommended to us by the doorman at the bar we had intended to go to. So down the block we went and the doorman at place #1 did us right. This place was bumpin' on a thursday night. We strolled in, proceeded to the bar and got our groove on. One of my friends was wearing a trench coat and pirate hat; women went crazy over the hat! We had blast drinking at the bar, making new friends and grooving with some chill hip-hop/funk and downtempo. Definitely coming back here the next time I'm in town. And on our way back home at 2am, we saw the other doorman and tipped him nicely for the recommendation!
author: Randy S.

description: One of the better happy hour spots just right out of the FiDi.  You must go early tho, and it gets crowded by about 6:30 most days.
author: C R.

description: Pretty cool, chill atmosphere and pretty clean-cut crowd. Which is nice, but also kinda boring.  At least last Saturday night.
author: Melanie C.

description: Went here after it opened and really dug it. Finally went back last night and still really like this bar. Good selection of spirits, great tunes, really cool setting...I'm really into the brick walls, the projector, and the rotating art. If you're in the area definitely throw this bar in the rotation. There's nothing earth-shattering about it, but it's an all around great bar.
author: Sarah R.

description: It's a guy place. A Very Guy place. Bartenders are hot, but...it's a guy place. Too loud, too many booooring surfer videos, not enough places to sit after work.
author: Rene D.

description: Ok, so I work up the street and I'm pretty much a regular. This place just keeps me coming back. It's got a pretty down to earth crowd despite its close proximity to the financial district. It's not too loud and the music selection is pretty eclectic but entertaining, making it a great place to meet up with friends. Plus the price is right, especially during happy hour. Tasty drinks...and bartenders ;)
author: Natalie T.

description: I'm always the last to get the memo on cool little spots to hang on weekdays. The DJ was plain good music, the bartender was super cute and nice. The crowd was mellow but clearly having fun. I wish the space was a bit bigger to put in more seating though. After chatting with the bartender about the current movie selection (Pootie-tang) he told me that they were planing to open a JC in Hawaii by 2008. Dude! Yes! Sweeeeet!
author: Alia D.

description: Great bar, fab ambiance and a lively crowd.  A co-worker and I went out for a Thursday night b*tch session about work and life over drinks.  The Lychee Tini is PERFECT...love it!   I said only 1, but ended up having two...my co-worker had 3 beers.  Love the mirrors over the bar...great way to check out the crowd behind you while you sit at the bar...and why not, it's a group of good-looking people.
author: San D.

description: Enjoyed the random Thursday night I ended up there with 10 people, of which I only knew 4. Walking distance from where I live, not too crowded, and a chill place to hang out and get drinks. I wonder what it's like on a weekend.
author: Antara B.

description: I used to work around the corner from John Colins and since it was a better bet than 111 Minna or Eddie Ricks we went there often. The perks of going there often is the barstaff will treat you like a queen. The flipside is when you're packed in with stuffed shirts and girls who look the same. Boring. You can escape all that by drinking heavily and focusing on the wonderful surf videos they splash on the wall, very zen if you drink the right cocktail....ooommmmm
author: Colleen B.

description: Plan on getting here right around 5pm when it opens if you hate standing in a crowd and fighting your way through a swarm of khaki-clad yuppies to get a drink. Assuming you do get one of the few tables/seating areas, it's not a bad place to enjoy a post-work drink or two with friends or colleagues.
author: Chris B.

description: I agree with the others - perfect drinking hole when it isn't crowded. When it is, it's annoying.
author: Mi M.

description:
the first time i came to this bar was on a mellow tuesday evening for a catch up sesh with a roommate after work.  

the bartender, wearing a "the town" shirt, was super cool and made us delicious shots with squirt soda, and then took it with us.  then, something - to this day i still don't know what - gave me the giggles and i laughed.  i laughed real hard.  shot still in my mouth.  and it sprayed.  all. over. the. bar.

the bartender just smiled - a nice, genuine, im smiling with you not at you kinda smile - picked up her dish towel, wiped off my mess, and made me another shot.

i have liked this bar ever since.
author: Helen L.

description: This is a decent enough bar but unfortunately it can sometimes turn into a bit of an after work "scene." I like this place best on weekends before ten, so basically before the crowds start piling in and elbowing you to order Manhattans to hold in one hand while you talk about your latest deal.
author: Cathy T.

description: You used to be a cool neighborhood bar that was a sure-thing for drinks after work.  People couldn't keep their mouths shut so now you are too packed with B&T on Fridays to get a cocktail.  You need to hire a doorman to keep it to the legal occupancy, hire at least one more bartender, get rid of all the bar seating and spend $20 at Target on a nice fan.  Staff is awesome, drinks are literally perfect, prices are right, but it doesn't really matter if you can't make your way to the bar, let alone actually order a drink in relative comfort.  Kudos's on the surfing videos though....nice touch.
author: Ari G.

description:
i've been here a few times now and i'm still don't have a direct opinion about it.  it serves alcohol so thats good.  its pretty small, bad.  i heard warriors players hang out here but not really a star struck person.  i guess it gets 3 stars for serving alcohol......?!?!
well i'll say i wold take a friends there sometimes.  i don't hate the place.
author: junie k.

description:
this place is alright.

as far as space its like drinking in a big hallway.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Not a bad venue! Cool art and limited edition 1800 artist collection vodka bottles along the bar and cool space for listening to live music. Mezzanine area upstairs, set further back, but makes it feel more private.
author: S B.

description: I like how this place is so cute in a the alley.  It reminds me of those alleys in France.  The place a bit crowded and you basically just have to stand in one place.  So if you just want a drink or are bar hopping then this is the place to go.  If you want to move your body body, then it's best to be at another venue.
author: Chau L.

description: They've got the real shiznit for a dark and stormy and it's great. Only 3 stars because it took 15 minutes to get one each time.
author: Michael K.

description:
i haven't been to john colins in quite some time and completely didn't recognize it.  we actually walked by before realizing that it's where we were intending to go.  anyway, i like the atmosphere, nice chill vibe, yet i'm also completely comfortable coming directly from work in my suit.  

happy hour specials weren't great, but not bad either.  it was $1 off anything, so i paid $4 for my hef.  not a bad spot considering it's on my way home, would go again.
author: Olivia T.

description: Great happy hour. If you go on Friday after work you better get there by 5:01 if you want a seat. Good crowd and mellow bartenders,
author: Raymond M.

description: Is there crack in this cosmo?  Definitely one of the best cosmos I've had.  My friends had a bottle of red wine and hated it though.  It was very crowded there and people kept unapologetically bumping into me which got annoying.  From the outside, I thought this place was closed and abandoned, so it was a welcome surprise inside...it felt like a secret find.
author: Yasmine G.

description: One of the best happy hours downtown, and a cool space to boot. John Collins can be relied on for a lively afterwork cocktail.
author: Cat S.

description:
one of the most delicious cocktails i've had in years - the lailani (possible spelling errors not withstanding) took me back to my days of lore. it tasted like ice cream, it was full of sake, and i felt like butter. 

in comparison to all the other bars in this area - i.e. weird after work crowd usually comprising a creepy sausage party - this place is more loungy with a good happy hour. so get drizzunk after you realize there's no place to sit in house of shields and all the cute bike messengers have moved on to zeitgeist.
author: alina p.

description: I've been here for happy hour a couple times. The drinks are nice and strong, and the bartenders aren't too shabby themselves. The atmosphere is a little too fancy for me, but I don't really like lounges anyway.
author: Samantha S.

description: I can see going here for happy hour, but past that....I'm out.  I enjoyed a very good mojito.  I also enjoyed the decor, had kind of a beachy thing going on, which is always nice especially on a warm night.  Only thing that bothered me were the girls who took too long in the bathroom.  And yes I'm female, and yes I probably have taken too long in the bathroom as well.  But come on girls do your bugger sugar somewhere else...argh!  How '80's.
author: Amanda P.

description: Really cool hip bar in SOMA.  It can get a bit crowded during happy hour, might have to fight your way to the bar but overall we always have fun here!
author: Victor M.

description: This is a great place!  Very switched on, nice vibe, nice looking crowd without being snooty or too trendy.  John and Colin, the owners, have this down.  Recommend for coming in on your own and chat with the cool bartenders, or to come with a bud or a group.  I hosted some team members from my company and had a great time.   I also come with my wife for an afterwork drink.  Not sure how people could find anything to complain about...unless they're looking for things to complain about.  For me, it's a can't miss.
author: Manolo T.

description: I dropped by for Friday happy hour and didn't want to leave! It's a great space and the owners (John and Colin) make you feel really welcome. I can't wait to check out the later-night scene, and I highly recommend JC as an after-work spot to meet up with friends.
author: Shannon L.

description: Not a bad place to grab a cocktail after a 1.5 hour yoga class...ommm.  The drinks were good and the bar staff was easy on the eyes.  Only issue was the crowd was a little snobby (my friend conducted an entire bar transaction for a random stranger that did not even say thank you).  I wouldn't spend an entire night there but if you want to sit at the bar, have a cocktail and admire some good (real and canvas-based) people art, then this place is for you.
author: Kim N.

description: any bar that has a hibiscus flower on the sign is a-ok in my book Braddah!    The surf  videos projected on the wall above the door along with the great artwork & industrial walls is such a great atmosphere.  the music is as eclectic as the crowd can get, when around 7ish it turns from "fidi happy hour" to "hipster pre-dinner cocktail crew.  I haven't been late night yet...but I'm sure i will be soon.  the make a stiff bloody mary,  one gin and tonic had me feeling no pain & there are great  beers on tap.  my favorite part though may be the bathroom....it's roomie, clean & there is GREAT 3 piece art on the wall.  Anywhere that puts that much effort into their bathroom, puts that much effort into everything they do!!!
author: Liz V.

description: This place is not like what I expected - while I knew there was a lot of hype about John Colins - I also thought that it would maybe be more of an Irish bar or something.  It actually almost felt beachy to me- lots of trees and I almost felt like there was bamboo in there too.  Anyway - I was expecting kind of more of the Marina crowd in there - but that wasn't the case at all.  I thought the drinks were perfect - you could taste the alcohol but it wasn't overly strong.  I will likely come back!
author: Katie P.

description: My hubby and I stumbled in here after the Giant's game yesterday.  It didn't hurt that the husband is friends with the owners --- John and Collin.  We were meaning to just catch the BART and head back to the island paradise home we call Alameda, but the lure of another drink (although definitely not needed) called our names.  Although I may be a little biased here, I REALLY enjoyed this bar.  It had a very cool vibe.  There was a crowd, but it was not too crowded.  Hubby and I were able to sit at the bar and talk to John for an an hour or so.  Drinks were spot on and watching a surfing video was fun.  I like the interior of the bar, simple, clean, brick facade, candles, plants... I am planning to go back and try the happy hour as soon as I can.
author: Michelle C.

description: It was a Friday after work, I was coming from a dissappointing visit from 111 Minna - (going down the tubes, crowd was sooooooo ghetto) - anyway, as my friend I walked past Natoma, we noticed the several bars in the alley. John Colins is a great after work, happy hour place! Great crowd, great atmosphere. I met one of the owners - Colin - very friendly.
author: Jen R.

description: Good music- mix of hip hop, old school, and other mixes.  Service is great- and this is a cool crowd for happy hour.  The guys went here one night and had enough space to catch up and drink.  Beware when you smoke outside- you must abide by the rules- NO standing in the street- or else.  Hehehe.  Knock on Baron Davis' door which is right in front of John Collins.  His unit reads Boom Dizzle or something hilarious like that.
author: Rob C.

description: Dope happy hour spot. They play dope music and the bartendars rock. They know their liquor and know how to make excellent drinks. It gets packed during happy hour but love the mix of people. Work people but not too stiff so a good vibe for happy hour. The only draw back is its kinda small so gets packed easily.
author: Hyung L.

description: It's always crowded when I go....which is usually a good thing, except I'm not really into the type of  person it attacts. Having said that, I continue to go cause the bartenders are pretty fucking hot, and I'm a superficial biatch, so that works for me.
author: Laurie A.

description: Fun place, great vibe and just the right amount of darkness. Usually a destination after 111 Minna.
author: Eric G.

description:
My new favorite bar in downtown SF! I usually meet up with friends on Wednesdays for their Happy Hour. Doesn't take too long to find a seat and enjoy your drink and snack on their mix of pretzels and goldfish (love it!)

There are frequently liquor promo people there, so often I've been given free drinks, which is great.
author: Adrienne D.

description: John Collins introduced me to the Sweet Leilani. And I've been going back to this bar ever since. The space is cool. The decor is cool. The bartenders are cool. The bouncer is cool. This bar seems to be a good bet on any night when you're out with your friends and just want to hang out at a cool spot in SOMA...which is my situation on most nights.
author: Nini G.

description: This is a nice, small, chill place to kick back and grab a drink.  There's a slight tropical theme so you'll find such decorative items throughout and possibly an orchid in your drink.  John Colins... is he related to Tom?
author: Naomi N.

description:
came here last night. not my kind of place.

first off, this place is so small. smallest bar i've ever been too.
second, i didn't see anyone under the age of 35. first thing i said when i walked in here was "there are a bunch of old guys wearing business suits.. we in the right spot?"

i'm not against older people going out and having fun, but i'm not about to go party with them myself. i'm only 23. it would be nice to hang around people my own age.

needless to say, we didn't hang around. didn't order drinks. we barely got past the entryway this place was so crowded.

don't think i'll be coming back for another 10 years.
author: Michelle P.

description: Cool spot. Has a chill vibe with hip events and people. It can get a bit crowded, but then again it's a bar. I enjoy going for a happy hour or for a night of drinks with friends.
author: jim o.

description: Great room, and overall a fun spot.  Gets a little rowdy as the night wears on, but I've always been treated well each time I've gone, and Colin definately knows what it takes to keep the party vibe going.
author: Eagan I.

description: One of the best happy hour locations! I work near John Colins, so it's one of the most convenient post-work stops for me. However, I must say that this is not your average afterwork bar. It's fun, the music is generally good, and the crowd is young (but not to the point of being annoyingly so). They make a good kamikaze martini and pretty much everything else is great there, too.
author: Amy K.

description:
The lighting is such that anybody who walks in the door feels instantly at ease about their appearance.  Yes girls, no need to go check yourselves out before grabbing drinks.  Colors inside are warm and the exposed brick adds to the rustic quality of the place.  Seating is slightly sparse, but bar serving complimentary goldfish crackers and pretzels makes up for this.  Random movie clips are showcased that add amusement to the ambiance.

I ordered a cucumber drink that tasted satisfyingly refreshing -- very similar in taste to the cooling, reviving water they provide at a spa.  YUM!  Thought it would be more packed, but surprisingly not crowded for a Friday night.  Bartenders were responsive and helpful.

Overall, this SOMA spot is worth a trip.
author: Ji-yon Y.

description:
great vibe, great bar tenders and very friendly doorman/security.

randomly came here and made friends instantaneously.  drinks are great and so is the music.  i do have to say that it gets really crowded at times but that just goes to show that the place is a well liked venue.  parking's a pain but its a pain everywhere you go in this area.  

worth the wait!
author: Patricia G.

description:
I went for Happy Hour last friday and it was hella packed, I was bumping into everybody I even elbow some chick in the head....I was paying my tab and saying thx to the bartender when I turn around and hit this poor girl who was sitting down right on the forehead, I felt bad so I bought her a drink and made a quick get away. 
A whole bunch of cutties to pick from all around the bar (mostly white...I saw 1 sista and 3 latin chicks)and the good thing is that you know they have a job.
If you really need to go to the bathroom your better off going to the alley (yes chicks go to the alley too they just need to be really buzzing...I've seen it...not proud of it) cause the waiting is crazy.
I had a great time @ least better then the last time, when Trucker Hank got a bunch of us kick out cause he was super faded and broke hella glasses just for the fuck of it, Trucker Hank got 86 on his 1st visit to John Collins LOL!!! the adventures of Trucker Hank.....To be Continue...
author: Angelisimo G.

description: What happened to the cutie I was making eyes at?!?!  Love the brick walls; love the attention at the crowded bar.  Love the way the lights came down after 7.  Tip - the longer you wait, the stiffer the drinks.
author: Yve T.

description: Is this place for real?  Stay away unless you like a trash bar
author: Steven T.

description: A nice and relaxing place.  It isn't over the top, just right.
author: Andrew N.

description: Eh, $4 bux for a Gunniess is not a bargain at happy hour. Kennedy's has them for $2 and the pretzels  at JC does't make up for it either. If the Guinesses were $3 or  if they had free food I might think different. The music sucked too.
author: Steve Q.

description: I haven't been to this place any other night, but on Friday's, it's THE SPOT (DJ Consuelo Fridays). I am a big fan of DJ Consuelos.  He's OG and one of the best and nicest DJ's in SF. This place has everything i love about the city.  There isn't a cover, the decor is nice, the bartenders and owners are friendly and welcoming.   Yes, some of the crowd is clean cut. Probably because it's a stones throw from downtown, but everyone is nice.  However, i managed to find some riff-raff there. Met some guy my friends now refer to as K-FED.  Need i say more? (no judgements on YELP, right?)  Anyway, on fridays, its guaranteed good times.
author: Angela R.

description: Last year I was organizing yet another work happy hour to welcome our summer analysts. As usual, I was given about 24 hours notice and was asked to find a hip bar with food.  Every where I tried was booked until Zebulon recommended a new bar across the street, John Colins Bar. They didn't have a private room but they did save us some space. They allowed us to bring in food from Zebulon which is basically across the alley on Natoma. Zebulon delivered it to us and everyone had a great time. The happy hour specials were so inexpensive that we ended up way under budget. I have always wanted to go back but it is a little far from the office for some of our bankers.
author: All About Town ..

description: I dropped in here one night after dinner and I was pleasantly surprised with the decor and ambience of this bar.  Bar tenders made great drinks and afforable prices and the crows was very laid back.  Everyone there seems to just want to have a good time and get buzzed.   This is a great place to drop by for a drink or two during a night out in the city.
author: Charles C.

description: I must admit, although the happy hours are jammin, I usually go there on the late night tip.  This place has an amazing bar staff that really knows how to make a mojito or specialty martini.  They also have some dope dj's there and rotating art exhibits by locals legends such as Sam Flores.
author: Pedro B.

description: Arriving at or around 10 or 11pm, I thought this was a sweet spot!!  Great music, good lookin' crowd.....place lighting not too dark, nor too light....and most of all....great drinks!!
author: Marie R.

description:
I just have to give this place a positive review based on one small anecdote, but it gave me a good impression of the bar.

I go on a Friday afternoon (crowded) with a friend, and we order two drinks. The bartender apparently forgets about this, and when he comes back to us and we mention we'd ordered two drinks already, he becomes very apologetic and offers us two drinks on the house.

Sure, he forgot about us, but it didn't take that long for him to realize this, and he was simply very nice - a refreshing change from many of the blase or disengaged bartenders I've come in contact with in this city.
author: Helene F.

description: After work I hit up J.C. Good spot for happy hour and to just chill. Bring good company and this place is the spot. Can get a little crowded but the vibe is always positive. When I feel like drinking trendy I go here, got to be in the mood though. Good location to bar hop in SOMA.
author: Erik W.

description: Fun little space that can be laid back but often takes itself too seriously.  Go with that in mind and you will have a lovely time.
author: Jere C.

description:
i've always been a fan of this place for one reason or another (strong/yummy/creative drinks, quick/attentive bartenders, great atmosphere) but tonight sealed the deal.

it's thursday and i met up with a couple friends for a spur of the moment happy hour. i was able to snag prime seats along the wall. (and it was already almost 5:30 PM - totally unheard of during downtown HHs, right?)

we got well on our way to buzzed over the next couple of hours, all the while enjoying the good drinks (the Mainlander - get it. LOVE IT.), interesting and not too shady company at the bar (read: guys who could actually carry a convo over 2 mins) and a sweet atmosphere (low-lighting, good ambient music & comfy seating).

the kicker came when we realized that the busser had taken away my draft that was still about 1/3 full. my friend who made the mistake of letting him take it away found him, told him and within a minute he was back with a full beer, apologies and all. totally unnecessary but very cool nonetheless.

we will be back. even though they don't have HH specials (-1 star).
author: Kay L.

description: a solid place for happy hour, albeit a bit too loud sometimes and absolutely no cell reception for at&t customers. i love the dark & stormy served up on a mug/jar... have had it at least twice and it's always been strong and tasty. very happy that the new space is bigger (they even have a back room which i haven't roamed through yet). all in all a good place to stop by for a drink!
author: Andrey C.

description: Nice to have another great spot near 111 Minna, the MoMA, and downtown. The owners are very nice and friendly. The atmosphere is fun and lively. The music could be turned down a notch or two so that a conversation could be had without ears hurting.
author: Jeny S.

description: Great happy hour spot.  The bartenders were very generous with the alcohol...made for a great night!
author: Christine S.

description: I went to John Colins with a group of friends last Friday and loved it.  The crowd was twenty-something/early thirty-something and stylish.  Cleary young professionals.  The atmosphere was edgy and sophisticated, esp. extra-large and extra-charming portrait of the ugly dog :)  But what I would really like to praise here is the drink Sake2u.   It comes in bottles and is like a sake daiquiri: citrus, green tea, or asian pear.  They have an interesting flavor, not too sweet, kind of subtle, just all around pleasant.  No bitter nutra aftertaste either.   Just thought you might like to try it if you go!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Has a decent happy hour, although it's only a dollar off all their exciting cocktails. I tried their signature drink, the John Collins (so eponymous!), which is basically whiskey with citrus and honey. Definitely a stiff and nice drink for whiskey lovers. My friend with bad taste who doesn't like whiskey thought it was disgusting, however.

Other than that, though, I didn't find anything else about this bar to be too interesting or enjoyable. Maybe it's just not my type of crowd, but I don't think I'm too unique in my search for a vaguely interesting place to drink away the work day. It was a lot of people (that I didn't necessarily want to talk to) who were drunk and shovey and loud...but not in a fun way if that makes sense.

The bartenders were pretty nice, though. Overall, I would come back here, but only if someone were pushing it.
author: Natalie M.

description: This place has great potential, but it's definitely not for me (or anyone who wants to salvage what little hearing capacity they have left). It is simply too LOUD. The DJ'd music needs to be brought down a few notches. The space itself is great -- there's  interesting art, it's a nice urban design and there are a variety of seating options, lively patrons and good happy hour prices, but I just don't want to have to scream to be heard by my friends. Trying to have a conversation here is exhausting, and there are other options in the neighborhood. It's shame because this is a great location.
author: Ruth M.

description: While I'm not the first to write about this new SF watering hole, I will also not be the last.  John Collins, from the owners of Wish, enters the downtown SF bar scene and does so quite gracefully.  A welcome addition to the Mission and 2nd area, an area in dire need of night life, this lounge combines a cozy atmosphere with the sophistication expected when one mentions 'lounge."  Gaze at the stellar artwork that adorns the walls, while listening to the cool rhythms from the DJ.  If you just want to drink till you can't drink anymore, well the bartenders have an assortment of flavors for your needs.  They make it sweet, sour, strong or bitter, you name it they can do it and with a smile.  John Collins for an all around good time.
author: Damian A.

description: Laid back & hip - great space with a sky-light and always a place to sit. One of my favorite bars!
author: Katie H.

description: Very cool vibe at this intimate spot in SOMA.   Drinks are good, and decently priced.  Stick to the weekend and there is a good looking happening crowd there.  High ceilings make it feel open, but definitely cozy if its busy.   Even when it is busy, I never have to wait too long for a drink.   Other nearby bars (Zebulon, Minna) if you catch them on an off night.
author: Ryan T.

description: This is my new favorite hang out! It has a chill atmosphere,  great drinks, and good music! If you're looking for a mellow place after work or a relax bar with friends. Check them out, its worth the trip and walking distance to market for Bart and muni.
author: Chris G.

description:
I really really like this place.  Its kinda small; intimate, but yes fri,sat nights get ridiculously crowded. Afternoons (happy hour) are great, yes ppl in suits because ugh duh, you're right by the financial district and its AFTER WORK.  

Staff is extremely friendly, drinks are reasonable for the area & the decor is very reminiscent to some lounges in NY.  Dress code is super relaxed everyday except fri/sat if you're with a large group (more than 2 or 3)

If you get anxiety, come here on a weekday excluding Fri, evening & you'll find friendly bartenders & patrons, a relaxed atmosphere and an enjoyable experience.  Oh, to comment on the staffs attire, I've seen that at some really nice lounges, and usually one of their alcohol reps has stopped by earlier to do some sort of promotion (which means cheap drinks for patrons while they're there) and left some free merchandise.  The staff here has always been in their own attire from what I've seen

Oh, if you're tall like me, watch your head when going upstairs, its a little shorter than 6'
author: Miss J.

description: one of those great little bars that gives you a warm fuzzy feeling... its so cute and welcoming. the crowd really makes this place. the very first time i came here, i only got to stay for about 20 minutes. luckily i was there with 2 cute fabulous yelp guys (wink, wink.) and i didn't mind much that we had to leave quickly for a party across the street. the 2nd time i came here however, i was with a girlfriend and we were definitely enjoying the visually pleasing scenery around us. um, oh yes and the bar is nice looking too. geez, i must have a bad case of spring fever right now because for some reason all i can think about is hot men and how they would look without their shirt on...... help!
author: Michelle I.

description: went here for the first time last night for a birthday..its located in an alley but once inside i thought it was nice little place. brick walls, small, dark, great beats, pretty mixed crowd...i'd definitely come here again.
author: Linda L.

description: we were there early enough to get seats, which as i recall were too-small plush cubes (which by 8pm were being shared by grown men) at too-small tables.   it feels new and is pretty and was busy and young during happy hour, but...it's small and i just don't like standing and i'll be damned if i have to share my cube.
author: michael w.

description:
#1 (another review after)
tucked away on a lil alley near 2nd, and across from zeboulon...

a mini version of  "the public" out in soma. the public is more chill and more lounge-y and this place is more bar-y... well, this place is lounge-y too but when it gets busy, it gets bar-y but no matter how packed it gets at the public, its just lounge-y no matter what..

i'm actually impressed with the wide variety of bars // lounges soma has to offer ... 

the brick layered walls, kinda had a great homey feel to it... the awesome vaulted ceilings, and not to mention, their dim light that totally gave away this total sexy effect ... 

if you visit, try facing the door, and then, look up and you will be watching some crazy nudity film...  just thought you'd like to know. great visual for an awkward moment when you and a bunch of peeps have nothing to talk about... 

def has a great vibe with cool peeps, even the bouncer and the bartenders... not a place you'll be bumping into pretentious babes. sry guys, it aint the marina, no eye candy..

i totally wouldn't mind coming here after work for happy hours, but since i'm always on and off from sf and san rafael, i'm limited with my outtings which is why i splurge and go wild occasionally.. well, i WAS going to stop by here last yr, but it was just wayy too packed that a bunch of us ended up at zeboulon...

and kindly enough to say the very least, the bathroom line has REALLY GOTS TO GO.
author: Jennifer S.

description: i have been to this bar for drinks a few times and like it - its not very big so it does get crowded.  they do have a little upstairs area which i enjoy, especially if you can get a seat up there when the rest of the bar is packed.  yeah, im lazy and like to sit!  i dont remember the music being that good.  i guess thats really my only complaint, all in all, its pretty cool.
author: Carolyn B.

description: totally cool spot...with peeps & music...for hh but its too crowded on a friday....will definitely pop in every so often...for sho tho, not every friday!
author: Syonora A.

description: totally not my scene, too B&T, but if the people WERE my people, i probably woulda liked this place ok enuf.  the bartenders are great, nice, attentive, the decor is cool, exposed wood beams and brick, a few couches to sit on, nice doorman who told me to "enjoy your evening, suzanne....  it was st. pats day, and not too crowded, which is good cuz this place is SMALL.  they need to fix the lock in the girl's bathroom so i don't have to invite a friend to come with me and watch the door every single time.  and dude, get some new tunes!  they were TERRIBLE!  so HOLY COW, B&T!  we got outta there and went to Lucky 13, thank gawd!  the night was saved!
author: Suzanne A.

description: the bartenders are good and that milky orchid-laden cocktail is tasty. BUT.  this place gives me some serious anxiety. where do i sit/stand? stop staring at me! who are all these dudes? i can't breathe! hey assholes, whaddaya lookin at? oops, sorry, coming through, sorray... let's go to the mission right away!
author: Erica C.

description: I have a whole lotta love for this bar, though I had a bit of a burnout on it from going so often. I was stoked (for lack of a better word) when this surfer-vibey bar-lounge opened a mere block from my work. It initially sort of reminded me of what an SF bar would be like transplanted in Santa Barbara, due to the always-playing surf films on the white wall over the door. Imagine my complete happiness when I strolled in those first few times to discover $2 beers at happy hour (which went until 8!!!). Of course, the HH beer price has gone up to $3 since JC has become more established, but that's still nothing to scoff at. Love the space with the skylights, lofty ceilings, and exposed brick--I'm so bummed they're going to be forced out with the arrival of the new transbay terminal. I only go for happy hour, so I'm not sure what the weekend/late night crowd is like, but it's generally the "after work" biz-casual gathering when I'm there. Nothing special about that. It can get very crowded even by 6 on Thursday evenings, so we always try to go early and snag a booth--definitely the way to go. The owneres (John and Colin, incidentally) are also super rad.
author: Jasmine F.

description: i have to say that i really don't love this place.  maybe because i actually enjoy food when i'm drinking...but don't worry, they offer free pretzels and goldfish.  whoop-di-do!  now i did have to give this place a star because the snacks were free and another star for the decor and ambience (think surfer meets metro), but other than that, there's nothing special about this place for me.  i'd rather go to harlot or zebulon next door.
author: Marjie T.

description: nice place to meet up friends for happy hour in the downtown area. it can get really packed though. the atmosphere is really cool with a brick industrial feeling.
author: Gabe H.

description: john collins is a decent bar to grab a a couple of beers... i say a couple and not a few because when this place gets busy (and it does happen to get quite busy on most nights) the service starts to stall and drinks become less frequent... get there early would be my advice (especially if you have a large party)... h-100...
author: Herb F.

description: so i love this place. i don't get to go too often but i still love it. it seems a little random because its on a little cutty street but inside the brick, big screen, paintings and overall vibe is SICK. sick as in amazingly awesome. you know how all the crews on t.v. have their place, like friends have their coffee bar, i want this place to be "our place." yes, its that good.
author: Sandi V.

description: We walked up on Saturday night and there was no one in front of the building except the security guard. So we said " hello" and handed him our ID's. He looked at all three of us and said, " Um ladies, can you please move over here and come around the rope." I was confused because we were the only people in line and the rope was only 2 x 2 ft in length. Not even casual smokers or any type of other life was in the alley at this time so I didn't get it. I took one step forward, and then three steps to the side and then he said, "welcome can I please see your ID's? It was weird?  I don't know if he was trying to be funny or he was bi-polar or perhaps he had short term memory or maybe he has whatever syndrome Munk has because I don't believe that one normal person would ask us to move four steps.  Awkward greeting put aside John Colin's is a good time. I like what the owners have done with the spot and enjoy the vibe and decor ( especially, the art work ) . Plus, the drinks in my opinion are well served and they always have a movie playing that takes me back as Breakin I did this past weekend. It's definitely a great spot to start your evening off  . . .
author: Jazzelyn F.

description: i went here about a month or so ago and had a fabulous time. it sits down a little alley and doesn't look like a whole lot from the outside; but it's pretty snazzy on the inside. the crowd was a good blend of mostly young people who worked in downtown sf. the music was good, the drinks were fabulous and the people were all very friendly. this is a great spot to meet up with friends or possibly meet new ones! :D
author: Kristin Y.

description: this was one of the last stops on my president's day drinking binge.  i joined nish n and phil m (man, i love dropping yelp names like that...:P) for the zipcar happy hour.  the crowd was a pretty typical soma happy hour group and there was a nice loungey atmosphere to the place.  the staff must have been pretty nice since i was so hammered (been drinking since 9:30am) that i dropped my glass (apparently on phil's foot), but no one gave me a hard time about it!!
author: Roshni R.

description: a nice large space which they use pretty well.  they had some huge paintings of pit bulls and a really interesting one of the peninsula.  on top of that, they were projecting some quality movies on the wall (charlie and the choco factory followed by bullit).  the music was a bit loud for conversation and a bit eclectic which made it hard for me to figure out whether i should be chilling out, breakdancing, or moshing.  but maybe the dj (bartender) was having a bad night.
author: eric g.

description: Great weeknight happy hour bar in the SOMA.... $3 beers until 7 pm!
author: Golden A.

description: this place is NOT a club but they only let girls in and guys have to come in with a girl...BS!i would give this place a 0
author: Erik T.

description: i agree with everyone about the staff.  everyone seemed nice and helpful. we stopped by on a saturday night and it was pretty crowded for a little while and then thinned out to a nice mix. drinks were decent and i even saw the bartender making a mojito without complaining (though which ever prissy princess ordered such a labor intensive drink at a packed bar on saturday night should be smacked. save it for the beach) the djs were pretty good too, although they ignored our request to play outkast.  the little lounge upstairs was nice and cozy. no hot guys to speak of besides the cutey bartenders, but definitely an enjoyable experience.... until 1:30 am when they flicked the lights on, the doorguy started booming at us to get out, and the bathroom line was looooooong.
author: Nicole M.

description: so i guess this is a golden gate law school hangout, just like how the hut was scu law's hangout. anyway, grabbed a drink here on friday and i really liked the atmosphere. the bar had a nice brick wall, was crowded but not so crowded that you couldn't walk anywhere. i ordered a champagne kir and it was good and they even gave me the rest of the champers in the mini-bottle which is pretty cool. defn a place to check out. crowd was pretty mixed, but defn on the younger working professional side.
author: Natalie S.

description: great space, friendly bartenders, super strong drinks.  i had the effen black cheery bomb and it definitely effed me up!  i've only been on tuesday evenings and the scene is mellow, the loungey chairs are comfy and it has a great vibe.  nice place to catch up with friends, though the music is a wee bit loud before 10pm.  can you hear me now?
author: Lija H.

description: i'll make the trek from potrero hills on foot to go down to john colins for a happy hour.  i hosted one last week there for a few girlfriends.  i heard about the place from a friend who knew the one of the owners at butter.  they opened up this joint last year and i haven't gotten a chance to chime in.  it's a great place though my last visit was not as nice after my past.  the music was way too loud and difficult to carry a conversation with my gals from time to time.   drink prices are right and the decor is loungey with fun leather ottoman cubes.  i return to this bar despite the noise factor.
author: Sharlene C.

description: nice place and good selection of drinks.  it was pretty empty for a fri night, but then again, it's probably more a happy hour place, and so many dif clubs have opened up in the area.  we were watching an old school break dancing movie the whole time there, which was pretty funny.  they also played decent old school hip hop.
author: Helen T.

description: i like this happy hour spot.  actually i like this spot as an anytime spot.  the crowd here is always upbeat and hip.  as others mentioned, it can get crowded at the bar at times, but then again, what good bar doesn't get crowded?
author: Jason J.

description: happy hour spot nuff said, go check it out and make your own review about it....  haven't reached the point of feeling I have to puke at the end of the night yet, believe me I will soon.....its a cool spot great on fridays and thursdays of course after work.....
author: marcus o.

description: can get WAY too crowded, but they make up for it in free snack mix.  i do love my snacks!  the bartenders are pretty friendly and the great big movie on the wall gives you something to look at when your friend is running an hour late.  i probably wouldn't spend the whole night here, but it's definitely a good start.
author: jen b.

description: This Cool Spot. I really like the crowd and the staff. Wonderfull space
author: A H.

description: We live in SOMA and are in close walking distance to this hot spot and we absolutely LOVE it!!!!! The exposed brick, interesting art and dimly lit atmosphere makes this our favorite happy hour spot. We love the movies projected on the wall which tends to defer our attention from the conversations we are supposed to be engaged in. The bartenders are laid back and make great drinks. We love that you don't have to pay $12 for a small and clever martini. Drinks are reasonable and they make some interesting concoctions. It attracts the after work crowd and can often get PACKED on a Thursday night. We highly recommend this social watering hole for a Happy Hour gathering. In fact... we will be there tonight cocktailing in the spirit of our favorite hour...
author: Melissa P.

description: uh..the sweet leilani, my drink of choice, it's soooo good, like i'm drinking guava juice. great great concoction. great bar, nice vibes, love the high ceilings, brick walls - wait, they're brick right?
author: Jo Ann A.

description: Tucked away in fabulous little Natoma alley, John Colins offers to people watchers what mexican food places offer for brunch goers - a well known medium offering some spicy dishes and additions.  As a bar it is a pretty pedestrian space - long, narrow, dimly lit with comfortable sofas and great seats at the bar.  As a people watching spot it is FABULOUS - bringing in the after work crowd, SOMA hipsters and even some artists (you know what I mean, people wearing hats - in a good way).  The drinks were strong.  So was the eye candy.
author: Anjali K.

description: Came here after Dada, the space is cool but my drinks weren't that good, maybe I didn't order right, I like how it's kinda hidden (ok not really, more like tucked - Natoma at 2nd)
author: xo x.

description: saw NBA player and former UNC star Jerry Stackhouse here before, other than that, decent place for HH.
author: Pickle R.

description: 5 * because the bartenders and doorman have a sense of humor - it goes a looong way when its crowded.
author: service p.

description: Wow is this place happening or what! Went there last night at 6pm it was packed with a real mix of drinkers. The barstaff are great as are the drinks & the prices. THX yelpers for the intro!
author: dawn w.

description: The space is nice but the bar staff terrible. It took me 20 minutes to get a round in. If it were really busy it'd be understandable, but it wasn't. Slow and incompetent.
author: Ben F.

description: When you want a break from dance clubs or just dress code enforced lounges, this is a place you would enjoy.  They have a casual cool dress code, DJ's and the Bartenders that seem to make the mixed drinks just right.  If you live in the South Beach, SOMA, of near the financial district this is the local spot for you.  Especially on the weekends when it is difficult to catch a cab, John Colins is within walking distance.  I had a friend in town for the Giants game and didn't think we were going out and of course with change of plans didn't have anything to wear. Thank God I knew that they didn't enforce a dress code. On the weekends it can be a bit too crowded  and the music is way to loud that I couldn't really carry on a conversation.  I would understand if it were a dance club but its not- its a Lounge.  A small lounge which is why I didn't understand the "Reserved table."  My group seemed to luck out and found the last available table.
author: Catherine M.

description: this place is hip hangout where you don't have to shout to talk to friends. last time i was there, the bartender john said i was the one millionth customer and gave me a drink on the house. was it mr. john collins himself??
author: kirti p.

description: good place for happy hour. small but i like it small. there are tons of guys here - great for women.
author: Miss O.
